reviews.review:
I can’t imagine why anyone would come to Yosemite and rate it anything lower than a five star. Everything about this place is great, the views are breathtaking and the hiking trails are plentiful. The park rangers are also really cool and super helpful. They are incredibly sweet and knowledgeable about the park. The park itself is also incredibly clean which is great and even the people who come here are respectful of the park.

Just keep in mind if you do come, there is a limited number of bathrooms, water fountains, benches and similar amenities around the park. It is wise to keep a map of Yosemite with you that shows you where everything is. In addition to this, because the park is out in nature, it may be difficult to get internet connection while here. There were times where my friends and I did not have any connection and needed to resort to the map to figure out where to go.

One final note: the trash cans and recycle bins are also posted in certain places around the park. They are not everywhere. Even at our campsite, we did need to walk a bit to find the nearest trash can to throw away our things

Great experience. Highly recommend one trip in your life. From Florida I have been twice. Never regret either trip. Go in mid May through June. Glacier Point a must and of course anything in the valley floor.

What a beautiful day at Yosemite.  What not to enjoy!
I had visited long ago and had forgotten how beautiful this was.  Hiked to Mirror Lake, great hike, not too strenuous and quite fun, mostly in the shade.  Fantastic view and very peaceful.  The mirror effect is a true mirror but one can only see it if you get close to the edge of the water.
You can also walk around the lake and have a spectacular view of your surroundings from the middle of a meadow.  Breathtaking!
Also enjoyed the Curry Village afterwards for food and drinks, not overpriced.  Store has a lot of selection of prepared food and not overly overpriced.
There is an ice cream shop in the village that we missed, we had bought some ice cream bars already from the store.  Lots of souvenirs/clothes/last minute camping gear in there.
Mirror Lake is about 1.5-2 miles from the village.

Only had one day in Yosemite and one of our group of four won the half dome lottery pass, so that’s what we did! Epic, exhilarating and terrifying all at the same time! Highly recommend Yosemite as the sights are indescribable. Looking forward to coming back when we can spend more time to see other trails.

This national park is so big and beautiful with countless trails, campsites, bathrooms, store and waterfalls. waterfalls are full and gorgeous but it all depends what time of the year you go because they do dry out a bit. There is no benches or water along the way so make sure to bring plenty to stay hydrated and some snacks.

Just brilliant despite so much of park trees burnt out some time ago. Easy to get around once you get a parking spot which is probably easier earlier in day. We left at 3pm and still lots if cars lined up to get in.

It’s an hour and a half just to enter the park driving up curvy roads.
Beautiful place best to use the AllTrails app (bad reception).
Remember to check if the miles you’re hiking is going one way or there and back.

Awesome place. We went on a day trip which was not enough to cover the entire place. But it certainly got me curious to come back again.
Huge waterfalls were nice to marvel at. This was in summer. Pretty sure the view in other seasons would be different.

It would need atleast 2 days or better 3 to check it out well.
The best place that i found myself in there. Perfect and peaceful National Park. The road is super cool. It is really good for motorcycle trip too... The Best falls

What an incredible place to explore and experience. Having seen so many pictures and heard so many stories about the beauty of this park, being able to witness this in person was worth the trek. From walking next to the giant Sequoias, to exploring the mountain ranges, embracing the nature of it all…just WOW! What ever you do, when you make a trip to California, please dedicate at least 2 - 3 days to really explore the depths of this National Park. There’s hours of exploring to do and every minute of every hour is worth the beauty of it all!

Yosemite was truly magical.  We could not have asked for better weather.  All the people we encountered were pleasant.  The area was clean, decent food choices in the valley, and the trolley is the way to go!  The trails were well maintained.

The Craters of the Yosemite National Park is an absolute marvel of nature. The breathtaking views of the rugged cliffs, towering waterfalls, and lush greenery make it a paradise for nature enthusiasts and photographers alike.
One of the most useful tips for visitors is to arrive early to beat the crowds and secure the best spots for viewing and photography. Additionally, wearing sturdy hiking shoes and packing plenty of water and snacks is essential for exploring the park's numerous trails safely.
Overall, visiting the Craters of the Yosemite National Park promises an unforgettable experience filled with stunning scenery and outdoor adventure.

Yeah this place is pretty incredible. Top 5 national park easily for all the things you can do and how developed the village inside is.

Loved every day we were there and all the hikes to waterfalls and scenic views. Would recommend looking at Airbnb options inside the park for cheaper options.

Yosemite National Park is one of the most beautiful national parks in USA. Lots of great trails like Vernal & Nevada Falls or Half Done and places to drive to like Glacier Point & Tunnel View! The views simply breathtaking in any direction you look.

A must-visit national park! Everywhere you look has incredible views. The park offers a variety of trails from easy to strenuous, so there is something for everyone. The village store had a lot of souvenirs to choose from. The free shuttle bus system was well organised. Yosemite was our last national park visit after 2 weeks of road tripping to different parks - easily our favourite park! Highly recommend staying inside the park to avoid queues at the entrance stations.

Yosemite National Park is an awe-inspiring destination featuring towering granite cliffs, spectacular waterfalls, and peaceful meadows. Its trails offer incredible hiking experiences, while spots like El Capitan and Half Dome are perfect for photography. Ideal for nature lovers, it's a place where unforgettable memories are made.....

If you're planning to come from the Fresno side, be prepared for a long drive to the Yosemite Valley floor.
I suggest coming from the west side of the park. You have more selection of hotels and restaurants that put you closer to the Yosemite Valley.
Also, if you're from out of state, or not familiar with the mountain roads.. PLEASE, for the love of everyone else's sanity. Use the turnout!

All the hikes are uphill, and you're practically climbing cliffs. I got soaked by several incredibly large waterfalls just by standing at the bottom of them. I wasn't told that I could take the cable car to the top of the mountains until after I left the park.

I came on a day that was a little overcast which made the pictures I took absolutely stunning. The waterfalls were gorgeous and everything was calm while simultaneously bursting with life. Yosemite is a place I will definitely return to!
Very good place for hiking and camping.. make sure you book in advance to enter the park.. Even I saw people climbing the mountain..

Vast mountains, with lush green forests and breathtaking waterfalls, create an awe-inspiring ambiance, reminding you of your humble existence amidst the grandeur of nature. Yosemite National Park evoked such feelings within us.

We had the opportunity to visit one of the most magnificent National Parks in the United States: Yosemite National Park, located in the state of California. Spanning 759,620 acres and managed by the National Park Service, Yosemite was designated a World Heritage Site in 1984. It is internationally renowned for its granite cliffs, majestic waterfalls, crystal-clear streams, towering sequoia groves, pristine lakes, rugged mountains, expansive meadows, ancient glaciers, and rich biological diversity.

We spent an entire day driving and exploring the park, yet it was evident that one day was simply not enough to cover all of its highlights. Yosemite National Park is truly immense, with every corner boasting colossal beauty.

We just wish we had more time, so we could simply sit beneath the trees and gaze at the granite cliffs that seemed to cast a spell on us.

It's no surprise that Yosemite has become one of the most sought-after destinations for travelers from around the world. Our time in Yosemite National Park was simply unforgettable, and we're already eager to return.

The #1 rated national park on most lists for good reason.  Unfortunately there was zero water at the waterfall when I went, but Glacier Point is fantastic and Tioga Pass is a great place to hike and hangout away from crowds as most people hang out in the valley.  Beautiful place!

This park went above my expectations. We had no issues with understanding that park passes were needed, so we got them well in advance. As this is a national park, we did not mind sitting in traffic to wait to enter, and we didn't mind parking far away and walking where we needed to be. I underestimated some hikes but that lead to more interesting days and even better memories

Amazing!  From start to finish!  Yosemite is an expansive park that covers a lot of ground so its a park that you need days for, not hours!  It has varied, diverse sections and each is special in its own right.

In Yosemite you will see the strength of nature's ability to rebuild afyer the devastating effects of fire.  Rebirth is evident everywhere you look.  There are awesome trail systems, the most wonderful waterfalls that you can get right up close to, blooming flowers, and wildlife abound.

The park service has done a good job of preserving the bounty of nature and offering accessibility to people while still meeting the many needs of visitors.  The shuttle system is great when parking is limited.  It takes time but saves miles for tired feet.  The rangers were exceptional at providing good information on appropropriate hikes to meet our wishlist and abilities.

Must sees include:  Glacier Point, Mariposa Grove, Tioga Pass (Olmsted Point and Tenaya Lake), Vernal Falls!  Bridalveil and Yosemite Falls, and Mirror Lake.  There are many secrets to be discovered here...get out...hike, picnic, explore.  Yosemite is a Jewel!  Perhaps our favorite of national parks and we have been to many!
One of the best parks I have ever been to. We did Half Dome in May when cables were down. Perfect weather although there was still snow on the way to Half Dome.

Loved the park! Even when it's busy, there are enough areas you can explore to feel more private. The valley has an one way loop, so if you miss your turn, you'll have to loop around. Luckily, the drive is beautiful! If you're going, be sure to see if you need a reservation to get in the park (they do this to prevent overcrowding); the office site will tell you more. I'd advise downloading or pre-loading whatever you need before going down there—I had little to no service the whole time I was down there, even in the visitor's center.
Some of shuttle system stops were closed, but there were no signs posted or anything on the website to inform me of the closure.  Otherwise, beautiful park which is why I only docked it two stars.

We hiked upper falls. It does require a good level of balance and patience. It’s quite an effort. Personally I wish I had done a little over half of it as most of the sights were in the bottom 60% it was about 22 degrés c when we took the challenge. It was a very bright sunny day and it felt hotter. I would recommend taking lots of water. We had just over 1.2 litres a person but used the life straw to fill the bottles on the way down.

We did see a brown bear with her cub on the way down my partner was very happy. Although this is not guaranteed.

One of the most beautiful places on earth and i would definitely go back. I was part of a group trip on a bus, so only had 5-6 hours in tne park. Tne views are breathtaking. So much to see and inspire - waterfalls, El Capatain, Half-Dome, more waterfalls.

Well worth a visit.

Went here mid week Feb.2024  It was not crowded at all, lots of parking and empty trails. Park rangers were very helpful and employees were friendly. Year pass was only 80.00 and park was very clean. Tried to catch the fire falls at Horse tail falls but only caught a glimpse because of cloud conditions.

It’s Yosemite. How do you capture such beauty in words. Ima let the photos speak and then you simply need to get out there and experience it for yourself. What are you waiting for? Be sure to make your park entry reservations. Peak season they are required. Traffic flow and parking can be tight so be prepared.

If the weather is great, this place is simply magical. El Capitan and Half Dome together with a few waterfalls make this place unforgettable for any visitors. Sometimes climbers can be spotted climbing El Cap - The Dawn Wall. Wild animals like bears, deer and wolves may be spotted. The 4th largest waterfall in terms of height is located here, which also once flooded the grounds in the valley. The number of visitors will be limited now from April 2024, which reduces masses and crowded promoting better views. Some people stay here for a day and some come for a day trip from San Francisco.

Yosemite National Park is in California’s Sierra Nevada mountains. It’s famed for its giant, ancient sequoia trees, and for Tunnel View, the iconic vista of towering Bridalveil Fall and the granite cliffs of El Capitan and Half Dome. Plan on spending two to four days in Yosemite if you want enough time to see all the amazing sights.There are approximately 300 to 500 black bears in Yosemite. Yosemite National Park offers a range of swimming opportunities—from rivers and lakes to our family-friendly pools. Yosemite averages over 4 million visitors a year making it one of the most visited national parks in the United States. With over 800 miles (1,200 kilometers) of hiking trails, world-renowned rock climbing routes, rafting along the Merced River, and countless winter activities, there is something for everyone.
Absolutely stunning!! I've been to many National Parks and I will honestly say that Yosemite is one of the most beautiful places I have ever visited.

The park was so beautiful. Went in early September. The crowds weren’t too bad and the weather was pretty much perfect. Some days a light jacket was needed. Overall it was a wonderful time and a great place to see and observe nature. The night sky is spectacular, and I would highly recommend doing a sky tour. There was a lot of road construction as it is all mountains and one road basically going in and out of some park entrances, keep this in mind as traffic can be bad.

Leave your car at camp and use the free shuttles. Most of the roads are one way and many parts are congested especially by curry village; where most of the popular hikes are around that part of the valley. Bring lots of water and don’t worry as there are restrooms around main areas and near the beginning of the hikes. ENJOY this beautiful place God created for us to see and be in awe of Him! Praise Jesus!

Amazing place, almost looks unreal. I strongly suggest renting a bike, totally better way to get around.
The only this I did not like was when I visited the waterfall we got close to and found Pete's Coffee and Kirklands water bottle left on the ground. I do not know why someone would visit such an amazing place and litter.

Been coming here since 1972 (yep, I'm at least that old). Every time is a new experience. Weather was like early summer. Made hikes to the falls wonderful. And, best of all, none of those INSANE summer crowds.

Yosemite has improved all parking and routes from one park highlight to the next. It’s easier to get around the park with less confusion, considering the many cultures from all over the world who are not familiar with U.S., the traffic flow has improved significantly.

One of the best national parks you go to in the nation. Some many different trails. Animals all over, whether to sight see or be close to. Mountains that are breathtaking. Water falls and fields.Rv spaces to camp at. Words cannot express how amazing this place is. Must visit. Once on a lifetime place.

A lovely park with breathtaking views. Many points of interest with stops, please note that the number of parking spaces is very limited at each such stop. I really liked the episode, an amazing experience and definitely recommended
Stunning views, well planned bus tour, clear instructions from the Staff. We really highly recommend the park 🤩

Yosemite National Park, nestled in California’s Sierra Nevada mountains, is a crown jewel of the American national park system. Renowned for its breathtaking natural beauty, the park offers a diverse range of landscapes, from towering granite cliffs to lush meadows and cascading waterfalls.

One of the park’s most iconic features is El Capitan, a 3,000-foot vertical rock formation that attracts rock climbers from around the world. Equally stunning is Half Dome, a granite crest rising more than 4,700 feet above the valley floor, offering challenging hikes and spectacular views. The park’s waterfalls, including the famous Yosemite Falls and Bridalveil Fall, are especially magnificent in the spring when snowmelt swells their flow.

Yosemite Valley is a must-visit area, where visitors can easily access many of the park’s most famous landmarks. The valley’s meadows, surrounded by towering cliffs and giant sequoias, offer serene spots for picnicking and photography. For those seeking adventure, the park’s extensive trail system provides hiking opportunities for all levels, from easy strolls to strenuous backcountry treks.

The park is also a haven for wildlife enthusiasts, with opportunities to see black bears, deer, and a variety of bird species in their natural habitats. Educational programs and ranger-led tours offer deeper insights into the park’s ecology, geology, and history, enriching the visitor experience.

Yosemite National Park is well-equipped with amenities to enhance your visit. The park offers a range of accommodation options, from rustic campgrounds to the historic Ahwahnee Hotel. Visitor centers provide maps, information, and exhibits about the park’s natural and cultural heritage. Shuttle buses make it easy to navigate the park and reduce traffic congestion, ensuring a more enjoyable and sustainable visit.

Overall, Yosemite National Park is a must-visit destination that showcases some of the most spectacular natural scenery in the world. Whether you’re hiking to the top of Half Dome, exploring the meadows of Yosemite Valley, or simply gazing at the grandeur of El Capitan, Yosemite offers an unforgettable experience that highlights the beauty and majesty of the natural world.
Absolutely stunning place to visit, bit of an effort if you’re based in San Francisco but even so, I very much enjoyed my experience here.

Words cannot describe. If you are thinking of going, don't hesitate, go! These photos were taken in the end of May through to the beginning of June in 2023. This was when the snow melting was at its peak and caused the floods only a few weeks before. I feel the best time to go is around May but it all depends on how much snow is melting to get the best time for the waterfalls.

Like all previous reviews, the park scenery is amazingly beautiful.   The waterfalls, the cliffs, the views are stunning. The other side is how very busy it gets.  People and cars everywhere.   Reservations are now needed on some days.  If you drive yourself, better get there early as parking gets full by lunch time.  Lines to enter the park, full parking lots, lines to eat, lines to shop the stores, lines to use the free in park shuttles. The short hiking trails also get busy.  We took the YART bus from Mariposa  to the park.  No worrying about driving or parking.  Once in, just use internal shuttle system.   Plan ahead.
STUNNING. If you haven’t been, go! The views are breathtaking. Easy hikes, hard hikes, something for everyone.

Beautiful scenery! Levels of hiking for all ages and skills, short and long trails, easy to difficult. And all kinds of accommodations, from camping to very nice lodges! Love all the gift shops, but wonder why most of the gift shop items are made in China or similar?! Use local resources!
Words are lost for this place!! It is just so serene and unbelievable with a beautiful and pleasant atmosphere and great waterfalls it's a must visit in summer.

Incredible experience, prepare yourself for a fairly long hike, I recommend taking several days to be able to explore more of the park. You can also rent bikes and stay over there but it is a little expensive.

The views were truly stunning, and I suggest allocating a few days to fully explore this park. Our day trip wasn't sufficient to appreciate all the beauty. If you're limited to a day, plan for 7-8 hours. Check for reservations during peak seasons. Many spots can be easily accessed by driving or hiking, such as waterfalls and scenic viewpoints.
This place is stunning and has it all, Sequoia trees, amazing views, waterfalls, rock formations, wildlife, just beautiful.
Although I only rode to the east entrance because the park was still closed, the scenery was incredibly beautiful. Can’t wait to actually go in the park.

This is my 4th time here and every time i come here i am in awe of the beauty and magnitude of the park. Each time i came it was different but this time with all the falls having gushing water and green patches it was just phenomenal
Endless trails, beautiful waterfalls and stunning scenery. A must visit if you live in California or are visiting.

There are long lines to get in, but it's worth the wait. Just make sure you purchase your pass before you get there.
Recent rains before we got there had the waterfalls really full and flowing nicely.

Such a breath taking experience every time I come to Yosemite. Many amazing view points with several convenient spots like eateries and restrooms. I was worried if the roads might be icy but it wasn’t icy at all, thanks to the sunny weather during our visit!

Yosemite Park is simply magical. Photos don't do it justice; you have to experience it in person to truly appreciate its beauty. It's a place full of energy that completely recharges you. An experience you can't miss!
One of the most beautiful national parks! Stayed in curry village. The staff was curtious and knowledgeable. Very accessible park. Bring your bike to navigate the park easily!

One of the best destinations ive had on my list for a while and am happy i finally went on it.
I took my car paid my ticket and stopped at every stop on the way to end in the Yosemite village and visitor center.
My only complaint is that the lodging inside the park is very expensive and the bathroom is dirty.

Gorgeous national park, we were here in November and it was stunning to see the leaves and natural beauty. Accessible trails in most areas, some signage is a little confusing but overall great experience!
Yosemite offers the most amazing views. It's a beautiful park, but it gets pretty busy during peak hours and on peak days.

Yosemite does not disappoint. We ended up driving through and getting out to take in views so we could do the park in a few hours. Took the hike to see the Mariposa Grove. I could see spending days here hiking the trails to get closer to the sights.

A blast as usual. Highly recommend the Valley Loop hike which is 12 miles and the Upper Yosemite Falls hike which takes you to the top of the falls. Hopefully we get some good rain/snow like we did this year to really show off the falls.

Yosemite National Park is absolutely breathtaking, with its grand waterfalls and towering cliffs. The sights of Half Dome and El Capitan alone are worth the trip – they offer fantastic opportunities for photography. Whether you're up for a challenging hike, a peaceful moment in nature, or simply want to take in the stunning views, Yosemite has it all. It's a natural playground that's perfect for anyone who loves the outdoors or is looking to capture some stunning scenery. Truly, it's an experience not to be missed and lives up to its reputation splendidly.

This is one of the most brutal and beautiful places Ive visited in my entire life. Breathtaking… if you love outdoors you will love it specially during april - may when the ice starts melting there is a LOT of whater.

Always good times at Yosemite National Park. Go early to beat the crowd (6:00 am). During peak times be sure to follow the visitation requirements. There is so much to do in the park. Trails that lead to waterfalls, snow play areas, camping, sightseeing, and many other awesome attractions. Restrooms are placed in good locations.

Beautiful national park. Visited in middle May when waterfalls are active (worth it!) Hiked Mist Tail (moderate, bring rain jacket if falls are active) & Upper Yosemite (pack more water & snacks than you think you need). Shuttle service is good & reliable. Bring buy spray for mosquitos in evening. Parking was a little busy so give yourself extra time to find a space.

Had a wonderful time in Yosemite. Took a short hike to mirror lake 2 miles round trip. Less people this time a year and i love it because i can hear the beautiful nature sounds. Lots of beautiful fall colors on the drive up. Loved my time there, will be back in the spring.
Amazing place. Breathtakingly beautiful. Nature at its best. Stunning scenery.

I recommend going to yosemite falls for a short quick view of the iconic falls, and then heading over to iconic mist train and doing the longest hike you can handle there.
Vernal falls (pictured) was beautiful. bring a poncho though, it was splashing up quite a lot!
Went to Yosemite for the first time, and it is amazing! The photos alone can’t capture the magnificent beauty! It is a must see.

Yosemite National Park is not just a park; it's an emblem of nature's grandeur, showcasing awe-inspiring vistas, towering cliffs, ancient giant sequoias, and breathtaking waterfalls. It stands out as one of the most majestic natural wonders in the United States, if not the world.

Pros:

Scenic Beauty: Yosemite offers iconic views like El Capitan and Half Dome that are unmatched in their majesty.
Diverse Activities: Whether you’re into hiking, rock climbing, photography, or simply enjoying nature, Yosemite has something for everyone.
Well-Maintained Facilities: The park is well-maintained with clean restrooms, informative visitor centers, and well-marked trails.
Educational Programs: Ranger-led tours and educational programs are available, enhancing visitor understanding of the park’s natural and cultural history.
Cons:

Crowding: Popular spots can get crowded, especially during peak tourist seasons (spring and summer), which can detract from the serenity.
Accommodation Costs: Lodging within the park and nearby can be pricey and books up fast, planning well in advance is recommended.
Experience:
Visiting Yosemite is like stepping into a vast painting. From the moment you enter, the landscape captivates with its raw beauty. The park’s highlights like Yosemite Falls—the tallest waterfall in North America—and the serene beauty of the Merced River running through Yosemite Valley, are sights that photos can hardly do justice.

Trails range from easy walks like the one to Mirror Lake, which reflects a stunning image of Half Dome, to more challenging hikes like the ascent to the Upper Yosemite Falls or the infamous Half Dome trek (permit required). The park staff are knowledgeable and genuinely enthusiastic about preserving and sharing the beauty of Yosemite.

Final Thoughts:
Yosemite National Park is a treasure trove of natural beauty that offers a profound reminder of the wonders our planet holds. It's a place that can be visited repeatedly, with each visit revealing new aspects and sensations. Whether you're a seasoned outdoor enthusiast or a family looking for a memorable vacation, Yosemite delivers an experience that is both invigorating and grounding. Don’t miss the chance to witness its beauty firsthand—a true bucket list destination.

Stunning park. Huge and beautiful. Went in October and the weather was beautiful and seeing the colors change was lovely.

The valley where the food is was super packed and barely a spot to park from afternoon to evening, so take the shuttle if you can.

The shuttles are free and take you around, drivers are usually good about telling you what is at each stop.

Overall it’s a stunning place to be and the rangers are super lovely.

One of the best national park I have visited till now….This national park looks amazing in most of the seasons but winter is the best time to visit…..
If you are planning to visit in winter make sure you carry tire chains and also call park services to know more regarding weather conditions…..
Places like Yosemite fall, mirror lake n wedding chapel looks amazing during winter months

Wonderful! You can park at Yosemite village parking lot and the start hiking to vista dome, there are two roads, if you go to the left there are a few steps to arrive at the lake but the view it’s fantastic. Also there are free shuttle buses
Beautiful and stunning geology.  We hiked to huge sequoia trees.  We drove to El Capitan and two amazing waterfalls.

Without a doubt the most beautiful place I’ve ever seen in my life. Every corner of it is majestic, grandiose, and awe-inspiring. You should take 2 days to fully soak it in. Make sure to visit Glacier Point for the best views.

Unfortunately the bathrooms are extremely dirty at every location in the park.... the fact that they charge so much and yet don't care to keep their bathrooms clean is just not acceptable. There are no signs whatsoever as you drive towards the falls or back to let you know how many miles you still need to go. People were fighting over parking spots as soon as you would drive through the tunnel due to illegal turns and cutting each other off to get a spot and no rangers were in sight to guide or direct or assist people with these issues. All they care about is just making money and that's it. Their website is terrible because it doesn't even release the dates for reservations when it's supposed to be released. Overall we wish that they would and should care about the safety of their visitors and not just care about the money.
Absolutely amazing, even on an overcast day. If you get the chance to go, take it. I'd write a longer review, but I really don't have the words. Nature really is amazing.

Yosemite National Park is an amazing place to visit. The park is huge but the most popular area is of course The Yosemite Valley and it has to be one of the most stunning places to visit in California. This can get very busy at weekends or holidays so avoid those times if possible. Its not an easy part to get out on your own and away from the crowds but is still worth visiting for hiking or sight seeing. Everything in the valley is well sign posted including the best view points of the sights and the trail head.

Four Mile Trail and Upper Yosemite Falls trail are well worth the effort. They are fairly strenuous so food, water and outdoor clothing should be carried. Upper Yosemite Falls trail is usually accessible all winter due to the fact the sun shines on it for most of the day. Four Mile is the opposite and is usually open upto the snow line until the thaw.

Hetch Hetchy is a must and I would recommend the Wapama and Rancheria waterfalls trail. This area is less busy than the valley but can still see large crowds in the summer and holidays. Like always venture more than 100 metres from the car and the crowds soon start to disperse.

Toulumne and Merced Redwood groves are worth the short hike. They are less busy than Mariposa Grove as they see less coach groups there.

March is a nice time of year if you can avoid the final winter storms. The storms can cause the roads to temporarily close or have tyre chain requirements. A 4x4 is nice for confidence at this time of year but not essential.

The NPS App is excellent for Yosemite and all you need to know is available there. Also arriving before 0900 at the park entrances is good for beating ques.

I photograph many weddings and elopements in Yosemite National Park and it's one of my favorite locations. From tunnel view to the upper glacier point road overlooking half-dome and the waterfalls, it's a must see for everyone. It's also a great place to get married or elope!
Wow!. It was my first time to yosemite and it did not disappoint. I'll definitely be going back to explore some more as the park has a lot to offer.

Very crowded at Yosemite Village and Valley, but there is much more to the Park than that.
Avoid weekends and Holidays if possible.
Best to visit on Tuesday-Thursday.

Beautiful place😍
Seasonal beauty differs

Reservations required for long week ends ..check the website

Entry fee required
Children ✅
Elders✅
Multiple stay options-
Campsite✅
Heated Tents on chargeable basis available ✅
Food with limited options✅
Souvenir +mountain gear shops✅
Early March turned out a picture perfect day for us; lots of sunshine yet still some snow cover that made for great shots.

Yosemite National Park is a breathtaking marvel, boasting iconic landmarks like El Capitan and Half Dome. The sheer granite cliffs, pristine waterfalls, and diverse ecosystems create a haven for nature enthusiasts. The park's hiking trails offer stunning vistas, and Yosemite Valley's meadows provide a serene escape. While the crowds can be overwhelming, especially during peak seasons, the awe-inspiring beauty of Yosemite makes it a must-visit destination for anyone seeking a communion with nature.

My friend and I embarked on a scenic drive from the Bay Area to Yosemite, taking roughly 3.5 hours. Upon reaching the park entrance, expect an additional 30-45 minutes to reach the valley. Visiting in winter, the recent snowfall enhanced the experience with flowing water and melting snow. We explored Yosemite Falls, a 7.46-mile hike from the parking lot. Parking can be challenging, so arriving early is advisable. The diverse trails offer various sites, and despite the season, the environmental charm varies. Yosemite is truly a gem with options for dining, coffee, and beer. Consider making it an all-day trip; it's worth the journey.

Mesmerizing, out of this world and total amazement. To fully experience Yosemite, it’s all about the trails. An incredible National Park. Year round, it offers different views with heavy waterfalls during spring and lovely snow during winter. You get to see some very unique rock formations.
We were incredibly lucky to come across the Horsetail Fall during our first trip to Yosemite. Despite searching for parking for two hours, we finally witnessed this amazing sight from our car.
Absolutely amazing. We spent about 6 hours in Yosemite National Park. We did as much walking as possible and got some amazing views and scenery into our tight schedule. I loved every minute here.
I went for a camping in housekeeping camp in Yosemite National Park. I enjoyed a lot where I hike in various waterfalls like mirror lake, Mist Trail, Vernal Falls, Bridalveil Falls.

Hard to believe that everyone does not already know this is one of the most beautiful places on earth.
Incredible hikes, amazing waterfalls, tons of space and trails and rocks to enjoy.
We visited in December, staying in Oakhurst. It took about 90 minutes to drive into Yosemite Valley, so if you want more time in the park it is probably worth considering a stay in the lodge.
The store at the Visitor centre is brilliant - packed full of healthy and unhealthy snacks, ready meals that are easy to cook when camping and a fab range of drinks.

The pictures I took still amaze me because they look fake and I know I was there in real life! I can not even describe how this place makes you feel! There is so much to take in! A part of me was overwhelmed! I will say this the next time I go I will spend the night or a couple of nights to take all of the scenery in. It too much to take in on a tour or maybe I just want to explore at my own pace now that I know where I want to explore. Seeing the Redwoods and Sequoia trees along with the breathtaking boulders is something you will forever remember! It’s so humbling to know this scenery has been here for thousands of years and will continue to be here thousands of years, but regardless of how many years have passed will never stop amazing generations after generations.
A very beautiful place. Breathtaking views all around.  You will feel tiny amongst all these Giants waterfall trees, and rocks. Even got to see a bear.

Such an amazing experience! I would say going in late June/early July is the best since its the perfect weather. If you go with a tour guide, you can stop to get the best views and explore the park. The lakes, trees, and atmosphere was very refreshing. The walk to see the giant sequoia trees and the waterfalls are a must!

Stay inside the valley, it's very far anywhere outside!!!

🔥 Ignite your sense of wonder at Yosemite National Park's legendary Firefall event in February! 🏞️ Nestled in valley floor, embrace nature's grandeur as the waterfall transforms into a cascade of fiery hues against the winter sky. ❄️ Amidst snow-capped peaks, witness the magic of nature's own pyrotechnic display. 🌟 Don't miss this surreal experience that will set your soul ablaze with wonder! #YosemiteFirefall 🌲✨

Truly breathtaking! I can’t wait to go back. It’s incredible and there’s so much to explore. We got there early so we had good luck with parking but if you come later prepare to utilize the shuttles. We went in July so it was hot! Bring extra water, a poncho, and some walking sticks. Make sure your shoes have good grip as well. Surrounded by granite stone, impossibly tall waterfalls, valleys and vistas, it was a great bucket list item to cross off. The day before we did Hetch Hetchy Reservoir, which I also recommend! Less foot traffic there. We hiked the Mist Trail and the John Muir trail. When we started there weren’t too many people but by the time we were done it was busy. Amazing experience overall. We hiked about 9 miles total that day.

Yosemite National Park is like a painting depicting the most breathtaking nature. The air is filled with the scent of flowers and freshness, while the sounds of waterfalls create amazing melodies. The stunning cliffs may seem inaccessible, but their beauty irresistibly lures and inspires for great adventures.

And of course, in this heavenly place, there is a museum that is delightfully rich in history and exhibits. It's like a window to the park's past, narrating its evolution and the importance of nature preservation. Incredible artifacts and interactive displays immerse visitors into Yosemite's marvelous world, unveiling its unique characteristics and captivating features.
Great park with great views. El captain is impressive. It’s also interesting to observe the effects of wildfires there… during fall / winter be careful with the icy roads.
Probably one of the most beautiful places I’ve ever had the pleasure of visiting! Largely untouched by human civilization, this place has had its natural glow for thousands of years now!

This park is beautiful and mind blowing. We went around january and it was veryyyyy cold so pls wear a snow jacket and pants. Also all the shops and markets were closed so bring your own food!! But dont leave it where the bears might eat it!! I recommend to arrive early before 9am to actually be able to park and hike/walk. The trails can be slippery and wet so bring walking sticks.

I recommend going in the off-season if you can handle the cold and icy/snowy roads. This park will leave you in awe, there's so much to see and it's all incredibly beautiful.
Keep in mind if you do come in Dec, highway 120 is closed in certain parts, alone with many other roads that go through the park...the plus side is there's no waiting to get in and there's hardly any other campers.
Bring lots of warm clothes and prepare for emergency situations.

Had a great time here.  Visited from the South Gate on March 27th.  Driving in was a marvelous journey.  Better to be a passenger, for all the lovely views you take in, on the drive in.
We stopped at Mariposa Garden.  Hiked to the halfway down the road.  Unfortunately, the road was not open to driving.  It was a beautiful day, but not quite April.  Which is when I believe the park is fully open.
Amazing pictures and time basking in the mist of the Bridesvail Fall.
The Valley was full of entertainment and interesting displays.  The museum and theatre make you feel like you need to dedicate a day just to The Village.
Whole family loved it.
It's a wonderful park with amazing views. Don't overlook the river that runs through the valley.

We love Yosemite in the fall! We hiked Mirror Lake because it was short enough for the kids! The falls were beautiful too and we wished we had enough time to do those as well. This is at least a two day trip if you want to enjoy the many beautiful wonders of the park.

Yosemite National Park is a nature lover's paradise! 🏞️ From towering granite cliffs to cascading waterfalls and lush meadows, the beauty is unparalleled. 🌲✨

Our visit was awe-inspiring – the iconic Yosemite Valley and Half Dome are simply breathtaking. The well-maintained trails provided opportunities for all levels of hikers, offering spectacular views at every turn. 🚶‍♂️🌄

The diversity of ecosystems, from ancient sequoias to alpine peaks, is remarkable. The park's commitment to preservation is evident, creating an immersive and enriching experience. 🌳💧

We marveled at Bridalveil Fall, El Capitan, and the serene Mirror Lake. The wildlife sightings added an extra layer of magic to our trip. The park's infrastructure and staff were excellent, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable visit.

Yosemite National Park is a true gem, offering a profound connection with nature. Whether you're an avid adventurer or a family seeking a memorable getaway, Yosemite should be at the top of your list. 🌍🌿 Highly recommend this natural wonder! 👍

I was only able to spend half a day in the park but I definitely made the most of it. I recommend for any runner to do the four mile trail. It's a consistent grade though it is steep. Take it to the top for epic views the whole way. If you go panorama then John Muir trail they take you past the Illiouette and Nevada Falls which are incredible (careful near the edge, especially in winter with the black ice about). Epic to see sunrise in Yosemite Valley!

There is absolutely no way to truly express the absolute majesty of this place! It is breathtakingly gorgeous and worth every bit of effort that it may take for you to visit. We did our visit through Extranomical Tour Company and it was worth every single penny. The tour guide/bus driver was extremely informative during the entire 15 hour round trip visit from San Francisco. They had plenty of built in rest stops and plenty of time to explore on your own within the park at each location too. I don't feel that the experience would have been quite as full and complete if we would have just driven it on our own. If you are thinking about taking this trip, don't hesitate! Make this happen! You won't regret it!

Yosemite is one of the place places in the country to visit we went in November and there was no crowds and plenty to do.
But the water falls were extremely low so we went again in April when the snow packs started melting and wow what a difference still no crowds but the water falls were epic
Do everything you can to time your trip when the falls are running high

Yosemite holds a special place in my heart, its surreal ambiance offers unique thrills in every season. From majestic waterfalls to towering granite cliffs, Yosemite’s beauty captivates visitors year-round. Must visit destination for nature lovers and adventure seekers alike.
This was a last minute camping trip my cousins and I took and we loved it.
I have been to Yosemite in Summer and wanter to visit in winter. It was a wonderful trip, one never can get tired of being in Yosemite. I would visit this park everytime I am in California.

Stunning and expansive national park with network of counterclockwise roads and shuttles enabling access to the many hikes and attractions in the area. I can see why folks spend entire weeks here, especially in the summer if you climb and hike.

One of my favorite places on earth.
Can get very crowded during the busy season, but I prefer to visit the higher elevations or off season when there is snow on the ground. Truly beautiful.
What else can we say about this place? It is a craft from the nature. Very pretty and refreshing. It is worth to go there!!!!

Beautiful place !
But plan to go for more than one day there is so much to see and as well you are paying a $35 fee entry for one day or all week price is the same

Absolutely gorgeous! I was stationed at Castle AFB in the 1980s and this was a couple of hours down the road from us. The views are absolutely breathtaking! In 2012 I drove completely through the park to Lake Tahoe on the other side. Everyone knows El Capitan and Half Dome but few venture deeper into the park. The views throughout are quite stunning! If I ever make it back out to the West Coast, this will definitely be on the list of places to go back to!
A beautiful valley, tallest falls, nice view's of nature.Very enjoyable spot.l love this spot 😍

Oh Yosemite oh Yosemite what a national park you are was only able to see you for one full day but I think that was enough we got there during February 20th two days before the Horsetail Falls turned into firefalls on the 20th of February it was a rainy snowy cloudy day but supposedly two days later they saw the Firefall we got to see upper Yosemite Falls lower Yosemite Falls bridal veil Falls and height to Mirror Lake incredible I repeat incredible if you are wondering if you should visit this place I myself am telling you to go now not later not next week not next month not next year go now this place is exceptionally beautiful this is why it is the top three national parks in America beautiful I will be back I promise

Yosemite National Park is an absolute gem of the American wilderness. From towering granite cliffs to cascading waterfalls and lush meadows, it's a paradise for nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts alike. Hiking trails offer breathtaking views of iconic landmarks like Half Dome and El Capitan, while the serene beauty of Yosemite Valley never fails to captivate. Camping under the starlit sky amidst the scent of pine trees is an experience like no other. Whether you're a seasoned adventurer or a casual visitor, Yosemite's awe-inspiring landscapes will leave you in awe and longing to return again and again.
The most magical National Park. If you visit in April you’ll see incredible waterfalls, but some of the park will still be shut for winter. There’s something to see all year round
Yosemite … it’s a dream place to spend time here. The best hiking spot ever… I would go visit there every year…

This was an incredible place to visit. We went after a difficult winter, much of the northern part of the park was still closed due to snow. What we did see was amazing. Everywhere you turned it was just beautiful to behold. We’re looking forward to when we can return and visit the rest of the park.
Breathtaking fall colors! The water falls were flowing  peacefully! Every snapshot was satisfying! It was cold in the village however the overflowing beauty of that park warmed our hearts!

Spectacular views and adventures! One of my favorite national parks thus far! Highly recommend hiking shoes. I hiked in Nike ACG Lowcate. This style is designed for the Pacific Northwest terrain. I broke them in before taking them on the trip and noticed a big difference. Happy Hiking😄
Must visit, regardless of whether you love hiking or not.  A calm and magnificent National Park. Will definitely visit again.

This place is amazing in so many ways. The views are so breathtaking and so many restrooms along the drive so convenient. The ice cold streams are a great way to cool off on a hot day. Will definitely be visiting this place again and going on a lot of hiking trails.
An absolutely gorgeous amazing place to be. We tend to go during winter because I'm not into the summer heat. So pack a lunch and some snifle gear and get out and enjoy some nature!

Awesome time hiking and taking free shuttle
Also great food
One of the most beautiful national parks in USA. Many amazing view, sometimes you can think, that it's a 3D picture. Also many good trails. During summer is super busy near main locations.

One of the most known parks in the USA. But should be avoided on weekends. It was very crowded and it took me around 40 minutes to get a parking space. This is not very environment friendly. Next visit I know it. The park is huge and a lot to see. I spent there 1 day, which is a good time to relax also a bit. There are also shuttle buses, if you have to park too far away. Facillities for food and rest rooms are available.
I can recommand the hiking path along the river and the yosemite falls. The halfdome I saw from far, but for a photo is was ok.

Totally makes sense why the place is so popular, really all types of activities here swimming hiking waterfalls animals it's all here. The lower falls trail is particularly shaded and good for kids even with stroller. Take about 2 days at least to see it. The valley is great place, use the shuttle but plan out your stops a bit to avoid having to double back too much.

We visited Yosemite while staying in San Fran and did a day trip through Viator tours.  Yosemite is absolutely breathtaking.  The drive in and out is hair raising at best with narrow windy curves and steep cliffs, but it is all worth it!

An absolutely amazing experience. A place filled with beautiful mountains and some of the world's oldest and tallest trees. It captures your imagination and there are so many options for activities and trails for all capabilities. The shuttle system is the best way to move throughout the park but can be slow and sometimes can be full requiring you to use the next shuttle. Parking is also extremely difficult to find unless you arrive early in the morning.
He's such a beautiful place to go I love the mountains of water clean air

Go in winter! Less cars, people, only two of us on the tour bus! Super personal service and history from Will Fontana. Take the road to Mirror Lake, excellent hike eat at Dugnan’s Deli. Check weather!

Came for the firefall and luckily we made it on a Friday where we didn't need a reservation. We tried for Saturday and Sunday as well and followed the directions. Logged in at 8am 2 days prior and no luck. The reservations go quickly. The park itself is incredible and the trails were in good condition. Very few rangers throughout and we were not checked for a pass on the way in or out. The south gate was unmanned when we arrived and departed. I've never seen this at any other national park.

Simply amazing. Ive been all over the Sierra Nevada's, but this place is just different.. Breathtaking sights everywhere you turn. It is one of the most beautiful places on this planet. It's a madhouse on the weekend in summertime, plan accordingly.

My family and I had the best experience at Yosemite! We went in December and we were so grateful it didn't rain and that it was in the low 50s. We went on a day tour and got to see many different angles of El Capitan and also saw some pretty waterfalls.
Amazing views with easy hikes with children. The rangers were very friendly. Enjoyed filling lunch at Degnan Kitchen!! Will definitely be back.
It was beautiful! I suggest going off season. The park was not crowded at all.

Just an amazing place to see!!! In person is an awesome experience! Anyome that has the time or around do not miss the oportunity. The tunnel is amazing, right after you have a parking spot with amazing views and pictures. Many trails to choose from, parking depending on the day could be hard to find depending on the day but just keep looking and make your way up to any of the waterfalls. There are many different hikes for all different levels. We took an easy one at the bottom of the lower falls and it was amazing and easy hike.

The Yosemite national park is really huge and amazingly beautiful. There are many trails that can satisfy everyone.
Of course, it's one of the highlights of any US trip and I would highly recommend it, although in the summer it can be very crowded. I would suggest to sleep just outside the park and be ready to start a trail before 8am.

OH MY! What a beautiful park! Yosemite is majestic with its granite cliffs, jaw dropping vistas, valleys, waterfalls. The place reminds me of God's wonderful creation. It is beautiful year around. For those not into hiking there are so many beautiful spots that you can drive to in addition to the plethora of hiking trails. I am a sucker for sunsets and the sunsets here are phenomenal. Parking can be a bit challenging due to the crowds so would advise getting to the park early. There are restaurants in the park where you can grab a snack/lunch. We grabbed burger and tenders from the grill at the village and it was delicious. Yosemite is HOME and this place will always be close to my heart! ❤️

Absolutely beautiful,  serene,  wildlife is huge. I was amazed at how handicap friendly this park is. There are clean bathrooms all over the park. They have a great mix of challenging and easy hikes. The boardwalks allow easy access to main attractions.
A must see when visiting California. February was a great time of year due to no crowds and some snow still around.
Surely bucket list worthy! Incredible views all around. A hiker's paradise.

Breathtaking! We drove in from Mariposa and started with Glacier Point as the farthest point before working our way down to the valley. We had lunch there and did a couple of easy walks before driving back. Crowds can be big and this is fall, not peak season.

The pictures don't do it justice as this really is a sight to behold. Looking forward to returning 🪨🌲🐿️💧

A gorgeous and stupendous part of the US that every American citizen should have the right and ability to see once their life.

There was a great variety of locations to visit, though Yosemite valley obviously takes the cake. It is a decently large park and takes 40 min to get to pretty much anywhere you really want to get to. Going around the valley is easy and the roads were not crowded or difficult to navigate when I went. There are mountains, waterfalls, lakes, rivers and even a grove of Sequoia trees.

Might have to grow out my mustache and start carrying my two sidearms because I'm a real Yosemite Sam after my visit!

Pulling up to this park never gets old. The giant rock faces, the beautiful tall trees, and the overall atmosphere are wonderful. It seems like everyone who is walking around the park is just so happy to be there and the vibes are great all around.

Lots of opportunity to just walk and enjoy the sun, breeze and sceneries. If you dont want to hassle moving your car from one parking area to another, shuttle buses are available. One beautiful park that the whole family can enjoy.

Nothing short of amazing. It's a long drive to get to the valley, but the second you turn the corner and see El Capitan and Half Dome, it's like going into Disneyland. Definitely my favorite national  parks I've been to, and so worth the trip. 100 percent climbing Half Dome next time we come. AND THE WATERFALLS ARE INSANE!!!

One of the most beautiful places I've ever seen in my, absolutely breathtaking. The waterfalls, mountains and trees are so beautiful and an awesome place to hike and camp as well. One must see at least once in their lifetime if possible . I would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Yosemite National Park is my favorite national park thus far. It is absolutely breathtaking. I will truly never forget driving through the tunnel and seeing Tunnel View for the first time. What a sight. I was mesmerized. I hope everyone gets to see this at least once.

I would definitely check road conditions prior to your trip! A lot of routes and hikes I wanted to do were closed due to excessive snow this season. I went in May 2023 and it was still heavily flooded in some areas. Absolutely still worth the trip. I cannot wait to go back!

How can I put these in words. That John Muir hasn't said it yet “But no temple made with hands can compare with Yosemite. Every rock in its wall seems to glow with life.”

By the grandest of all the special temples of nature I was ever permitted to enter.

Those are some of his words that were inspired by the splendor, beauty, and majestic landscapes of Yosemite. For me is Nature's Cathedral.. ¡. I was in state of owe... I been to other National parks. But Yosemite took my breath away... When you see it for the first time. When you finally are able to take a glance at this magnificent valley, working your way out of the tunnel... Is just breathtaking... Sublime... Just by being able to stand right there... You feel you're in paradise.... Tunnel view. Glacier point sentinel bridge. Mariposa Grove... To not only learned, but to contemplate with your own eyes the fall foliage. To feel the crispy air. To inhale the pure air. To see and feel the mist of the water falls. To drive the gorgeous, winding, and scenic routes. Is just not only an amazing experience. But a privilege the mother nature has allow you to live and enjoy... It is undoubtedly a beautiful place. However, public transit and a connecting train to the various campsites would be amazing. We went on a hike, we had to drive to the location and despite it being near the end of season, parking was near impossible to find. Got fined 300$ for parking somewhere we shouldn't have. Completely our own fault. But something to consider.

I had an amazing time visiting this incredible National Park as it is easy to see how this is people’s favorite national park! Lots of great trails and places to drive to like Glacier Point & Tunnel View! Highly recommend visiting very early in the day and on a weekday as the crowds here can be too much when visiting! Take a few days to explore this park if possible!
Gorgeous Place; all the trails and climbing routes are amazing.
Amazing views. Already want to go back. Went during off-season and didn't have to deal with crowds. One drawback was that some on-site food places were closed.
Se one time visiting and still so beautiful. This place is a definite must see, add it to your bucket list.
Incredibly beautiful. Still closed for some winter conditions in May and I didn’t know about the reservation system but we’ll get it together for next time!

Yosemite and the Sierra Nevada Mountain Range  is absolutely the most magnificient, breathtaking place on earth. The Grand Tetons are in the conversation for being the most magnificient, breath taking and beautiful place on earth.  The Ansel Adems Wilderness could also maybe be just as magnificient, breathtaking and beautiful but it is located right next to Yosemite and is within the Sierras.  It does get crowded here which is I like to backpack outside of Yosemite Valley in the late spring and summer.

Amazing national park, a must see if you're in California! The park was extremely crowded when I went in late June though, so I recommend going in early, like 7 or 8 AM to get the most serene and quiet views.

FIREFALL 2024! I could write about how amazing Yosemite National Park is, but that's been said enough. This is specifically about the sunset phenomenon that happens for 2 weeks every February, known as Firefall. It is increasingly rare, as there hasn't been enough snowpack for Horsetail Fall to flow in recent years. Usually when it is seen, the Firefall is a reflection of a direct sunset, causing a yellow and orange glow on the fall. When I took this photo, 2/13/24, the direct sunset was blocked as thick, low clouds had just moved in. However, there was a cluster of high cirrus clouds, at just the right angle to direct a bright pink light on Horsetail, creating a rare "Pink Champagne Fall," and I recommend anyone who is able to try and see Firefall one day! Yosemite is one of the few National Parks I would say is equally enjoyable in any season!

Yosemite National Park is an amazing place in so many ways! Lots of great trails like Vernal & Nevada Falls or Half Done and places to drive to like Glacier Point & Tunnel View! The views simply breathtaking in any direction you look.
In my opinion it’s one of the most beautiful national parks in USA. It can be very crowded in the summer. I would suggest to start hiking in the morning before 8am if possible to get the most serene and quiet views.
Highly recommend for nature enthusiasts.

My recent visit was in winter. The park is surprisingly active even in the winter. Busses were running and I stayed in the campground. Never heard a peep out of anyone over three days / two nights. A fave photography location!

- Jason Fazio Photography

Beautiful views, small and big hikes. Lots of rock climbers. The food is expensive at the food court and my chicken was dry as can be. Should have went to the village food market as they had everything.
Who doesn’t love Yosemite National Park filled with abundant beauty and natural wild life. I come here every year and have stayed inside and outside of the park
Love to hike here. Camp here. Lodge outside if taking one of our dogs or all of them. Love to kayak here. Picnic here. Breathe the air and escape into forrest therapy. Heaven on earth. Drop the mic.

November 2023. 3 days in the park.

Unbelievable. This place is right up there with Yellowstone & Zion. Tunnel View is a must. From there we went down into the Valley and did hikes around & to places such as Bridalveil Falls, El Capitan, Yosemite Falls, Mirror Lake, Half Dome, Yosemite Valley Lodge and Mariposa Grove.

South Entrance give immediate access to Mariposa Grove and is a windy 45 minute drive to the dramatic entrance that is Tunnel View, above Yosemite Valley. From there you can drive down into the valley and begin a series of one-way roads connected by loops throughout. Don't worry if you make a wrong turn...it's never significantly far to loop back around and the scenery makes up for it. Shuttle helps if you want to park and just ride along to whatever stops you choose: there are 18 or 19 shuttle stops, well marked on the map. Yosemite is pristine; absolutley gorgeous. Wildlife all over. We will definitely be back, and could easily spend a week or more here hiking and camping deeper into the park on lesser frequented trails & areas.

Beautiful park, very well structured to guarantee access for everyone for many attractions. Very high and gorgeous valley,  mountains and waterfalls.
My suggestion however would be having signs throughout the trails since it gets very difficult to understand the distance to get to some places in the trail and even to understand that you have reached certain point or not (ie. Columbia spot)
A place of natural beauty unlike any other. Trails, waterfalls, streams, skiing, (Dec 15 onwards) and epic views mashAllah. One of my favorite places to be.

Absolutely incredible park! So much to do and see from mountains, waterfalls, rivers & meadows. Good shuttle service around but very busy often with waits due to full shuttles. Parking fills up most places by around 9 so best to come early. Sunrise at tunnel view was beautiful and visiting glacier point is a must!

Spectacular! Awe, inspiring! Locals told us it hadn't been like this in over 30 years, but with all the snow and rain, the waterfalls and rivers were amazing.  We got there before 8am and had no trouble with parking or crowds. Some areas are closed, but there is so much to see we just went to a different area. What a national treasure. Go! Go! If you can.

This park was absolutely beautiful. We camped at upper pines and it was the perfect balance of enough camping space, flushing potties, and running water taps. There was plenty of places to take young kids on beautiful walks and enough room for them to play in our campsite without bothering neighbors.

This is another beautiful place one has to witness in our lifetime. There are countless trails to hike, cabins to stay in, places to camp, this place is beautiful. A place where you and your family can come and explore. If you are the type that's a lone wolf or traveling with two or four legged friends this park is a wonder to experience.
One of my Fav National Park .. Weather is good, complete facilities :))

The most terrifyingly beautiful place I have ever seen in my life. I was awestruck and speechless. It is a marvelous sight to behold even if you aren't an avid hiker. Plenty of paved walking paths, and most is handicap accessible. Love it!
Simply amazing. We went in October and got to see everything - the greenery, mountains, lakes, rain, a rainbow and even snow.

We came to hike Four Mile Trail from the valley floor to Glacier Point. That whole route allowed us to see most of the valley as we climbed. And it's simply stunning.

Wherever you look there's evidence of how amazing nature can be. From the sheer face of El Capitan, to the beautiful greenery along the valley floor.

There are free shuttle buses around the valley, although we didn't use them. There's normally a (paid) bus to and from Glacier Point but this isn't running during 2023.

The view as you enter the park through the tunnel is stunning. As you drive into the tunnel everything feels close and dark. As you emerge it's suddenly filled with bright light and expansive views. It's one of the most amazing moments.

We went at the beginning of October. There was ample parking. And the food court wasn't overly busy. At the end of our 9 mile hike we dropped into the Starbucks for hot chocolates and that did have a long wait.

Didn't see any bears sadly.

One of the bests National Parks you could visit. We went to the Yosemite village with the kids and love how stroller friendly the location is.. you can take picture pretty much everywhere.. its majestic.. would love to camp one day

Yosemite was amazingly beautiful like always! We visited on Labor Day weekend and even on a rainy day it was still very crowded. It would be nice to have the reservations back in place. Because of the clouds Yosemite showed us a more mystical face, it was enchanting!
Such a breath taking experience.Many amazing view points with several convenient spots . The weather was good for us. We will definitely come back here.

One of the great National Parks of the United States, Yosemite will awe you with its incredible glacial valley and delicate ecosystem. Seeing thousands of feet of granite vertically sheared will give you a new perspective as you contemplate the magnitude and force of glacial erosion, and the scale of geologic time, prequired to create the practically vertical walls of Half Dome and El Captain. Say nothing of the incredible climbing talent required to scale those vertical walls, or the amazing ecosystem that has managed to find a foothold up the cliffs.

There are as many options for lodging in Yosemite as there are ways to explore the park, from tent camping, to heated tent cabins, to the Yosemite Lodge, and the 4-Star historic Ahwahnee Hotel. The earlier you plan your trip, (up to a year in advance) the more options you will have. Summer is very busy, and can be hot, while fall is a very nice time to visit with cooler temperatures. Winter and spring can find the valley coated in snow, and the high sierra access road and pass will be closed.

Food options range as well, from pizza in curry village, to the Mountain House in Yosemite village to the majestic dining room at the Ahwahnee. Reservations for dinning are suggested.

Hikes in Yosemite valley can be difficult, due to the steep canyon walls. Yosemite falls is quite strenuous, and the half dome hike is over 4000ft of vertical climb. The final cables to the dome itself require a permit. The valley floor offers a nice flat loop and a very pleasant bike trail.

For the more adventurous, the high sierra wilderness offers an escape from civilization. Backcountry permits are required and there are huts that can be reserved in advance. Park access in February is limited due to the demand to see the FireFall phenomenon.

Yosemite offers an incredible wealth of experience  and should not be missed by anyone remotely interested in learning about natural history or simply standing in awe of 4000ft granite cliffs.
One of the most beautiful park in the world. I love this place very much, especially in autumn.

Such an incredible national park with huge rock faces, beautiful views, and great hikes! I visited on a Friday in mid-September and it was great weather. We stopped at tunnel view to get a great view of the valley, and then drove down into the valley. It was unfortunately difficult to find parking, but once we did, we went on a great hike to see both Nevada and Vernal Falls, a 6 hour hike. Yosemite is like 4 hours from the bay area but it’s worth the drive!

For my first time here, it went as well as it could.
We purposely plan to go in the fall to go in the off-season so that the hordes of people would be less.
We hiked the mist trail up to Vernal Falls. This is considered moderate on AllTrails and boy was it. 3000 gain of elevation and then 600 steps to get to the top of the waterfall. To be honest, I prefer the views of the waterfall versus being at the top. I was sore for four days and it took me a while to get up there.
We also went to the lower Yosemite falls, and we went to bridal veil Falls .
It was a beautiful experience because we actually got to see El Capitan, the enormous rock that Alex Honnold climbed without rope.
Views from glacier point are very pretty however, we loved the views from the sentinel dome .

We want to go back in the spring so that we can see those waterfalls in full bloom.

If I could give some advice to anyone is, if you go there with the group, do not hog up areas so that other people cannot take pictures. We ran into quite a few groups and they stood in the same area taking picture after picture after picture be respectful of other people wanting to be in that spot as well.

Vast - iconic - awe inspiring. My first visit here. Spent time in Yosemite Valley and on the road to Tioga. Exploring the park in late Fall brought less congestion, easy park entry with no wait times at all.

We did almost all of the quick attractions along both loops. One thing I will say the hot pools and springs are very interesting. However for a so highly touted national park I would say this park ranks near the bottom. Very family friendly, plenty of easy hikes that most anyone could handle. Worst part is definitely the extreme traffic and constant bison jams.

That being said the revisit value isn’t great. Especially with the Tetons being so close. I’d choose that park over Yellowstone all day long. I’m not saying it isn’t a great park, but I would choose many others before this one.

We stayed at the Canyon camp ground which I did really enjoy. Being in the thick of the trees was very cool and the accommodations in the campground were great as well.

Always doing some sort of construction or road work. So expect traffic. But it's all worth it. Just park and use their shuttle service to get around. Beautiful powerful and amazing waterfalls. There is so much new growth.  Beautiful clusters of young trees. I'm so happy for the park's future.

Gorgeous, spectacular, picturesque. 2 massive water falls even during the fall.  El Captain straight up. The visitors center second only to Mount Rushmore. Enjoyed the video. Bridalvail falls along with the upper and lower Yosemite falls in the valley were the ultimate highlights of the park. Remember the falls are full in the spring for the snow melt but so is the park more crowded. Roads were good coming in from Lee Vining (east side entrance)
One of the best place in California. Life is short stand and watch or let’s go Yosemite National Park.
Breathtaking! Both figurative and literally. I can’t wait to be back. Some bathroom closer to the fall are closed in winter so be aware.
Nothing like I’ve ever seen. Wish we’d stayed an extra night or two on our holiday - impeccable.
Love this place. The history is more fascinating when think about how well people preserved such great views.

Exceptionally beautiful national park. I have been here multiple times in different seasons. Every season is beautiful in this national park.
Highlights: Tunnel view, El capitan, Yosemite fall, Vernal fall, Nevada fall, Sentinel dome, Glacier point, Half dome.
Good pizzas and breakfast in the curry village.
It shows beautiful colors in fall and spring. Best place when it snows. Amazing hikes in the summer.

This place holds a special place in my heart, it’s like finding yourself in peace. I think I find this place beautiful,  in summer all waterfalls have water in it,in winters ice covered mountains makes it amazing, a must trevel destination if you are in CALIFORNIA or are visiting CALIFORNIA this place has lot of beautiful hikes and deck for snack and quick bite or pizza. We generally come here for hikes and camping in summer as it’s one of the best time to visit, lot of cabins and clean washrooms inside the park to stay and easy facilities.

Extremely beautiful valley, fall colours were starting to appear!! Stayed at Curry Village camps, well-maintained facilities... It was cloudy when we visited (end of Sep'23) so missed seeing Half Dome but there's hopefully always a next time 😊

Yosemite is wonderful and magical every time I go, and this trip was no exception. We saw (from a safe distance) 3 bears... make sure you check with the rangers about how to respond during bear sightings... And many other animals.

Additionally, the waterfalls were the strongest I've seen for this time of year due to record rain and snowfall last winter. This also contributed to a lush green valley floor with plants and flowers I hadn't seen in prior years.

Curry Village is a great way to stay in the valley with kids...parking, tents with beds, close to bathrooms/showers, food and grocery, bike and raft rentals, and trailheads.

Whether relaxing on the shores of the Merced River, biking around the Valley floor, or hiking to a waterfall, the views in all directions are awe inspiring.

Be advised that as of writing this, the Mist Trail is closed Monday - Thursday, 7am-3:30 for maintenance and repairs. This led us to hike to Nevada Falls instead of Vernal Falls, but was totally worth it!!
Absolutely love coming here. In my opinion the best national park. The scenery is beautiful and there are hikes for all skill levels.

It's a magical place you should visit at least once in your lifetime. They maintained the park by high standards. Visitors have access to all the facilities and food was great in their lounge. Parking facilities should be improved since we had to go around about half an hour to find a parking spot.

I love nature and this is not the exception. We were able to drive around, park, hike and explore. Remember not to get there too late like we did because you don't want to get lost walking in the dark. We had to stop at the hotel to get our bearing and were able to ask the sanitation crew members for help as well. We found our car and were very happy to do so.

I just went there a few hour ago. It was incredible thing such as waterfall, rain, fog, and suny at the morning time and afternoon.
I hope I will be there soon😍😍

Magnificent park. We were only able to visit the center, on the Yosemite Valley route, for 1 day. Leave super early, even on a Wednesday there were quite a few visitors. Swinging bridge was a short, beautiful hike. Bridal falls an easy hike to viewpoint. The hike to mirror lake was wonderful but pretty dried up this time of year. Saw deer and elk. It's not too far from towns for fuel, food and lodging.

Unbelievable peace of nature.
Unfortunately we made terrible mistake and stayed only one night at the park.
For the ordinary visitors park have a number of trails with different lengths, the shuttle bus delivers visitors to 17 different stops which are the trails beginning. There different options of staying in the park, begining from luxury suites to the campground tents. The dinner room is opened for visitors and supplies standard American breakfast and dinner.
The national park has beautiful waterfalls, along with fast flowing rivers, it feels like heaven on earth.
Breath taking views. We don't even hike because our oldest is in a wheelchair and it was still amazing to see everything. Pictures could never do it justice
My second visit and there was no time to enjoy everything. I want to go back in the summer 😎 Unmistakable
Prettiest national park! Vernal & Nevada, Mirror Lake, Upper Yosemite Fall are 3 must-do trails. Glacier point is a must too. Fantastic view during sunset.
We had a lot of fun and the long and hot hikes were worth the views.
My favorite place on Earth.  I come as often as I can.  Beautiful in any season

We knew this would be beautiful -- did not realize it would be as stunning as it is.  There just are no photos that can adequately capture the majesty and beauty of this area.  We spent three days hiking -- wish we had at least two weeks.  We will definitely be back.

one of the best national parks in the US🇺🇸
my personal favorite one 👍
Stunning….exceptional…very good traffic flow and lots of parking…very organized for a Sunday 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻

Yosemite was just amazing. We’ve been there 3 times and never seen the park so full of water and green during summer.
Be careful and try to be early at the park entrance otherwise you might get stuck for hours to come in and park in the valley.
Also when we went mid June the tioga road was still closed due to the snow. Other than that it was stunning.

Nature at its best!
Took a wonderful, memorable day trip to Yosemite and Half Dome. Went hiking and sight seeing. Saw several camping communities. Plenty to do. Including biking, swimming and touring.
Tickets entrance for private vehicles are good for a full 7 days.
Must visit national forest easy accessible to most of the view points

I love waterfalls and this park has at least 6 big ones. Some you can hike right up to and splash around in. Did multiple hikes around the valley and went up to glacier point. It was beautiful at every level. Would definitely recommend getting there early to find parking and utilizing the shuttles when possible. I already can’t wait to go back! (I don’t have a dog but I saw lots of cute ones around which is a win.) only mild disappointment was mirror lake which photographed beautifully but looks much swampier and less reflective in person.

You should spare at least 3 days to visit this place. The park is huge. It can take 2 hours to go from one point to another. If you want to see the sunset view, you can pitch a tent in the park or rent a caravan and stay there. Otherwise, you can stay at a hotel in Oakhurst.
