Absolutely beautiful! Did a 12 mile hike on a day off from a work trip and the water levels were overflowing like I’ve never seen before. We must preserve places like this in their pristine state at all cost!

One of the most wonderful, and stunning places I’ve seen. We did the mist trail, it was totally worth it. Yes you get wet, but it was a sunny day. it was like a fresh shower!

Unfortunately part of the trail was closed, so we couldn’t fully complete the hike. If you’re a hiker this park is great. You’ll need more days to see most of the park.

Absolutely magnificent place, all the waterfalls are active and flowing because of historic snow received this year.

We could not do a hike here this time due to personal constraints and I shall regret this. However, if you get a chance to visit, please hike.

Lower Yosemite Falls and views from Columbia Rock were incredible. The waterfalls were overflowing and water was trickling down the granite from several areas all around the main falls. The rivers were really rolling and raging in many parts. It was such a tremendous display of the power to see the historic levels of snow from the past winter, melting into collective forces to create such beautiful waterfalls. There was light to moderate rain each day it seemed around 5 - 6 pm. This made the greenery all around lush and bountiful. The air was saturated with scents of pine/ fresh forest/ meadow. I could not breathe in all in enough. Absolutely majestic.

Tips: get to the park early, by 8 or earlier to find parking. Even during the week.

- Don't depend on the shuttles. They only loop in one direction. If you want to get to a previous stop you will need to loop on the shuttle around for an hour and a half to get to it. It's faster just to walk.

- In the afternoon most shuttle buses are full to capacity  anyway much of the time so there would be no way to even get on if you wanted. This means you'll probably do just one or two trails and leave the rest for another day/ visit. They may be more empty early morning/ later evening.

Pictures taken Monday, June 12, 2023.
It is Such a beautiful ❤️ place, so many falls aa there to see, I did hiking also  , it was fun ☺️

Amazing National Park! Beautiful experience. I went there in Fall, usually there's no water at this time of the year, but I was lucky this time. I recommend going in Spring though... Everybody says that's the perfect time. If you want to spend a night here I really recommend de Wawona Hotel!

We came at 9am to the park. Unfortunately there was a huge queue at the entrance. We were waiting for 40 minutes. After this we were looking for the parking a long time. Finally we started our hike. 7 hours in total. But it worth it. Very tired but happy with the result. The view is spectacular. Definitely you have to do it!

This is the most visited national park in the country for a reason. The views here are spectacular and you will find a reason to stop every two mins. The park has a lot of bears so carry a bear spray. You’ll have to book tickets in advance as the park is always busy.

A national treasure. Maybe even a world treasure. A great natural beauty located in California close to San Francisco. A scenic drive to get there and back. Visited in June 2023 and this year there was a particularly wet winter and as such some of the passes and roads were still closed due to snow. Otherwise the park was easy to visit and go through. Tons of camping options. Reservations required and check often the National Parks website for updates and information. A definite visit if in the area and a good one to take time to trek through. Highly recommended.

We challenged ourselves with an overnight course in the San Francisco Bay Area. I left at 6 am, took Gracia Point, and returned after hiking near Bridal Veil Falls. I had to throw away about 2 hours because there were so many restrictions on each section, but it was a really beautiful place. Unfortunately, I couldn't try Mirror Ray because the weather was too hot.
If I get a chance next time, I plan to try camping.
Always wondrous. December is such a great time to go, as the park is nearly empty but still so very beautiful.

Did a couple days here. Missed Tioga pass but will be back for that next trip. You need at least 3-4 days here to see the top spots. I could have spent the entire day at Glacier point just enjoying the view from a good coffee rock. Prepare for hours of driving.
Absolutely amazing experience. A place filled with beautiful mountains . We hiked to lower yosemite falls , so stunning .

Absolutely beautiful views everywhere we looked. Amazing trails with numerous waterfalls. We went in early May so the crowds weren't bad. Frequent shuttle busses available to take you around the park (included in admission cost). National treasure!

This is a great place to go and forget about your troubles, and immerse yourself in nature. The only bad thing is sometimes this place is crazy with tourists. The best way to see this place is a day hike that is far away from everyone. My suggestion is the panoramic trail in the fall.
There's no way to describe how magnificent this place is.  My son worked there this summer and didn't want to leave (he may be back lol).  God's beauty abounds in this Heaven on earth.....

Absolutely beautiful well worth the drive, amazing views, so much stuff to do, if you love hiking or cycling there is activities for everyone to enjoy, also restaurants, museums, hotels, various areas to camp in, come and enjoy some of the best California has to offer

Went here in June 2023, waterfalls were overflowing.  Everything were lush. Hiked to top of Vernal Falls. That was a strenuous hike for me - bad heart (going up) & a bad knee (going back down).  But it was so worth it. Didn’t need to make reservation for park entrance, but check the NPS website for updates. Glacier Road was closed. Shuttles were running slow & full like packed sardines.  East village (purple) shuttles were not in service. Visitor center was closed, but had services outside. Bridal Falls parking area was closed, but nearby parking area was open. We were able to hike there easily.

Our visit to the most beautiful national park in the US was a short one. Although we planned to spend the whole day there, we arrived at 4 pm, so we only had time to visit Lower Yosemite Falls and the El Capitan Viewpoint. Despite this, I was overjoyed to be able to witness the stunning sunset at the El Capitan Viewpoint in Yosemite Valley.

This Park is absolutely beautiful. The breathtaking views are worth the effort no matter where you go.

I hiked to Half Dome on my first visit and only day of the trip.

The hike to Half Dome is definitely strenuous but every step just provided something new and majestic to look at. Mist Trail is so spectacular especially with the water rushing and all the mist to add to the experience. The trails are well maintained and the rest stops are well placed and greatly appreciated along the way.

Got to speak with many nice people and make new friends on the journey. Park rangers were as always friendly and informative.

I will definitely be returning to see the rest of this spectacular park.

Absolutely beautiful to see!! This is definitely a must see for any trip in the area. It is quite a drive, but worth it. My wife and I entered through the southwest (hwy 140) entrance and it took another hour and a bit to get to the park itself. It was stunning once inside. Very accessible as well if you're somebody who does not hike.

My friends and I did the Vernal and Nevada Falls hike via Mist Trail.  Steep climb so we took many breaks. You will get wet so be prepared. The spray from the falls is amazing. Rocky wet steps, but there is about 100 feet of railing you can hold onto for balance. It’s really not too bad. Next was Nevada Falls. Easy enough walk on over, but the best was yet to come. Took the Muir trail down. Get ready to be soaked. We had waterproof boots, but did not help. You will be walking through a fall. Ankle deep water. It was like being a kid playing in the water. Embrace it and push on through. Now, we are exhausted. Yes, mud and water is involved, but stay focused on your footing and have fun.

Yosemite is the BEST National Park within America hands down. I visited the Yosemite Valley for 2 days and I was completely blown away. I can't stop thinking about the park and ots gorgeous views. Photos and videos don't do the justice. There are tons of hiking trails, gorgeous waterfalls to be seen or photographed, bike and raft rentals and much more. Make it a priority to visit Yosemite National Park in your lifetime.
Absolutely beautiful National Park in Central California. Stunning streams, lakes and mountains. Roads are maintained in very good condition considering the elevation.

I went for a day and a half and stayed in a bed and breakfast just outside the park. I went into the valley for one day and the other half, I went to mariposa grove. It was a great time of hiking and great views. I will be posting more pictures but here are some.

A beautiful place to visit any time of the year. The waterfalls flowed spectacularly during my early August visit. Hiking to the top of Yosemite falls was exhausting but worth the effort to get to see some of the best views and vistas.

The bestest national park, largest rocks and prettiest waterfalls, in this season anywhere you look you will find a couple.. weather is perfect for a day trip or for staying a few nights, there are so many hikes that lead to some stupendous sites and makes you realize importance of Nature..

Amazing view! Good park service like information center, good amount of bathrooms and the road have a lot of signage. Unfortunately there’s no good cellphone service at the park, but as soon you arrive, they give you a map. There’s a bus that does shuttle inside the park.

Beautiful and magnificent views specially 2023 has been wonderful with huge snowfall contributing to the best views this year.
They have free shuttle running in the valley from 7am to 8pm. It’s quite a wait but definitely better than going around in car without finding a place to park. This facility is really helpful with bus stopping in every 20 available view points.
Every stop has lot of restrooms available as well.
They even have rental bikes available for kids and adults to go around the valley that costs around 40$ per day. Even this is one of the easy ways to view all the places. They have bike paths around the valley and also enough bike parking area.
Get early find a parking and go with shuttle or bikes. Definitely the best was the most trail. Take ponchos

A serene, beautiful national park filled with beauty anywhere you turn to. Spent a good 4 days at the park and the views were spectacular. Lots of hikes, look out spots, flora and fauna around. Certainly recommend for while in Northern California!

It’s has stunning views and full of wonders! It reassure me to acknowledge that behind everything that is there: the vast of full of oxygen green trees, stunning strong and endless waterfalls, wild flowers, majestic well established rocks and mountains there is a grand designer whom with great power and unique wisdom! He created all of those wonder for us all to enjoy!

Yosemite has a million things to offer and you wont be disappointed. Amazingly organized campgrounds (make reservations for camping and hiking as soon as Reservation app opens them). We decided to get permit for Snow creek and from there did the north dome, Yosemite falls loop. Be aware that with back packs the down climb of Yosemite falls is harder than getting up the switchback's on snow creek. I would plan for a two night out hike, even though we did it with only one overnight stay, it doesn't need to he this hard😆

Such magnificent beauty, but spoiled by the maddening crowds. Around every turn are scenery that is breathtaking. But also rude pushy people. Speed limit is 35mph in most of the park but too many drivers think it is a freeway.

The park is amazing, recommend to go early as you might end up in a few miles queue to get in otherwise. The scenery is just breathtaking and if you're early you'll see some wildlife too. 100% a must do and see.

I love this park! We started our hike at Glacier Point. We camped at the creek then continued our hike to LYV. We camped the second night in LYV then hiked the summit of Half Dome via cables. We ended our trip in the Valley stuffing our face with convenient store food. I can't wait to return for more!

2023 is a must visit to Yosemite.  The valley's trees and foliage are the greener I've seen and there more smaller waterfalls. The old classic Yosemite, Nevada, Bridalveil and Vernal falls are gushing with much more water them we've seen in years if not a decade.
Got what an absolutely ugly place !!!! It’s like I couldn’t get a break to rest my eyes because of how much I loved - I mean hated - every view around every corner.
Arguably the most breathtaking place on earth. Yosemite is highly developed, with a grocery store, hotels and restaurants, and plenty of EV charging. Arrive early to secure parking!

There are no words to do this park justice. Majestic. Awe inspiring. The views. The hiking. Late May is a great time to see full waterfalls. The weather is mild. Fall is a great time to see the beautiful colors. Check the NPS website for current road conditions and closures. Reservations are required to drive into the park at certain times of the year. Two full days is the minimum to even see the highlights. The Valley Floor Tour that was 2 hours was definitely worth it.

This place is popular for a reason.  Go early in the day.  Be in your parking spot by 7:30am.  It gets crowded.  Beautiful trails.  There is no such thing as a bad section of Yosemite.  Just do your preparations and know what you can do.

My family and I visited today and we just had a great time. Wednesday was the day to go. There was no line to get into the park and finding parking near the Falls was a bit hectic but still found a spot in a reasonable amount of time. We loved the entire park. My girls had a blast in the water and seeing the falls. I will absolutely be back. We got lucky enough to see a small bear and a dear 😊😊

Wonderful place to visit, especially during the winter. It can get crowded during the summer, but the roads are wide enough for cars to stop on the side.
I recommend coming in from the 41 highway and leaving on the 120. That way, you get to see the valley from up high, seeing both El Capitan and Half Dome!

Great experience, definitely coming back. There are quite a few lodges and resorts within 30min of the park. Food is pricey so bring some necessities with to save a bit. There was only one of three entrances open and quite a few roads closed. Make sure to check what roads are open and closed prior to going to plan better. Prepaying online for park pass made it a breeze as well and saved time at the entrance of the park.

Been to Yosemite countless times since childhood. Is just as amazing and breathtaking as it was then. A blessing and privilege to live so close to God's creation. Even the old restrooms at the entrance are a historical landmark. A lot of history at Wawona too.

Stunning! Yosemite is that kind of place that you wonder if is real. Amazing views, great infrastructure and some of the most breathtaking natural spots in the whole World. That kind of place you have to go at least once in a lifetime.
Beautiful place. Dogs allowed on all paved trails!

The popular trails like John Muir Trail was kept well without steps falling off, with volunteers giving guides at corners.  Public restrooms and water fountains also clean and tidy for climbers use.  Trails command magnificent views of Half Dome and other peaks, and Yosemite Falls and other falls and lakes.  The trails are really worth walking, so private cars should be stopped driving all together in the area and tours and guides to good view sights should be provided more.

Absolutely beautiful nature, one of the most beautiful places I've seen in the U.S. and in the world, even though very crowded (in August). Moreover, rangers are restricting access to some areas and paths (I should've asked a permit years ago to climb Half Dome??) or will only let you pass against payment or previous booking. It's very bureaucratic (but this is a general reproof I personally wanna make about U.S. National Parks. Of course, it's only my personal opinion) When I came back down from the summit of Half Dome, the path I had taken in the early morning was now closed, without explanation, forcing me to take a huge detour, climbing up again on the crests, at the hottest hours of the day, when I was already exhausted by the climb of the summit.

Nevertheless, Yosemite is definitely worth it. The view from Glacier Point was stunning and summitting Half Dome was one of the most fantastic experiences in my life. I wish I had time to do more trails in this amazing landscape.

I recommend to choose a period when the park is less crowded. To avoid the crowd, I recommend to wake up early and to take some hight; The lower in the valley and the closer to Yosemite Village, the more people you'll meet.
This is very beautiful. The most bang for your buck if you live in the Bay and have the means to get there!

Yosemite is one of my favorite places in the world. I’ve come many times in all times of the year. Winter is best because of the small crowds and epic beauty.  Yosemite is my church.  Great hikes everywhere.  Hike a bit past the common tourist spots and the crowds drop off fast.

Spectacular scenery, this place is magical. Waterfalls didn't have water in September. This park offers scenic hikes, amazing meadows and wonderful scenic drives. Curry village has good restaurants for your cravings and accessible restrooms and gift shops.

Incredible views, hikes and waterfalls. Went in June 2023 and the park was so lush with gushing falls and streams. Parts of the park were flooded unfortunately and glacier road was closed. Definitely will come back to visit Yosemite!

This is one of my favorite places in California. It’s truly a magical and Spiritual place… I have been here 4 times in the last 2 years and I already can’t wait to come back for a fifth time! If you haven’t been here yet it’s a must for your bucket list and make it happen. Every time I come here I see and experience something or somewhere new! Places I recommend visiting are anywhere and everywhere… but if you want actually locations try the valley loop, tunnel viewpoint, glacier point, Tuolumne meadows, mariposa groove, half done and Yosemite falls! I love this place and miss it already
Gorgeous views. Well-made and kept up trails. Wonderful hiking atmosphere. You have to do it at least once if you are a hiking enthusiasts or just need a vacation.
Saw a rainbow in the canyon, the most spectacular view I've ever seen in my life

This is the BEST national park to visit! It is breathtaking in natural beauty, very well maintained trails, friendly for all levels of fitness, good shops, restrooms, restaurants, and the most incredible views of mountains and waterfalls. I highly recommend this place for everyone to visit at least once!

Great weekend getaway from the bay. We didn’t get to the park until 5pm so we went straight to Vernal Fall and Nevada Fall In Yosemite Valley. We get to watch sunset on top of Nevada Fall and did an amazing night hike back. Don’t forget to bring some lights for night hikes! Raincoat is needed when water is with this level of power 😂 snacks snacks!! Gosh how did we forgot to pack any food, I started to have illusions on the way back from the 9 mile steep hike!
every description ever used to describe this incredible place falls short! what a miracle on earth

One of Californias best statel parks.
But  in fact , its one of of our country's national treasure. This latest adventure found us with the beautiful fall colors . Loved the explosion of color against the backdrop of falls. Dynamite granite vistas surround the valley wich helps funnel the sun among the trees. Always marvel when we come here. Fine dining among rugged nature is just the beautiful juxiposition if this place. You cannot visit this place one time.
Absolutely gorgeous! Nice scenery around every turn! The waterfalls don’t disappoint! Sad to leave this park, will have to come back!

Never crossed my mind that I would be in this place.  The beauty of nature is amazing, the waterfall is incredibly exciting and the beautiful panorama cannot be expressed in words.  You have to come to see it yourself.
Even though the journey is quite challenging, with winding roads and sharp turns, ascents and descents with steep cliffs that are very worrying.  We arrived with a satisfaction and believe me, this visit is very worthwhile.  Shall come again whenever I got the chance.

Absolutely great. It’s so worth it. But in the winter time, there are risks regarding the weather and quite some parts are not open in winter time. If it’s snowy, you might be required to have snow chain on your tires. I’ll have to come back when it’s not so cold for sure.

Buy the America the beautiful pass if you plan to visit more than 1 park. If you are only visiting 1 national park then make it Yosemite, it is amazing. The views are totally incredible and breath-taking. The hikes are fun and a wide variety to choose from. Visit Glacier point and drive the Tioga Rd if you can. Awesome 😎.

Wonderful scenery, horrible management. The park has alot to do, but it's hard to move around in. There is no staff anywhere. Once you pass the gate, you are on your own. There is no cell service, so no rangers and no good maps make for alot of wanted time. Signage is bad, trails are not well blazed. The bus service is abysmal.... they pack the buses way beyond capacity. It is hard to believe that the government that manages yellowstone so well leaves this park to crumble. Road closures with poor notice are a major inconvenience.

If it was not for the natural beauty,  this place would not be worth it. If planning travel, pick yellowstone or denali.  It's a shame to see how mismanaged it is here. Bathrooms do not get cleaned, we came across two with feces on the wall and floor.

Shameful

Visited in June 2018. Has always been one of my bucket list things. Spent 4 days and did a few hikes, the famed 4 mile trail etc. It is one of the most beautiful places on the planet and I had a blast.
I went last month stunning unforgettable views will definitely be back !
Truly amazing sights to see. The entirety of the park was so majestic. I only had one day to explore, but I'm definitely coming back for more.

This place is amazing but needs to be more organized. To find parking was the toughest job and the one-way traffic was not helpful at all. Make sure you read the map you get at the entry carefully before you drive in. The fall and mountains are breathtaking. Must go.

Yosemite is just beautiful. We arrived on Tuesday after Labor Day at about 3 pm. Only two cars in front of us at the El portal entrance. Dinner was pizza at the deck in Curry village. There was a long line, but it moved quickly and the half some pizza with hot honey was awesome! We saw lots of wildlife in our upper pines campsite, and even a coyote in happy isles! We parked in Yosemite village on Friday when we were leaving around noon, and there was still plenty of parking. Would recommend coming after Labor Day if it's possible. Weather was great- about 80⁰ all four days we were there with barely any wind and no smoke. Perfect!
For me, it’s a bit overrated but still a very good national park anyway.

Such an amazing nationl park… crazy how developed the valley is with places to stay and eat. The parking was a little bit of a pain but we were able to find a spot. The trails were very well maintained and we were able to easily escape the crowds.

Everyone should see this place at least once before the die. Early Summer waterfalls are amazing, Spring and Fall the colors are amazing. Winter is amazing, but you may risk getting snowed in... Keep that in mind 😂
So Many Beautiful Views, Waterfalls were, what seemed like, on Every Mountain!  Pics don't Capture the Beauty of Yosemite.  Road to Redwoods was finally open and worth the short Hike.
Amazing views through out the park!
One of the best and scenic places in California. Picturesque locations, mammoth mountains, giant falls, steeper hikes. One of the best places in the United States

So beautiful! I am so glad this place exists and is protected.

(I wish visitors were more mindful about their footprint.)

I highly recommend taking the tour of the flats for the history of the area. Learning that the Buffalo Soldiers were commissioned to protect Yosemite from those who wanted to pillage its resources and that parts of the park rangers' uniforms nationwide pay homage to that black military unit gave me goosebumps!

I highly recommended this an wonderful place in San Francisco,.Not just a great valley, but a shrine to human foresight, the strength of granite, the power of glaciers, the persistence of life, and the tranquility of the High Sierra, Yosemite must-visit destination for everyone exploring National Park. ❤️

Was with a friend to help move a piece of furniture from their family residence in the Wawona area along the Merced River.
Took a walk to explore an area I'd never been to, away from the usual tourist areas. Thoroughly enjoyed the daylong experience.
An easy drive from Fresno, on a Friday in mid Oct. Expected to see more vehicles and tourists, but didn't. Hope to return soon for some more hiking.

Beautiful place! 😍 The ticket is $35 per car. 🎟️ We entered through the south gate, and it's true we had to wait for 30-45 mins, but we drove almost 3 hours to reach the head of the Mist Trail (we drove from Merced). On our way back, it only took us 2 hours to drive from where we parked to Merced. 🚗 Not sure which gate would be better. 🤔 We saw bears and easily found a parking space. 🐻🅿️ We departed at 5:30 am and arrived at the parking area around 9 am. ⏰

$35 for a 7-day entrance fee per vehicle.

Beautiful, humongous, magnificent rock formations/cliffs, waterfalls, the Merced River, creeks, white sand "beaches", & campgrounds albeit a very scary drive back to Oakhurst driving along cliffside w.NO barriers and only shoulder turnouts not full shoulders!  That drop had us on edge, elevation hit 8,000 ft so you can only imagine the horrifying ramifications from accidentally driving off it.

FYI; If you miss the entrance to the waterfall viewing location you won't be able to loop back due to the raised cement median at the turnabout.

We only viewed a couple of hours, so when even a weeklong tour wouldn't give you the majority of what Yosemite holds we'll need to return and stay longer.

For the Fall changing of the colors of leaves you really need to visit mid-late November.  On 10.16.23 we only witnessed a very few trees just starting to turn yellow.

Pics of HUGE waterfall, maybe 1,500+ ft(?) & Merced River (very cold).  For full blast raging waterfalls come in April or May when waterflow is at its peak.

*During the drive to the Park we almost hit a huge young male deer who sprinted in front of us running across the road, just jumped out from the foliage.  If I hadn't checked the brake we would've collided w.it, we missed him by only inches.  This was so scary being so sudden, a fright and then relief for both us and that deer.  There are bear & deer crossing signs along both lanes. Please keep that in mind, it can happen to you.
A wonderful experience this time of year.   Our day was beautiful.  The waterfalls were in high gear.  Saw climbers on El Cap and a bear on the way out of the park. Perfect day.

Amazing place to enjoy for a weekend or couple more days, a lot of hiking, spend time on the water, enjoy the night.
They have a shuttle that it takes you to the different parts of the park, also there is a supermarket to buy whatever you need most if you go camping.
To find a parking you should get there early in the morning around 6 or 7am or at night around 9pm.

I recomend arriving early (sunrise), this will save you time for parking and trails will be less crowded which make the place even more magical. Parking will be terrible if you show up at 10am.

The bus lines are currently very long starting at 10-11am so patience is key. Or time your trails so that you take the bus to another area before 10am.

Beautiful park! 😍
Pictures don't do it any justice!!

Yosemite National Park is an absolute gem among America's national parks. Its stunning views of waterfalls, including the iconic Yosemite Falls, leave visitors in awe of nature's beauty. The majestic El Capitan, with its towering granite walls, is a sight that truly captivates the imagination. Yosemite offers an unparalleled experience, making it my top choice for the best national park in the U.S. for its incredible scenery and opportunities for outdoor adventure.

I loved this park even though it was busy. You must come early in the morning or later at night if you want to have a pleasant experience without a wait. During the busy middle of the day plan on staying off of the roads and enjoy picnics, hikes and watching nature, because those are the busiest times. Some roads close in the summer once the area gets filled up, such as Marriposa Grove, so if you don't come early you won't be able to see that area at all. If you can stay overnight and watch the stars in the summer it is amazing! Housekeeping camp has showers and coin operated laundry which are very nice. To see animals, stick to the least populated areas of the park.

We've been to Glacier, Yellow Stone, the Badlands, Grand Canyon, Bryce, & several other National Parks. I can say with full confidence- Yosemite is a MUST see. The pictures I've added are 1/100th of what you'll actually experience while standing there in person.  We didn't have much time there because of our schedule, so we did zero hiking. I can't even imagine what we'd see if we had the time to hike.

For people deciding where to go  - definitely drive the Glacier Point Road. It's one way in & one way out. Then, leaving there, & head north- do the big oval loop. You won't be disappointed.  The memories of the views will last a lifetime.

You have to go early to avoid the very long lines at the entrance. Whether you're a beginner or an avid hiker, there are so many trails available for everyone. Don't forget to bring your mosquito repellant, unlike me. What a beautiful place to enjoy and visit.
Always majestic here.  Put in on your bucket list!

Yosemite National Park is a beautiful place with stunning scenery. There are many things to do in the park, including hiking, camping, fishing, boating, rock climbing, and horseback riding. I highly recommend visiting Yosemite National Park if you're ever in California.

Beautiful please to enjoy the hikes, waterfalls and scenic views, We found a snake on the way so be careful of your kids and pets, some hikes with waterfalls are risky so better go with a guide, keep park clean and don’t forget your mosquito repellent, sun protection and lots of water. Better drive there early cuz the line to enter to the park get so crazy (minimum wait on car at 8 am is 35-40 min ish) as well to find parking available. Rangers al always checking if you are not parking correctly so do your best. Be safe, be patient, enjoy! ♥️
Great place to go. It's absolutely beautiful and amazing to see. If you can try and go before winter so you can go up glacier point.

This occurred in Yosemite National Park's Mariposa Grove. Taken during the week of Christmas in 2023. but it was really satisfying and had a nice, natural scent. There are lots of hiking trails and trees.

Wow.  I've spent a lot of this summer in this park.  Glacier Point hike, Mist Trail hike, Yosemite Falls hike, overnight camping at Cathedral lake, overnight camping at Curry Village, driving through, and going to the super secret waterslides.

Glad I've gotten to see so much of this beautiful park, hope you do too.

What can be said about Yosemite National Park that hasn't already been said? Probably not much. What an incredibly beautiful place. We went on a free day expecting there to be a TON of people and in all honesty, there wasn't. Park was breathtaking and of all the places I've visited (a lot) this was for sure the most beautiful.

If you haven't already, make this trip happen for yourself. It's worth the drive, flight, or whatever it would take to get you there, it's worth every dime!

Visiting Yosemite National Park was an ethereal experience. The iconic beauty of Yosemite Valley, framed by granite titans like Half Dome, truly embodies nature's grandeur. A trek to the Lower Falls offered a refreshing mist and picturesque views, while the daunting silhouette of Half Dome stood as a testament to Earth's geologic wonders. Venturing to Mariposa showcased ancient Sequoia trees, towering and wise, a humbling reminder of nature's longevity. Each location in Yosemite provided a unique and awe-inspiring vista, making the journey not just a visit, but a deep communion with the wild. Highly recommended for nature enthusiasts.

Valley feels smaller (it is narrow) in person than what one would imagine. However, it is really beautiful. Needed to buy snow chains for tires. Should be worth visiting in summer and staying for 2-3 days.

One of my favorite places and I’m so happy that it’s only a few hours drive from where I live. I love hiking here and it never gets old. The beautiful landscape and scenery are beyond beautiful. I can’t wait to explore more of this park. It’s truly a unique place on this planet.

We visited on a Friday, the park was crowded.  It was very beautiful and we visited a few places, but never made it to Yosemite Falls due to no parking.  The park is a 'must visit'.  Smoke did affect some viewpoints.  Photos do NOT reflect accurately, you have to see it in person to appreciate how great it is.  The park was burning some standing trees.

Cool place! Got to see the amazing waterfalls. There's also a bunch of trails that lead to cool little areas. Only downside is that there's usually some wildfires in the area that make the air quality not the best. But other then that it's a cool place to visit!

The most beautiful place on earth. Lots of amazing hikes of varying lengths and skill levels. You can see a lot right from the car or boardwalks on the valley floor. It is over crowded now. It would be better if visitors were polite and followed rules. Lots of people leaving trash and smoking. If you take time to research on the nps website before your trip, you'll be better prepared.

We are not a “hiking/camping” type of family, however we wanted to visit the park to view the mountains, falls, trees and some other natural places within the park.

Needless to say, beautiful place to visit. We just did a one-day visit and had a blast. Rangers and workers all around the park were great.

Some tips:

Arrive early (no later than 7AM), this way FOR SURE you will beat the traffic and be able to move around the park on the bus. And of course, easier to find parking.

Bring a sweater, no matter if it’s middle of summer.

We stayed about an hour away from the park (Mariposa), recommend staying there if you’re not planning to do camping. Also, is a little bit cheaper than staying in the valley area.

Just enjoy the walk and sightseeing.

If this isn’t on your bucket list of places to see I’m California you need to add it! This place is absolutely amazing and deserves more than one day to explore, there’s to many breath taking spots to do it all in one day. Iv been twice now, 3 days each time and still want to come back to try new trails and make new adventures. I recommend getting the very early and deciding before you go what exactly you want to see. This will help get you parking nearest the sites you want to visit.
Beautiful beyond explanation. I recommend visiting at least once.

100% must see if you are visiting California. The
most beautiful national park and nature in general i ever saw. Recommending to stay atleast one night so you can experience as much possible. Most of the viewpoints are possible to get closer with car and then you can hike a bit or you can hike to everything. The place is huge so really recommending planning properly before you go there. There are nice camping areas and also some food options even gass station.

Hot and dried up waterfalls with far less shade than other forests. Definitely come here in late spring, May or June, when the waterfalls are especially large. The trees are still tall and majestic as are the mountains. No large wildlife to see, mainly squirrels, chipmunks, few bats, and few birds.

Stunning. From titanic granite towers to towering waterfalls; from bobcats to bears to mule deer in their natural habitat; from cool, flowing creeks to the majestic sequoia. This park is absolutely breathtaking.

Unfortunately much of the park has been closed so far this year(2023) but the part that was open was spectacular. The waterfalls and rivers we raging. The mountains, the trees, wild flowers, rock climbers , everywhere you look there's something. Parking can be tricky and grocery prices are high.

I will forever consider this national park the most beautiful of all national parks in the U.S. It definitely lived up to the expectations I had of it. No where else have I seen a place so beautiful in my life! I can’t wait to have kids one day and bring them here! I would recommend coming here in mid April. It’s cool, the snow is melting and it makes for a beautiful waterfall and green environment!
Need I describe this beauty of a place, it's a must go for any CA Bay area visitor and a great option for those zombying around the house on a weekend.

It is incredible. Amazing national park.
It’s easy to go around with your car or with the public shuttles. There are lot of trails (very easy to find) and with different difficult levels.
The views are just the best of the west coast.
The rangers are severe but friendly and super useful when giving directions.

We went in early June and the waterfalls were all going strong. The river was raging. It was very hot out but if you have school age kids and want a 2 hour quick tour you can take the open air bus ride from the Yosemite Lodge! It was well worth it! You don't have to be a guest at the hotel to enjoy the bus ride or the cafe at the Lodge. The parknwas clean and there were visitors from all over the world. I wish reservations weren't needed but I can see how they are necessary.

We came on a Saturday in early Jun. Applied for permit online well in advance . Stayed at a hotel close to the park the night before and when we arrived at the entrance via El Portal slightly past 7am , there were only a few cars in front of us.
Drove  another hour to reach glacial point, no issue to find parking ( the toilets there really sucked). When we got to our second destination down at the Yosemite Village area close to 10am  it was more crowded, however, no car queue and we are able to get a lot.  Overall, the permit and reservation system to manage peak period traffic helped to ensure a more pleasant visit for all.  Keep it up!
Wow! 🍀The park is amazing and beautiful! 🏞️We absolutely love it! There's plenty of paved area to walk with a dog 🦮and a stroller, making it perfect for exploring!

I drove my EV, an ID.4, in and out of the valley and it worked beautifully. I would charge at Oakhurst to between 80-90 percent and going in and out it would use around 15-20 percent. The first day and found a trickle charger in the valley at the lodge and charged while we hiked, but that day we actually ended up with more than 85 percent charge left by the time we got to Oakhurst due to regeneration on the way down. The last day we went all the way into the valley, and then up to glacier point and used ~35 percent. Doing Yosemite on an EV was great. This time of year the park was beautiful, nice temperature, it did rain the last day pretty hard but it was still a great trip.
This place is magical!! Reservations 6 months in advance to the day!! If you love nature but have never been to Yosemite, you just found your next camping trip!! Enough said no spoiling🤘

This is an incredible place. The vistas and waterfalls in the spring are amazing.
Though if you are coming from east of the part be aware that the road through the park opens late May or June. That will add travel time.

A scenic park with some spectacular waterfalls and a valley bottom route, and a mountain drive through spectacular rock formations. The road system is being revamped at the moment and is somewhat confusing at times, especially around the rest camp areas. Sadly some of the area has been badly devestated by what I presume is fire, and in other areas trees look to be dieing of some other cause.. posibly drought? Worth a visit but nature seems to be suffering from over use.. in my humble oppinion.

Such a wonderful place to visit!! We loved everything 💜
The eating/cafeteria is so huge. It have tons of kiosk to order the food ( ppl didn't piled up as much for waiting on their turn to order). There are workers all over to help out if ppl have questions or need any help.
Food quality and portions are decent 👌.
Bathrooms are clean. Staffs are nice and friendly. Gift shop have so much items. Also have nice & friendly staff.
The trail signs at the park are all over, clear & visible.
Such an amazingly wonderful park! We came there on a Tour Bus. So our stay time are limited.  We had 3 hrs to enjoy the park. Oh boy, 3 hrs ain't enough! Definitely next visit, I'll probably drive there, to enjoy it longer.
So worth it!

This place is actually breathtaking and is full of so many different scenic locations. The hikes available range in all levels of difficulty making it easy for anyone to enjoy the park to the most they can. I can not stress enough how beautiful all the different views are and how this is a must see location.

Great place to go to enjoy the beauty of nature. You could do serious hikes as well as easy walks - no matter how you decide you will find great views, wonderful details and interesting new information.
Beautiful place especially in winter. We are so fortunate that their were people who protected this magical place

I recently had the pleasure of visiting Yosemite National Park, and I must say it was an extraordinary experience that left me in awe. From the moment I entered the park, I was greeted by stunning natural beauty that seemed almost otherworldly.

The iconic granite cliffs, majestic waterfalls, and lush greenery created a picturesque landscape that felt like stepping into a postcard. The sheer magnitude of El Capitan and Half Dome left me speechless, and I couldn’t help but admire the wonders of nature.

The park’s management deserves praise for their dedication to preserving the natural habitat. The facilities were well-maintained, and the informative signage and ranger-led programs enhanced my understanding of Yosemite’s ecological significance.

Whether you’re a nature enthusiast, an avid hiker, or simply seeking a tranquil escape, Yosemite National Park offers something for everyone. The sheer grandeur of the landscape, coupled with its diverse flora and fauna, make it a destination that should be on every traveler’s bucket list.

I cannot recommend Yosemite enough. It is a place where nature’s beauty unfolds before your eyes, leaving you with memories that will last a lifetime. Prepare to be captivated by the park’s majesty, and don’t forget your camera – you’ll want to capture every moment of this awe-inspiring journey!
Everyone should experience the beauty of Yosemite at some point in their life! It is truly awe-inspiring. You'll feel more connected to nature than ever before.
The trip to Yosemite was awesome.   The views of all the granite stone mountains were breathtaking.   The beauty was tranquil and relaxing, causing one to sit back and say, wow.

Yosemite National Park is an oasis from the complexities of most of the rest of the state of California. Would give it a 5 star, but it is quite crowded these days, unless you head to the backcountry. Plan to visit in May or September/October. Here is a photo of a coyote wandering in the valley looking for pocket gophers.

One of my favorite places ever since childhood. Even though it can get crowded, there is no place more beautiful than yosemite, in my opinion, and I've only been primarily in the valley. There's so much more to see.

Visited in June 2022 and it was incredible! We stayed in upper pines campground which was convenient for the shuttle and all of the valley attractions. We also spent a day in Tuolumne Meadows which is well worth the drive to do some additional hiking! 10/10

Second visit this year, and I AM HOOKED. Great hiking and beginning (for me) bouldering.

I love how everything is marked and warnings given, but for the most part, everything is at your own risk. This is an amazing concept and tool for empowerment lacking in most areas of the US.

The park is ABSOLUTELY stunning. I’ll definitely be camping in the park the next time I’m visiting from Guadalajara.

NOTE: there is virtually zero cell service in the park. So put your phones away and ENJOY the here and now with the people making the trip with you.
This place is impressive with its nature and views, which are seen here and there.  Mountain rivers, lakes, creeks, waterfalls - everything is so attractive that you don’t want to leave here.

We visited the south western part of Yosemite National Park. We drove Route 168 to Shaver Lake and beyond. It a short trip from Fresno we we added a graduation ceremony. There is some wild fire damage in this part of the park but there is also an effort to do cleanup. In addition, there are a couple of places to get gas on the route we were on. This is important as this one highway is the only way into and out of this section of the parking.

Unique rock formations, waterfalls and wildlife in this National park, don’t miss out the miss trail and the Yosemite falls. In peak season, you can get reservations from 4 months in advance to 1 week in advance (Camp 4)

If you ever have the chance..get there..asap! There is so much beauty here to the human eye! Pass was $45 but lasts 7 days. There are lodges and even a hostel along the way to stay over night. Would def recommend doing that! I wish i had!

OMG! If you haven't visited Yosemite post 2022- 2023 rain storms, you are missing out something.  It is so gorgeous with sooooo... many waterfalls across the park.  Name it Bridal Veil, Vernal Falls, Yosemite fall....Went to the park several times in the past several years, never found a full waterfall.  This time due to wet winter, and snow is melting created these gushing waterfalls.  Easy walk to lower Bridal and Yosemite falls, bit of steep hike required to reach Vernal falls.  Campsites are full, park is not fully opened and is pretty crowded.  Rock climbers are on the go entertaining the visitors. Highly recommend a trip and enjoy the nature, beauty and the perfect season!

Grand experience.  Definitely a bucket list item.  Even hiked to the top of the Yosemite Falls.  Very tough hike.  Would recommend the viewpoint on the Upper Yosemite Falls hike which is about halfway for those who are not in hiking shape.  The viewpoint is an easy half mile hike from Columbus Rock.  Start as early as possible of you want to go to the top of the falls.  Also a rain jacket is recommended for the hike to the top as the falls will rain on you.  Hiking poles are helpful.

For any hikes, bring plenty of water and listen to your body.

We came through the Tunnel View from Wawonna Road.  There are Vista points there that will take your breath away.  Enjoy the short hikes, nature centers and vistas!

Absolutely breathtaking! Everywhere you look is granite rock, tall trees. Visited Yosemite in October 2023. Beautiful weather. Mist trail was closed. Hiked through Vernal falls, El Capitan, Yosemite Valley Meadow, climb on the rocks in lower Yosemite falls. Stayed 3 nights in Curry Village cabins. Cabins carpet was a bit dirty, asked sheets to be changed. Shower area was not too bad. Definitely recommend staying in the Yosemite lodging. If you stay out side of the park, you have to drive about 45 min to get to the actual famous hiking areas. Overall was such an unforgettable experience.

I don't know how they can but adding more car parks would be very helpful. We had to park 5 miles away and walk in some hot weather.
The views are lovely as you can see and worth a visit, but make sure you go at a quieter time, or you'll be walking a distance or not be able to catch a bus as they were packed like sardines.

Not enough food places either; I think there were only two, which were packed even at 3 pm.

Overall, a sight to visit but be prepared for it either by clothing, food, water or time.

Hiked half dome for the first time. Most beautiful and difficult trek of my life. Highly recommend to those who are in shape (I am not lol). Gorgeous mountains, cliffs, rivers, trees, and waterfalls along the way. The path is well worn and pretty easy to navigate.

Better not come to Yosemite on weekends and public holidays if you can. I arrived at a little over 8am on Saturday morning, there was already a line, hardly moving much, to get to the entrance. I didn’t have any waiting experience in my past three visits.
You will need more time here no matter what! Plan for trails to take much longer than you think. You'll be wanting to stop and take pictures around every bend! The falls are spectacular this year!

It was a beautiful day in Yosemite yesterday (Sept. 16). The weather was warm throughout the day, but not too bothersome. I rented a free bike with their bike share program; they provide the helmet — just download the Yosemite Bike Share app before you go.

This is the must visit national park. I visited the park after winter when the snow started melting. The waterfall were at the peaks and it was very beautiful. The park is always busy to plan accordingly. Usually the parking near the hiking areas become full quickly.
Camped out during November. Temp dropped to 29 degrees but it wasn't much of a problem. Not much of a crowd.

This place is pure beauty! Our fam enjoyed hiking the falls, tubing down the river and soaking up all the nature that surrounded us. We were able to see two bears, from a distance of course, and many buck and deer. We stayed in the Housekeeping Camp, and even though the laundry facilities were not open, we had a wonderful time. I recommended that anyone planning a visit to Yosemite call ahead of time or check their website to see what is open and closed to the public.

Such a beautiful park with the peaceful nature and falls. My daughter enjoyed viewing them . We only covered half the park and need to go another trip definitely. We went on winter season but preferred spring season .
Loved it, it’s so pretty in fall right now. It does get quite cold after the sunset, prepare accordingly!
One of the most beautiful places I've ever visited! Glacier point is just wow! Lower Yosemite falls are also amazing! Highly recommended!

Loved the national park not the traffic jam.
I would hope that NPS would come up with a system that let's people know which entries are closed through google maps.
We got to an entrance after a 2 hour drive from our camp and had to drive another 3 hours because it was closed due to a sinkhole.
The other entrance had a traffic jam for almost >30 minutes and a lot of waiting time to our trip.
Although the hike to mist trail was amazing with a rainbow forming right when we arrived.

This place was incredibly beautiful.  The only reason why I gave it 4 stars is because we came during fire season (July &August) and it was very Smokey in the morning.  That was not as bad as not being able to view any waterfalls because they were all dried up or barely flowing.  If I had researched better I would have come earlier in the Summer or late Spring even if it meant more crowds. Also, the trail to the mist waterfalls was very strenuous.

This park is awesome! A lot of nature and a lot of perfect views. Be careful tho, there are wild animals around there, I encountered a snake, but not venomous. I would recommend going with kids to see El Capitan and the Meadow.

People complaining about traffic when they are traffic. The Yosemite landscape is magical every time - summer and winter. It's a much better experience during off season. This park isn't the place to go to "get away from everything" as it's wildly busy and caters to tourists, with the shops, cafeteria and shuttles but it's still an amazing park. The views and hikes are next level.

I mean what do you say....its amazing and awe inspiring.  So greatful for those that had the insight to preserve such a special place.  Wish the park took weather into consideration for closing Tioga and Mariposa Grove road.  Otherwise NPS does great job.

Straight up looks like the movies! We ended up staying in a yurt in Oakhurst and made the short drive to Yosemite. We did the chilnualna falls hike - it was about 5 hours back and forth with a beautiful trail. It had Creek crossings,foresty part, flowery part and a bouldery part. I would highly recommend  wearing long pants and getting the all trails map. Not going to lie though we were amateurs and it showed. I would not go on this trail with kids. There was 1 uninvited animal on our way, but the rest were tiny lizards. The quite and the view are are very rewarding!

We love Yosemite in the falls. It was peaceful morning. You can drive to there and parking. There had free bus and waiting for 30 minutes. Just 15 minuses far away to destination. When we first arrived we had the trees to our. The peacefulness lasted about 45 minutes. This gave our time see all grove had to offer without fearing we was holding someone up. We walked the loop and read all of the signs explaining the area. Deer walked along the path without seemingly noticing me. I highly recommend this grove in the morning. The forest is alive with it daily business that we are too loud to notice.
Its an amazing place to hike and spend time with your family. Beautiful sight seeing and waterfall. Many bike lane around the park.

Amazing! We stayed in the upper pines campground and got to do a few hikes and climbs. Air was fresh, waterfalls were flowing, views were absolutely stunning. This place is a must for all who can appreciate the outdoors.

Scenic, beautiful, and amazing are all words to describe my week here. Well kept, with surprisingly controlled crowds and relatively fast transit, it was an amazing trip. I got a chance to climb and boulder on different occasions and had an amazing time. 10/10 for... everything!

This place is really pretty. So many waterfalls to view, mountains to climb, and trails to explore. There are enough bathrooms scattered about. The cabins that I stayed at were nice. They were pretty cozy and not too dirty when I got there. The tour guides there are so nice and extremely knowledgeable of what they are talking about. The bridges there look very cool and seem stable.

What are you waiting for? GO to Yosemite Natl Park. You can do the "try to see it all, jam a lot of driving in one day" visit, that would work. But we took 3 days and hiked and drove most of it. Waterfalls, Half Dome, El Capitan, Mirror Lake, sequoias are the favorite highlights!
I enjoyed the experience. At the moment of taking the pictures, it felt like walking on heaven—so calm and peaceful with everyone wearing big smiles, and the sound of kids laughing and playing.

Yosemite is one of the greatest places in the world to have your elopement! Couples absolutely love this park for a reason--You will get the most epic photos with all the various and stunning backdrops. What's great about Yosemite is you don't need to necessarily do a challenging hike in order to get some amazing views! Please be aware you must obtain a special event/photo permit in order to have a ceremony or take photos here 💙

It is beautiful!!!!!❤️ The waterfalls in the springtime are huge. As soon as you go through the magical tunnel into the valley it is absolutely astonishing. I definitely do recommend driving in through the tunnel. It's not just the valley that is amazing though, all of it is. Outside of the valley in the mountains there are Giant Sequoias. (Huge trees, over a hundred feet tall) I do definitely recommend going to Yosemite in the springtime, it is very alive and lots water. I just absolutely LOVE Yosemite!😍 The squirrels there are very cute but just make sure to not feed them. Sometimes you will get to see a bear and that is very cool. as long as there are a good distance away from you it's ok. There is also a lot of deer you can always find. The deer also aren't scared of humans so you just have to make sure that you keep you distance. There is also bobcats you can sometimes see, they are more rare though. At night the stars are very bright and pretty, so definitely to recommend that. From up high the view is also really good, doing at least one high up hike is always good to do so you can see the beauty from up there. If you want to go to one of the Giant Sequoia groves DEFINITELY go to Mariposa Grove. Tuolumne Grove is disappointing. I think that's all I have to say but overall AMAZING.😍

Definitely a must see!! We planned our visit on a Tuesday. We arrived super early and bypassed a ton of traffic. We were able to see the super popular attractions before the crowds arrived. It felt like we had the park to mostly ourselves until about 11AM. Parking is a huge nightmare. We did get lucky and found 2 spots — we were gambling switching spots at about 9:30AM but after just a bit of circling we found a spot. The bus was not an option bc the lines were long and the busses very full.

Always beautiful even with hoards of people. Rangers closed the street at around 11 and had us bus or walk from El Capitan. We chose to walk and saw more of Yosemite than we normally do. Just wish they would have said something sooner about closing the street. I miss the reservations of COVID.

Beautiful. Must visit in your life. Could add another 100 beautiful pictures, but it wouldn't show the true beauty until you've been there. Highly recommend the top of Nevada falls if you're a moderate hiker and half dome if you're an advanced hiker.
Bucket list place full of interesting this to see and do. Countless amount of hikes and the Ansel Adam's gallery is a must visit for some books for instance.

My most favorite national park in winter!
Absolutely fabulous
I have been to a few national parks in the U.S., but this National Park has Breathtaking views 😍 👏 👌 lots of scenery you have to go to visit this amazing place once in your life time.

Yosemite is unarguably one of the must-see national parks in the US.  The mountains are so majestic, the waterfalls so grandiose, and the river makes the whole scenery just gorgeous.  We came back here just for a day trip many years after our more frequent visits when our kids were still young, and we were still in awe of the natural beauty.  Too bad that it was a mid August hot summer day (98F max).  We’ll definitely come back in some cooler days to enjoy it more.

I was here for the first time this year.  I recommend going in the spring.  Because a lot of water comes down from the mountains to the bottom.  This means that the waterfalls at this time are very strong and beautiful!  I am amazed by this place!  It is incredible.  You can live there for a month and not see everything.  I recommend visiting this park at least once.  I promise you will not regret it!

Yosemite National Park is in California’s Sierra Nevada mountains. If your hiking lover this is great place to explore visit and enjoy nature.

Most of the locations in yosemite national park has hiking like minimum 2 to 5 miles with elevation. so you have to be careful about your health.

You will find 3 to 4 different waterfalls here and if you don’t want to hike you can try vernal fall which has 2 to 3 miles walk with elevation.

Half Dome is a quartz monzonite batholith at the eastern end of Yosemite Valley in Yosemite National Park, but you need lost of training and practice to hike this.

On park entrance you need to buy $70 to $80 parking pass and you can park vehicles also park has shuttle bus options which you can use will visiting locations.
Beautiful mountains and landscapes. Scenic drive through the park!

Absolutely incredible views and fantastic trails to hike! For accessibility, the Lower Yosemite Falls trail is one of the best for strollers and wheelchairs.

As a word of warning, this is one of the most popular national parks. Arriving any time between 9am-3pm will result in long wait times (1+ hours) stuck in your car to get through the gate, and you'll still have a long way to drive before getting to the Valley or Glacier Point (if it's open for the season) to only be met with no available parking. The park is huge and takes a while to get anywhere, so plan accordingly and arrive early in the morning, or later in the afternoon to get through the gate and deal with less crowds, even outside of peak season on weekdays when reservations aren't even required.

Wonderful!

Photo (1)   From the Eagle Peak.  Escalation to  7750 feet = 2362.2 meterst high, and 5000 feet =
1524 meters ascending,  Yosemite Falls on the left, Half Dome on the center, Nevada Falls on the right, and Yosemite Valley down below.
