Breathtaking view of the waterfall. Absolutely mesmerizing . Loved the park with its giant Sequoia trees.

It was great. Enjoyed the great wilderness and hikes around the Valley. I did the mist trail up to nevada falls and down the john mur trail. Pretty tough but i liked it. It was one of the best stopps around the westcoast I had. Btw: also saw a bear!

It is a glorious place. The park is very popular. Be aware the park demands you make reservations before visiting. The crowds are enormous. I've been in the park on weekends before reservations and you didn't want to be there then.

As many have already said, AWE INSPIRING!! We entered through the South Gate & drove about 45 minutes through Tunnel View to Curry Village. We hiked the Mist Trail and had an awesome time!! I can’t wait to come back :) if you’re the type of person who cries when traveling/experiencing new things.. bring tissues, lol!! I teared up a couple times ;)
It's always worth the long drive. Sunrise at Artists Point away from the clouds was spectacular.

The natural beauty of Yosemite National Park can't be overstated, and this year, after record snowfall, the spring runoff has generated magnificent waterfalls. I've been coming here since I was a kid, almost 50 years now, and I've never seen the park so spectacular. I saw fast flowing falls in places that are almost always dry. Incredible.

That being said, we visited a week before memorial day, which I suppose is technically the "off" season. Despite a good crowd, park services were limited at best. Most of the eateries were closed, and those that we found open were busy, tended by obviously stressed out and tired workers.

Shuttle buses were running at 30 minute intervals--with most of them packed to capacity. On a number of occasions, drivers were forced to leave a dozen or so people behind; the bus was just too full. Parking was relatively easy by comparison, and we found ourselves wishing we had ignored guidelines & driven from place to place.

The final blow was an empty ice cream freezer in the village store.

We tend to visit in the off season, so some limitations in service are not unexpected. I do wish, though, that park management could be more flexible. In a time of epic conditions and nice weather, they should be ready to scale up to meet the demand.
The valley is the most beautiful place I’ve ever been to.
Yosemite National Park what a wonderful place to go, Unbelievable scenery anywhere you look. America’s beauty at its greatest !

Summer of 2023 - July 4th holiday weekend.

I would call Yosemite a heaven on the earth. We are lucky to witness Yosemite in its glory with waterfalls and rivers with high amount water because of heavy snow  melt.

Everyone staying in USA deserves to visit this place. So make time and do visit.
Make at least 3 day trip, try to stay in Yosemite valley itself if the lodges are open, they get booked in lightening speed or stay in nearby city.

We were lucky to get one day accommodation in curry village, other nights we stayed in Mariposa. we took the advantage of the day we stayed in curry village and did mist trail hike to Nevada fall.

Always start your day as soon as possible and reach valley before 7:30am to enjoy crowd free views and hikes.
The best hike I have ever done in my life : upper yosemite falls trail. Can be hard if you are not in good physical condition, but otherwise what a view, what a spectacular hike…

A beautiful place to visit. Needs at least 4 days without traveling time to explore the park. If you are a hiking person then this one is a place for you. To complete the half dome hike you require a booking and then you can do that. There are many small hikes. You have to visit glacier point to see a magnificent view. You can camp in the park but for that you need to book a spot for your RV or tent area. You'll find a bear, a deer. If you're a bird enthusiast then you'll love this place. There are many trails for hiking as well like lower Yosemite fall, upper Yosemite fall, and half dome trail. The best time to visit is in spring if you like snow then winter but in winter some of the parts are closed for visitors. You'll find many types of wild animals, if you're lucky you'll encounter a fox which is a rare sight. You'll require at least 4 days to explore the whole Yosemite park without travel time. Some of the places from where you will find beautiful views, a tunnel view and a glacier point view. Sunset from the tunnel view is a must to experience.

Make sure to get reservations before you visit. When here try to visit back in Tioga Road and the viewpoint from the end of Glacier Road. Both of which are less busy than the valley and offer just as good of views.

Don't expect cell service, bring hiking shoes and sunscreen, and get far enough away from crowds to spot some wildlife.
One of the nicest places on Earth. Everything is well taken care, even during the winter. Mariposa Grove is closed for vehicles, but it is still accesible by foot.

Had an absolute blast heading up to Yosemite National Park to shoot a proposal!  As a traveling destination photographer, I often get to go to some really cool places to shoot.  This had to be the coolest.  The views were breathtaking and served as the best backdrop for this couples special moment.  Hope you love the images!
I don’t think you can rate this place anything other than 5 stars. Breathtaking. Great trails, for all levels, a lot of facilities and even great food inside! Fan of the pizza at Curry Village.

This is a once in a lifetime experience, especially this year (2023) when all waterfalls are especially beautiful due to the snowmelt of the record snowfall. (which unfortunately also closes down several roads in the park longer then usual).
I would really recommend staying 2 days or longer in the park to absorb its full energy and doing all the interesting hikes you want to do. Hike at least one fall and do more if possible. And don't miss out on Mariposa Grove, even though its a 40 minute drive outside of the valley.

This place is a lifetime experience of serenity, beauty and almighty’s magical powers!!!

But it’s quite full of people on weekends, plan accordingly and enjoy the mesmerizing views of valley!!!

We spent three days(9-26 to 9-28) in Yosemite NP.  Our first day was spent in the Mariposa Grove.   I found the large Sequoias awe inspiring.  We hiked past the Grizzly Giant and got away from the crowds.   Going on some of the lesser known trails, we were able to see more trees.  It's hard to imagine those trees have been around for thousands of years.  Our second day was spent in Yosemite Valley.  We hiked to Vernal Falls, which was a challenging hike.  We spent the afternoon exploring the Valley, going to the visitor's center, theater, and museum.  We finished by walking at the base of El Capitan, watching rock climbers.   Our final day was spent in Toulumme Meadows.   We hiked to Dog Lake and Lambert Dome.   We also stopped, and marvelled  the Meadows.   We stopped at Tenya Lake and had lunch on the beach.   Our last stop was Olmsted Point.  Here you can see how the glaciers carved the granite millions of years ago.   When visiting YNP, be prepared to drive.   We stayed in Groveland, CA and had to drive 40 mins to get to the park.  The shuttles in the valley are convenient, and easy to use.   Yosemite is a beautiful place, and I'm thankful I got to visit.
One of the most beautiful national parks in the USA! Waterfalls were amazing and the fresh smell of pine and water was indescribable!! Absolutely loved our visit!!
What more can be said about one of the most beautiful sites in the United States. Definitely be in the park as early as possible. It’s almost impossible to find parking after 9:30 am.

Amazing views, difficult trails but worth the hike. Can be crowded which takes away experience so recommend getting up very early and hit the trails. Take plenty of water and suggest nutrigrain bars and/or  salted nuts and berries packed air tight to avoid unwanted guest.  Too much to see in one visit.

We backpacked Yosemite Falls to Old Big Oak Flats - Three days and two nights with quite a bit of leg-busting elevation gain along the way. We originally planned to exit Snow Creek but were rerouted due to a small fire. So much water 💦 and beauty to be had. If you have time in August (or September) to get up to Yosemite, you should. Permits are relatively easy to grab for the falls (because hey, it’s straight up a mountain 😀), but the amount of water flowing right now is truly once in a lifetime!

Yosemite National Park: Awe-Inspiring Beauty and Unending Lessons

The ancient rocks here will awe you like nothing else. But it's not just the rocks. The sheer tranquility of the streams flowing through the valleys, teeming with life, will leave you breathless. Giant trees, silent witnesses to centuries of human existence, stand tall with their roots relentlessly penetrating the hard rock, a constant reminder of persistence.

Look up at the mountains, their white peaks a majestic sight. If you're lucky, you might even witness cascading glaciers as they melt, a display of nature's raw power that will command both admiration and respect.

The journey doesn't end there. The vibrant shrubs thriving near the riverbanks and at the foot of the mountains, bursting with color and variety, offer a beautiful lesson in diversity and its importance to humanity.

Yosemite is a classroom with endless lessons. The drive itself is an adventure, with the road meandering up and down, crisscrossing rivers, a testament to the ingenuity of those who carved a path where none existed before.

Come explore Yosemite National Park and experience its magic for yourself!

Third time visiting and was blown away all over again. Pro tip - visit during the weekday. We went on a Monday and there was no traffic and the park was not busy at all which made the experience 💯 more magical.

Serene n calm place . One feel connected with nature . Zero pollution . Wish we could have spent more time there. Our journey from SFO to this place was for four hours one side. The tour person left us there for three hours . If you are vegetarian please carry some food with you as they sone have much veg options . And if u get lucky to stay there (which is very difficult as they r booked for year already) else enjoy your time . Do wear comfortable shoes as one need to walk a lot
Truly amazing! We went only for 2 nights, hiked to Glacier point and did the Panorama route. We stayed in the tented village(won’t recommend that), but the valley is so amazing we loved it!

Lovely. A must-see visit. It cost €35 for our visitors ticket for 5 days I think it was, which we bought in advance online before leaving the UK, and it was well worth it. We haven't seen any black bears yet, but it's been great to walk the trails. There are plenty of spaces to stop at designated areas at the side of the road plus larger car parks. Restrooms are available in the larger car parks plus along several of the trails. Only 1 of the campgrounds was open when we visited.

We were really lucky with the weather, bright blue skies and sunshine, after recent snowfall.

A great place to visit with really helpful rangers in the visitor centre. Some truly spectacular views and sights.

For my nature and adventure lovers Yosemite is a must place to visit. I went during summer and the water levels were crazy high which created a beautiful waterfall scenery. It provides camping sites as well as many miles to explore. It takes at least 3-4 days to appreciate all that Yosemite has to offer so please plan ahead.
Brilliant, lots of scenery, and you can see the rock climbers climbing up el captain. That's them small figures on the photos

Amazing scenery! The Mirror Lake is dry due to drought and the burnt trees are visible along the way. They practice safety for everyone.  It’s a beautiful experience to explore the beauty of Yosemite National Park.
This place is good for who loves waterfalls, I have seen this place when there were more waterfalls, this place has more night camping, more parking lots, picnic area and hiking area and trails more…

I took the south entrance in--winding high mountain roads is not for the faint of heart. Delighted there was another way out.

Though the stress of driving totally replaced by the beauty in the Valley. Love being on the Valley floor where every turn produced another incredible view.

Went in April. Few crowds and before the wild flowers started to bloom.
honestly a hi-light of my trip, the photo does not do the place justice…. if you are anywhere near Yosemite just go, i promise you will not be dissapointed

Yosemite is beyond amazing.
I would strongly suggest doing as much research as you can, I thought I had but it wasn't enough.
I struggled to navigate around with the map presented at the gate but was able to use Google maps to help.
I also found some of the trail heads/signs a little confusing, for example I thought I was hiking to the upper Yosemite Falls but instead hiked to Columbia rock.
**I was surprised by the lack of people thinking without bear spray and I encountered the same bear twice during my time there, I think bear spray is a good idea just in case☺️

Despite some of the confusion in finding my way around it was well worth it. The veiws are amazing.
**My favorite was definitely the Glacier Point look out. It gives you a bird's eye view of the park essentially. This road is open at select times so check on that a head of time.
Also... Be prepared to be patient, there are lots of people.
Also- don't leave your trash, the amount of purposefully place trashed I found left behind was incredibly sad😢
This is a must. I spent there 5 days hiking and enjoying every minute. I loved it.

This park is huge! We spent all day yesterday, and still did not cover it all. From the pristine lakes, to the drop your stomach cliff views, to the picturesque and grand sequoia trees you will not be disappointed in your visit. Make sure you have room on your camera or phone because you will be taking many photos!
Definitely worth a visit. Remember to book tickets in advance. The huge rocks are breathtaking. You can drive one way trough the park and see most of it in one day if you don't wanna hike.

The adventure of a lifetime!

I visited with my children and service dog on April 12, 2022, on April 13, 2023, and on August 19, 2023; using my lifetime military veteran national park pass.

All three times we have been so far were absolutely amazing!

We took almost the same exact epic photo at Glacier Point three times so far over the years!

Yosemite National Park is a photographer’s paradise!

The spring was a nice time to visit because of the greenery, the cool temperature and the abundance of flowing water at the falls. When we visited in late summer, Yosemite Falls was considerably less spectacular but magnificent nonetheless!

Life and Mother Nature are absolutely amazing and this special place just reminds us of this fact!

Last year, we hiked the Mirror Lake Trail. This year, we hiked the Nevada Falls Mist Trail.

Our Portuguese Water Dog service animal Mack made our visit so much more special!

The views are absolutely spectacular. It’s nice to drive through the park, but even more fun and special when fully experiencing by hiking it! There were many campsites as well. I’ll have to do that next time!

Every encounter we had was incredibly positive! It was really nice exchanging stories with travelers, couples and families from all over the country and world!

Please see separate entries for the individual hikes at Yosemite National Park.

We will be returning very soon!

Iconic national park well worth a visit in summer when the snowmelt creates spectacular waterfalls and rapids in fast flowing rivers. Home to the famous El Capitan and numerous other giant granite mountains. The park roads are excellent and the campsites well appointed. Due to its unique nature it is extremely popular and campsites are booked out months in advance.

Was there only for one day, but it was soooo worth it! Loved the experience, even though I did not go hiking. Would go there again.
Only downside was the parking situation and the waiting lines for the food. I would advice to bring food instead.
Yosemite was an awesome place all along!! Our clients loved their experience with us at American Limo.
Really beautiful national park. It is 30$ per car and parking was very difficult during the weekend. We had to wait around 40min-1hr to get parking. Make sure to arrive early to avoid delays

Very beautiful regardless what season I was there. Winter is tougher in terms of walking on the ice, but it is less crowded and so cooling, we never felt the need to drink water after our 3 hours hike. We took a Amtrak bus-train-bus from San Francisco to Curry Village, the whole trip was awesome and we didn't need to worry about driving on snow! So happy. Was there during 13-15 dec!

BEAUTIFUL. The only downside of this park is the crazy traffic. Sometimes the crowd were so intense that it felt like we were in an amusement park instead of a national park. I would definitely go back, but maybe in the "off season". This is such a big park, you need at least a week to see everything you want to see, more than that if you plan to hike everything you want yo hike.

I was just reminiscing with my husband about our trip in January 2020 and just how absolutely beautiful Yosemite is! The drive up is not for the faint of heart or inexperienced driver, but if you get the chance GO!

Amazing place. You will forget the technological and busy world around you and get yourself immersed in the nature while you are there. Unfortunately I didn’t find any camping sites as it was a last minute plan for me. The waterfalls are also great

The beauty is everything that's spoken of by everyone that's ever visited. Even with portions of the park being closed, there's plenty to explore. Parking can get strenuous later in the morning, but that's to be expected. If you're planning on going to any of the waterfall sites, bring jackets.

We took a 3 day trip to Yosemite this last week. Wanted to experience the waterfalls in all their glory as well as the rivers. What a difference a year makes after a great winter.
Yosemite valley was packed not my idea of camping at it's best. Stayed at the tenaya lodge, and the wawona. Great time to visit. The rivers are off limits at this time to swim, and Tioga pass is still closed as of the date of this post.
Will return to visit toulome meadows and Bodie.

Went on Sunday, November 13th. It was such a beautiful time to go. There’s snow but the good amount of snow that you don’t need snow chains. Definitely recommend going around this time. There wasn’t a lot of people. Which was a huge plus.

Yosemite is my favorite place on earth.  I love to go in the spring when the waterfalls and rivers are full.  Make sure you take the time to go to Glacier Point.  It’s a bit of a drive even though it is right above the village.  If you’re in shape, you can walk to it.  The view from there is spectacular.  Also make sure to visit one of the groves of Redwoods nearby.
Our visit to Yosemite was specifically about my daughter having her dream wedding photos, and Yosemite didn't disappoint! We started before sunrise and finished at sunset.

Took a day trip from San Francisco to Yosemite National Park. The park is absolutely gorgeous. There’s so much to see, I need to come back and spend a few days. I was able to see El Captain, and Half Dome (which was relatively close together). Definitely recommend visiting!
Good place to go on a trip!!

No matter the time of year, Yosemite always boasts breathtaking beauty. With stunning vistas that look different every time you cast your gaze upon them, this natural wonder never fails to surprise and delight visitors, whether the sun is shining or the clouds are rolling in.
Yosemite falls is tallest waterfall in North America, must visit the other falls like bridal veil too, tunnel point had best views for photos. Overall very nice, you'll feel at one with nature.
Simply the most beautiful, majestic place on the Earth. If you haven't been it's worth the effort to experience Yosemite.

Put this on your bucket list if you've not visited it already! Breathtaking views, hikes for all fitness levels and jaw dropping landscapes. You'll need good hiking boots with walking socks, water, snacks and first aid kit. And of course, plenty of layers +bug spray to keep your warm or protected from the elements. There are public restrooms but be prepared for queues during peak season. Oh, and being waterproof gear no matter the weather. There'll be waterfalls you'll be tempted to explore!

Some of the shuttles and roads were closed that were not listed as closed,  however,  it was still an amazing experience.  Loved hiking with lower Yosemite falls.  Was an easy hike with the opportunity to hop on and over boulders of you desire.  Great for kids and families.  Water was still flowing well.  If course you have to see tunnel view as well.  The annual pass for all national parks is 80 bucks,  admission to Yosemite is 35.  I recommend getting the national parks pass.  Wear hiking shoes if you have them and warm socks.  Bring a change of socks in case they get wet.

The best place to be. All worries are tossed to the wayside. The breathtaking views are unforgettable. I love Yosemite! Spring is the best time to come to see majestic waterfalls. Summer is the best time to swim in cool waters.
The valley is so beautiful in the fall and much less crowded. It was really cool to see the rock climbers' headlamps at night.

I’ve had a far better experience here than I could have ever expected. It’s so beautiful and very well kept. The entry fee varies from $20 a person to $70 for an annual pass. There are free entry’s for military, permanent disability’s, and 4th graders. There is plenty to see and do here for the whole family. That includes breakfast, lunch, and dinner options, a small grocery store, ice cream shop, ice skating, and gift shops. There are countless trails scattered across the park. If you’re visiting for winter I highly recommend you bring some snow chains for your tires. They didn’t make us put them on but occasionally it is required. If you want to stay in the park you should put in a reservation at least a few months in advance. They stay full and if you want to lock in a specific spot you’ll need to do so in advance.
My son made it to the top of ½ Dome in one day. I made it to the cables. The water is clean and the falls are beautiful.

Around every bend there's another breathtaking view.  The sequoia trees themselves are so majestic. The only disappointment was we went during the dry season. Very little water. We went after the fire we could see the damage and devastation that the fire had brought. But it is a beautiful sight to behold.
A little crowded but an absolutely beautiful place

The most beautiful,absolutely breathtaking national park !!!
The scenery,waterfalls,trees...it's all so incredible !!!
Unforgettable experience.A must see destination for nature lovers !!!

Yosemite National Park is an awe-inspiring and breathtaking destination. The snow melts generously, filling the waterfalls to their brim, creating a majestic spectacle. The valleys are adorned with beautiful purple and white flowers, while lush green meadows attract graceful butterflies.

Our recent one-day trip to Yosemite left an indelible mark on our memories. The water flow this year was truly remarkable, and we had the privilege of hiking the mist trail. As we walked along the trail, it felt as though we were enveloped in a torrential downpour, refreshed by the mist's embrace. The view from the waterfall's pinnacle was simply breathtaking. With an array of activities spanning over 14 miles and a journey of more than 350 miles, our Father's Day weekend was a fulfilling adventure.

However, it is essential for the National Park Service (NPS) to reevaluate their parking arrangements. The influx of cars allowed into the park often leads to congestion at the valley entrance, compelling visitors to park farther away and rely on shuttle buses. Unfortunately, the frequency and capacity of these shuttles do not align with the number of park visitors.

To address this concern, I propose the following measures to the NPS:

1) Increase the parking capacity within the park to accommodate a greater number of vehicles, alleviating parking-related issues.
2) Consider implementing a system to regulate the park's visitor count, such as reintroducing a reservation system. This will help manage the flow of visitors and prevent overcrowding.
3) Ensure that the frequency and capacity of the shuttle buses are adjusted to cater to the number of visitors, enabling efficient transportation throughout the park.

Given the significance of these issues, it would be beneficial to bring them to the attention of the park superintendent. By proactively addressing these concerns, we can enhance the overall visitor experience and ensure the long-term sustainability of Yosemite National Park.
Being from NOLA with not a hill for hundreds of miles, we were in awe by such amazing structures all around us.

Yosemite is stunning. Unfortunately, while we were there one of the main roads leading to the best lookouts was closed and it seems to have reopened. We enjoyed a few days of hiking the trails in late fall but did get some early season snow fall, but the lack of crowds was great during this time. Highly recommend staying at the nicer hotel so you can enjoy their breakfast and dinners as the other options are very weak, especially for breakfast.

The waterfalls are ROCKING now, it’s so exciting to see.  There is a lot of construction, so that is a bummer but it needs to be done.  Glacier Point road, Bridalveil Falls lot, purple shuttle, and Ahwahnee dining room are all being worked on.  Took us 44 minutes to ride green shuttle to get to a spot that purple shuttle would have taken 10 to get to.  Get to entrance as early as you can to get a parking spot.  There are tributary creeks to Merced River that are flowing faster now than the Merced during drought years!

You cannot do this place in one day or two days or 3 days take a week this is an absolute gorgeous location ran into absolutely zero issues went at the perfect time of the year.
No regrets none at all the only regret I have is my husband is no longer here for us to revisit this gorgeous land

Why haven't you visit there? Amazing scenery will overwhelm you. And also a fine place for a family picnic but you should think about the distance. So you may want to plan a several day trip. There are lots to see as well as some doable things like rafting.

We will definitely come back here to enjoy the natural beauty. It is better to come in spring or fall, because in summer it is very hot, so if you are going in summer, choose light and comfortable clothes, because you will have to walk a lot. Be sure to take a drink and a snack because there is not much choice within the park.
In addition to the tallest trees, you can see waterfalls, it is an incredible sight, unfortunately we did not have time to see everything in one day, so we plan to return 🏞️
It was a quick trip that was filled with awe. Yosemite will take your breath away. I had fun meeting other photographers, always friendly. Can't wait until the next trip.
Yosemite is a beautiful place! Well worth the visit! Be sure to make an entry reservation during June. Traffic can be crazy!

Dude! I’m still mind blown at what I saw in the valley! Nothing bad to say. Grounds crew was out making sure the foot paths were debris free. Backcountry trails were active with lots of long trail backpackers making their way through YNP.

For any nature lovers Yosemite is a paradise. One can not get enough of it in one visit. One  can visit it time and again to connect with one's soul. It's a gem, a place to find oneself and connect with raw nature. From rocky mountains , waterfalls, ancient trees, wild flowers, snow, lakes, just name it and it has all. California has so much to offer one can not imagine without paying a visit to this god's own forest. It has something for everyone. Green meadows, snow covered peaks, jaw dropping beautiful lakes and what not. One can hike, trek, drive or just sit and enjoy the nature's bounty. It's so vast that every time one visits it offers fresh  perspective of Life, beauty and nature.

I arrived late at night during the full moon. I saw a couple of coyotes, a fox, and a mule deer buck on the drive into the valley. I set up to take pictures of the stars over Yosemite Valley. The Merced River was at 9 feet at the gaging station near Yosemite Falls and over 7 feet on the way up to Vernal Falls. I have never seen so much water in all my visits to the park.

Yosemite National Park is a true gem of nature's grandeur. From the moment I stepped foot in this majestic wonderland, I was captivated by its awe-inspiring beauty. The park's towering granite cliffs, cascading waterfalls, and ancient sequoia trees create a landscape that feels like it's straight out of a dream.

As an avid hiker, I was thrilled to explore the countless trails that wind through Yosemite. Each path offered a unique adventure, leading me to hidden gems and breathtaking viewpoints. The hike to Half Dome was a personal highlight, rewarding me with panoramic vistas that left me speechless.

But Yosemite is not just for the adventurous souls. It's a place where one can find solace and tranquility amidst nature's embrace. I spent hours simply sitting by the Merced River, listening to the soothing sounds of water and feeling a sense of peace wash over me. It was a reminder of the power and serenity that nature can provide.

The wildlife in Yosemite is abundant and diverse. From deer gracefully grazing in meadows to elusive bears roaming the forests, every encounter felt like a privilege. I was reminded of the importance of preserving these habitats and ensuring the continued existence of these magnificent creatures.

And let's not forget the night sky in Yosemite. Away from the city lights, the stars shone brilliantly, painting the sky with their celestial glow. I found myself mesmerized by the vastness of the universe, feeling humbled and connected to something greater than myself.

Yosemite National Park is a place that leaves an indelible mark on your soul. It's a sanctuary where nature's beauty knows no bounds. Whether you're an outdoor enthusiast, a nature lover, or simply seeking a peaceful escape, Yosemite will exceed your expectations. It's a place that reminds us of the wonders that exist in our world and the importance of preserving them for future generations.

I wholeheartedly recommend Yosemite National Park to anyone seeking an unforgettable experience. Prepare to be amazed, inspired, and forever changed by the sheer magnificence of this natural wonder.
It's absolutely gorgeous but you have to get there early before the crowds grow. If you hike half dome I suggest you start at 5 am. It's totally worth it!!!!

A truly breathtaking and awesome place. So much to take in and be grateful for. Even in pouring rain, Yosemite valley was wonderful. It sounded, and smelled amazing. The dense fog hanging over was beautiful, although a little scary to drive through at times. There are endless possibilities to explore here.
Amazing national park to experience in California. Good areas to camp if wanted and also great amount of quality trails to hike.

Went there after it had just reopened after being closed for several weeks because of the many storms that had reaked havoc on the area. Most of the park was open and beautiful. Roads were mostly open and cleared of snow. Unless you want to do a lot of hiking park at the lot near the store  and take the shuttle. Well worth the trip.

Yosemite is a great place for getting close to the natures. Those big and old trees, mountains, water falls and the giant rocks… all brought us a great memories!! This National park is totally well organized and preserved. It’s not difficult to find a parking lot, and you can get water easily. All in all, it is a nice place for families and people who want to challenge themselves!

Yosemite is number 2 on my favorite national parks list, going in the winter is the absolute best, except that a lot of the trails are closed. Seeing the snowfall on the trees is beautiful. The park stores have vegan options and they are marked, not overpriced either.

An incredible park with so much to do with something for everyone — very accessible hikes to hardcore ones. Tuolumne Meadows and Yosemite valley have multiple options for picnic, hiking, biking, and other activities. Yosemite valley is well connected by shuttle. It does however get very busy so try to avoid the peak season if possible.
Very beautiful and big national Park. Big highlight of california. We hiked the Vernal and Nevada falls via mist trail. It was about 6 hours with some breaks on nice spots like Vernal falls.

Breathtaking views, beautiful water falls and a great place for trekking. Overall this place is worth visit by anyone who visits California. Make sure you book things in advance to make sure you get parking and stay atleast 2 days to cover the attractions.

We came to Yosemite from the Bay Area, a 4-hour ride. The nature here is amazing and definetely w must see.
We did hiking for just 2 hours. It was a great experience to do hiking in this stunning area. We regret that we did not come earlier because we had to ne nd our hiking before the sunset. I think coming before 11am is the best choice to have the best experience. I am looking forward to visiting here again with friends.
One of the top 10 US National Parks. A+

I have been this place for 6 times now .. I will love to visit again and again .. since this place is so close to my heart and so entertaining. Best place to hike in the world . Must hiking place is half dome

It had been...10 years or more since I was here last. The last time was in the middle of that long drought, the water was dried up, and the trees had yet to recover from.the recent fires. Now...wow. glad I got to see it so flush and flourishing.

Yosemite is one of my family's favorite camping places to visit! We visited on May 19th and... WOW! This has to be one of the best years for Yosemite with all the water and snow melt happening.  We also got to see a bear a couple of times throughout our trip, so amazing! If you do visit and happen to get lucky enough to see a bear, please do not feed them... if they come back at a later time looking for food and hurt someone, they could be put down. :-(  We are spoiled with living so close and getting to visit often, and I can honestly say that this was easily one of our most memorable visits ever! Can't wait to come back in a month or so! Yes, it's summer now, so there are a TON of people and crowds and lines...if you do not like crowds, you may be better off visiting in the fall or winter months (still just as beautiful and breathtaking). It is also pet friendly,  but for the love of all things good... Please pick up after your animals and DO NOT LEAVE TRASH EVERYWHERE (no trash can nearby? Bring an extra trash bag and pack it out with you)! Let's all try to do our part and keep this majestic place beautiful for others to enjoy as well!

With unprecedented experiences in my life. At night, I sleep in the middle of the mountains and forests, and during the day, I live in the quiet and vast space of nature.  Experience these relaxing moments in the middle of the Yosemite mountains that are unforgettable!

I very much enjoyed my time even though it was misty and rainy while we were there the views were breathtaking!!!
The photos couldn’t capture just how beautiful it was… you definitely have a better visibility with your eyes than the camera when the weather is rainy.

It was spout $30 to park for the week

Multiple locations for hike, camp and waterfall views!

I cannot wait to go back and camp! Love it!

Yosemite is beautiful. However there is a bit of a trade off. It has become very touristy so parking is difficult if you are not hitting the trail before 0800.  It is a big giant loop so if you miss your end point, you have to go all the way around.

The food at Yosemite valley base camp was actually fairly priced and good. I will say, if you want to do some of the major hikes I would start early. The harder trails do get busy and I do not think many people understand how tough they are and as a result later in the day you have a lot of people turning around or resting on narrow passes.

The visit was amazing!
The views are breathtaking!
Nature in all his glory!
watch my photos and look for my profile on
Instagram for more recommendations :)

I tried  Four mile trail and it was adequate for beginners. We arrived 7:45AM and buying America the Beautiful annual pass was really easy at the entrance with credit card only. Yosemite Falls parking lot has enough space and hiking took 3.5hrs to go up. Walking down is bit harder because of heat from sun up the sky. But it all worths trying and I saw a baby BEAR at the returning way!!
Absolutely breathtaking! The pictures I took just don't do justice. The air was clean, I could breathe! My kids had a blast exploring and playing in the snow. Can't wait to go back!

Sadly I did not spend as much time as I wanted to here, but there really are no negatives for me! It’s the most beautiful NP. Wonderful lakes, mountains, hiking trails. You definitely need about 2-3 days here to be able to really explore and see Yosemite. If you enjoy the outdoors, walking, hiking, ect, then this is the place for you!

Yosemite is really one WOWWW after another El Capitan, half dome Cathedral Rocks, Yosemite Falls, BridalVeil Falls is just unbelievable . you'll see photos never do justice to it's incredible beauty . Views from Glacier point provide breathtaking views of halfdome and elcapitan . It doesn’t seem real when you stand looking out at its beauty. Make sure you go to glacier point worth the drive up there!  Glacier point is magic!
Gorgeous 😍 Everywhere you turn is a new and beautiful view. Everything from El Capitan to Half Dome to all of the amazing waterfalls  it is one of the most beautiful places I've ever been to.

This park is absolutely incredible! Great for families and the solo traveler! You do need a reservation if you want to enter the park between 6am and 430pm. I recommend getting to the park early and doing your number 1 trail first thing to get somewhat solitude. The park will get busy as the morning goes on. Definitely recommend this park!
Absolutely stunning park - a real bucket list moment for me. Seeing the gigantic sequoia trees and hiking around the gorgeous mountains was a dream come true. Can’t recommend enough.

An amazing National park even though in the winter the time everything go withered. The ground is a little slippery so be careful!! The views are extremely awesome!! We just drove around the Yosemite valley road and which is kind of relaxing. Do not overspending because 21 bears got killed by overspending car each year from the National park police officer. Worth to visit :)
It's the most beautiful place I have ever seen in my life.  Nature is so pure and incredible!
Beautiful!  Stay inside the park if you can.  Enjoy the early morning peace & beauty!  Use the bus, always!

The views are spectacular beyond belief you have to experience it for yourself a picture does not do it justice. We spent four days there and still didn't experience everything. Outstanding place to go to be in Nature.

This park was absolutely phenomenal! There is a reason why this became the first national park. The scenery was beautiful. There is just one thing that led to one less star for me. I went with my sister and she almost died at the Roosevelt trail. While walking on the trail, her leg got pierced by something. This caused her to faint and almost die. So if you are deciding to go here, make sure to be wary around your surroundings and be careful not to be pierced with anything... Even if it looks harmless or is on trails. But overall, as I said, amazing scenery! You will enjoy the park with all of its beauty.

Gorgeous scenery all around, and some cool hiking spots, ranging from easy to difficult. The waterfalls were the selling point for me at least. Also the giant sequoia trees and wildlife. We saw some bears here. Also deer.

Get your hot fresh BIG ORANGE TREES here!!

Local recommendation: enter from the east- Lee Vining to Tioga Pass. The majesty of the Eastern Sierras is so unique with sparse vegetation clinging to towering cliffsides and high altitude plains. Watching the landscape morph into lush forests and meadow-bound lakes is flooring. An unparalleled sense of scale is provided by traveling down from those same peaks now looming over your lake-side picnic.

Yosemite Park is one of the wonders of the world and should not be missed if you ever get a chance to go. I've been several times and every time is great. The only complaint, of course, is the number of people. By instituting a reservation system they have cut back on the crowding but also made it difficult to visit the park. One should plan ahead and go because it is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity

Gorgeous - If you're anywhere near Yosemite you should visit. Such a beautiful park, we went there last month .The Dawn Wall , El Cap, and Half Dome are all relatively close together which makes viewing.

We had a beautiful time taking in the nature. Coming in from the East was difficult because of the high altitude. My poor Nissan Versa couldn’t handle it so well. It’s a beautiful park though! I highly recommend it
Incredibly beautiful! I also highly recommend the Upper Yosemite Fall Trail!

Absolutely amazing hike to Vernal & Nevada Falls it is rated hard, but it is worth it! You will get wet, I did take an extra pair of Sox and shoes and I am glad I did walked under a water fall in order to continue.

We ride our motorcycles through here every year if we can get to it. Amazing vistas outstanding asphalt. Especially good this year I think with the restricted nature of access. Meaning you need to get a reservation it seem like they were less people. A lot of roadwork going on right now so be ready for delays. Still worth it

Yosemite is the most beatiful natural scenery I have ever seen. Everything looks like out of this world. I recommend to arrive early in the morning to avoid crowds, but even after noon when it is packed, you can find a parking spot and use shuttle to move around.

Tunnel view is amazing for sunset but it gets crowded so m try to reach early. You get a panoramic view of the valley.
Absolutely breathe taking!! If you get the opportunity to see this magnificent place in person, DO IT. Pictures do not do it justice.

The park is beautiful! It would be nice if there were signs indicating how far to your destination along the drive. But, we had an amazing time and the pictures look like a painting! Absolutely beautiful!
This place need to review because you gotta see it to believe it. Its a sight for sore eyes. Breath taking and just stunningly beautiful. Will definitely come again.
Beautiful place, plenty of rest areas and Restrooms.  Many great views and trails. El Capitan, Brideveil falls, half dome and others were spectacular.   Recommend highly.

One of the best national parks across the country. Amazing views and so many trails ( family friendly and challenging ).

Easily accessible with so many parking slots but get so busy during holidays.

35$ for regular entry ( per vehicle ) good for 7 days.

There's no way to not be in awe of all of the park's majesty and grandeur. It leaves you speechless. Fortunately, we were able to get into the park. There were still areas closed, but it's still worth a visit. What's great is that there were very few people there. It's almost like we had the whole park to ourselves. What great memories we made!

What an incredible place!  We spent our time in the valley, hiked 4 mile trail and camped in Camp 4.  A little smokey due to proximity of a forest fire but it was mostly cleared up by noon.  The camp site was perfect for a first time visit.  We hope to visit again

SPECTACULAR National Park!! Gorgeous waterfalls, mountains and cliffs, amazing views no matter where you look. El Capitan, Half Dome, so amazing to see in person! The water flows are powerful to watch. Glacier Point was still closed and so is Tioga Pass, so if you’re getting to the other side of Cali, it’s a bit of a trip.

I have been to a lot of National parks and Yosemite is one of my top favorites! Make sure you take the drive up to glaciers point to get unforgettable photos/views of half dome! The road is a bit narrow and looks sketchy but I promise you won’t regret it!
As a first time visitor in the area it was very nice and very friendly and beautiful. We the whole family will be there soon.
It is a beautiful place to visit even in fall, but with expectations that the mirror lake and the waterfalls are almost dry.

Amazing views. Lots of parking but may have to walk some to the view of the falls. If you’re a hiker, MUST EXPERIENCE this place. Some holes are not for the weary. Definitely have right shoes and please of water if you plan on hiking to the upper falls. A 3.7 mile hike will take about 6-8 hours. Countless turn backs and as many beautiful views.
Another bucket list item.

Wonderful NP in California. Can spend one to two days here easily. Have lots of trails, walking routes, cycling paths... Lots of scenic spots to fill the cameras. The lower Yosemite falls, curry village, awahene lodge etc. are must visits. If you come with family or friends, have lots of activities to do here. Can get into water in the river in the middle of the village.

Beautiful outdoor national park. Would recommend others to come. In order to do it justice and see everything you need to come for multiple days. We loved the upper and lower falls. They are just beautiful.  You can definitely see God's artwork in forming them
One of the best nature sites to go and visit,  had the pleasure to experience sunrise, sunset, hiking here as well as saw a couples vows
Beautiful day every time!

Went early and beat the crowd.  Very important to arrive 6 am or before while several entrances are closed due to fire.  Reservations required except for locals 'passing through.'  We left this time after lunch and they line was 2 + miles long.  What took less than 3 minutes at 6 took over any hour at noon.
The park is, of course, magnificent even partially shut down.  The tunnel view at dawn is wonderful.  People friendly.  Vendors a bit worn out and lunch at then lodge seemed overpriced.  The lodge is a must see.  Otherwise, the views, meadows and streams, half done and El capitan were incredible.  Many foreign tourists were fun to observe.  In all, go early.

Wow.  You won’t be disappointed.  That’s why so many people come here.

Bring your walking shoes and extra water because you will want to see everything.

There’s a bus that can take you to different spots- runs about every 10 minutes or so- but can be longer based on traffic.

Very pleased to learn that the lifetime pass for Permanently Disabled Americans was offered at no charge. It will allow free entry to most passengers in the same car, at all National Parks for life. The park is always beautiful but this visit, with a recent snow fall, was magical. Dec 2nd 2022. No lines, plenty of areas to pull over and take spectacular photos. The falls were gorgeous. The roads well cared for and plenty of park rangers around helping cars that needed assistance. The Big Oak Flat gas station was closed but we found another near by in El Portal.  There are no gas station in the park.
Yosemite is amazing. The amount of humanity inside of it on any one day is not awesome.
Very nice place with nature

Beautiful park probably the best in the world . Most stunning big walls in the world with a low valley lying through them . Loved hiking up half dome but nearly killed off my sister walking for 10 hours.  But I can't recommend it more . Must visit .

Beautiful place with loads of trails, lakes, waterfalls, and rivers! Go hiking and find some amazing views, walk up next to a waterfall and get cooled off, float down the river on a raft or kayak, enjoy nature! Loved this place and wish we had more time to spend in it!

Magnificent- is the perfect word to describe this place. Massive rocks, huge sequoia trees and majestic mountains. It’s the perfect escapade from every days routine.

A short walk and you will see the highest falls in America: the Yosemite falls.

Make sure to stop by tunnel point to have a full view of most famous landmark such as the half dome.

Restrooms available at the Yosemite lodge.

Beautiful park. Made it into the valley this time and enjoyed the Yosemite Falls hike. Was impressed by the shop and restaurant facilities available in the valley. Enjoyed the drive from Lee Vining, so many beautiful places to stop along the way. You don't even need to go into the valley to enjoy beautiful hikes or clear water.
The top of the waterfall is very worth seeing. It takes 2.5 hours to go up and 2 hours to go down. It climbs from 1020 meters to 2040 meters above sea level, but it is very worthwhile.

How could one ever describe the beauty and wonderment of this National Park. The insane amount of amenities, camp grounds, tours, public transit, maintained trails and information goes above and beyond anywhere else. Only drawbacks are the insane crowds.
Beautiful scenery; able to enjoy pleasant views by car and by foot. Largely barren of concessions for a large park which is nice; plan accordingly for longer visits.
This park is breathtaking… the colours are so bright, the smell is so nice and calming… stayed for 2 days, but would definitely go back to spend more time there.

everything is very beautiful!  It was the first time I went on a hiking trip.  I would like to return to be able to climb half dome.  This was the first place where I was able to see snow falling from the sky for the first time.

It’s heaven in the earth . Rock structures are mesmerizing. I love ❤️ this national park . There are many segments under this park .
There is entry fee to this park that you need to pay to get pass .
Very beautiful in spring time.

Yosemite is an overwhelmingly beautiful landscape filled with forests, mountains, cliffs waterfalls, rivers, and mist. The options on how you interact with those features are endless. There are many campgrounds in the park but most will sell out months in advance. Same thing with the cabins, you must reserve sites early! There are two free shuttles in the park - green which runs valley wide, and purple which serves only the most popular eastern end. Aim to at least visit Lower Yosemite Falls, Vernal Falls, Happy Isles, and Glacier Point in a day or two to hit many major highlights. If you really want a proper test, attempt Half Dome but only if you can get a permit! Arrive at the park very early to be guaranteed a parking spot, otherwise you'll be walking a long ways or be overly dependent on the shuttle.

Yosemite national park is one of the best national parks in California. It has a great view and waterfalls up the Yosemite valley. We had the visit during the early January and it was still snowing up in the mountains, which all for the great and beautiful view of the mountains covered in snow. They were a lot of families and kids doing their winter sports and activities. The roads were icy, yet still safe to drive with all the precautions
Really enjoyed our visit during the winter and would be going back in the summertime
The drive and the journey to get up to the Yosemite national Park through the Yosemite Valley is just amazing and picturesque

One of the great wonders of the world.
I have to add in part because of construction and ongoing improvements... the signage was terrible.  The park maps given out are grossly out of date.  Things on the map don't exist... Things you know are there are not on the map.
There appears to be a problem at the fundamental level.
But that being said...
It's a 50/50 split on these negative issues vs the amazing job the park service does here given the volume of guests.
The Natural Beauty of this park goes without saying...
If you keep your cool... ignore the speeders (I wonder... why drive from Florida... to see Yosemite... then drive 10 mph above the limit focusing on the road rather than the park). Even the speed limit is too fast at times to take in the sights.
As you can see from my photos... forest fires in the region have created a lack of clarity.
Winter time is a bit different, summer time is better.
More than beautiful, this is a must experience for all mankind

I know in 2022. There were major fires and this year 2023 There has been a storm that dropped the most snow at Yosemite and the park is doing It's best to keep Visitors Safe and still being able to visit the park some roads have been down to single lane due to damage from the storms driving in to the park you can. See a lot of fire damage.  But also the logging companies are taking all the dead trees. It is still a beautiful and majestic drive i'm placed to see things not a lot of parking And that is including handicap parking, I'm in a wheelchair and it's difficult to get around I visited my daughter Who works there at yosemite and that's the reason why I came up.
Fantastic experience this year (2023). All the waterfalls were full, and the landscape was lush. Everyone was in good spirits.

One of the most amazing natural places I have ever seen! We visited the park for one day because we wanted to see the giant sequoias in Mariposa Groove! We underestimated how huge the park is. Next time we come to California, we will stay in this area for at least five days. It’s so worth it! There is a free Shuttle Bus available. We paid 35$ entry for a car valid for 7 days. We saw just 1/1000 from the park and it was stunning and breathtaking! I definitely need to come back and discover the “entire” park!
Lost a mirror because of their large metal poles angled to the road. Everything is all on the side going west, all points and flats. Would not recommend to go east.

I can see why Yosemite is one of the most visited and popular National Parks. The scenary is just breathtaking in all seasons.

It's best to go during low tourist season so you can truly enjoy the beauty of nature at its finest.

Yosemite is one of the most iconic sights in the United States. I have been twice and both times I walked away amazed. There are loads of hiking paths so if you're going to explore make sure you come prepared with snacks and lots of water.
Ive been to over 20 NP’s in the US and close to 100 worldwide and Yosemite is still my favorite ❤️!

Very few places can take your breath away like Yosemite. The views the scale and nature are just amazing. I recommend taking a few days and trying to get as many of the trails as possible 12/10 amazing park

One of the most beautiful parks I have seen! A handicap placard gives you permission to drive right to the base of many of the sights. (Grizzly Giant and Half Dome, among others). Very clean and beautiful!

Yosemite national park definitely a must when in California! It’s absolutely breathtaking. Me and my partner attempted the upper Yosemite falls hike we hike for 6 hours in total there and back we did not make it and only because we started to late we didn’t want to be there when it was pitch black. But so much fun and so much to do a couple days is just not enough

I don't even know where to begin. Yosemite is by far one of the best National Parks out there. Once you are there, you get a sense of calm and your body and mind are suddenly at ease. The air, night sky, mountains, valley's and everything else is unlike any other! The views are to die for and so much to do for individuals who are a bit more adventurous and even families with young ones. There are very strenuous hikes for those who seek them (like Half Dome which I completed!), more moderate ones with fantastic views with easy and accesible paths for all and so much to do for those with young children too, like the Valley Floor. The backcountry here is gorgeous! This National Park has it all and checks off anything you are looking for from an outdoor trip! This place is heaven on Earth and is definitely a trip I will be repeating. I think I have found my favorite place on Earth! Anyone who can, should experience this part of our beautiful country and what I think is one of the best National Parks out there!!!
Everything you thought it would be, and more. Breathtaking scenery, great accomodation and helpful staff. Don’t miss it!
Fantastic nature. Beautiful waterfalls and forests. Yosemite Valley was awesome. Kids friendly. It was very peaceful in 2nd week of March. Not very crowded during our visit.

BeaYosemite National Park is an awe-inspiring natural wonder that captivates the soul with its majestic granite cliffs, breathtaking waterfalls, and lush meadows. The park's iconic landmarks, such as El Capitan and Half Dome, stand as testaments to the sheer beauty of Mother Nature. Whether you're an avid hiker exploring the challenging trails or a leisurely stroller enjoying the scenic vistas, Yosemite offers a harmonious blend of adventure and tranquility. The diverse ecosystem, from towering sequoias to diverse wildlife, creates a truly immersive experience. Yosemite National Park is a haven for outdoor enthusiasts, a sanctuary where every visit leaves an indelible mark of wonder and appreciation for the unparalleled wonders of the natural world.utiful
A scenery that cannot be captured on a phone screen Take the opportunity and go see it for yourself. The happiest moment you can feel just by sitting in the mountains

Absolutely gorgeous park .
So many beautiful places and unforgettable views!
Definitely recommended to visit!

Beautiful place too be. Visited in early September (good time) most things open but not super busy. Always able to find a parking spot. If you possibly can stay somewhere in the Yosemite Valley - you can explore from here and not have to travel for hours in your car.
Yosemite National Park is absolutely beautiful! If you love to go on hikes, this is  the best place to go and see the high peeks of yosemite
Awesome! So beautiful and so spacious. One of the best national park. To be absolutely visited

Yosemite is home to the Californian giant sequoia, a rare species of tree that grows to an impressive height. The park also features cliffs and rock formations that are perfect for hiking, as well as numerous waterfalls. The park is great for rock climbing, or during winter visitors can even explore the park on skis, skates or snowshoes. The landscapes in this park are vast—perfect for all kinds of adventures.
Not just a great valley, but a shrine to human foresight, the strength of granite, the power of glaciers, the persistence of life, and the tranquility of the High Sierra.

First protected in 1864, Yosemite National Park is best known for its waterfalls, but within its nearly 1,200 square miles, you can find deep valleys, grand meadows, ancient giant sequoias, a vast wilderness area, and much more.

Like for more..

7 wonders of the world.
Breath taking , amazing, tranquility at its finest,  beyond amazing.
Retreat from the concrete jungle we live in.
With everything going wrong in the world, this is the place to be in right now, honestly.
One of the most stunning places to visit in California. Place to visit multiple times. Great for hiking, photography, kids, camping.

We wee very relieved 120 reopened so we could access Yosemite from Groveland. The park was extra beautiful with the snowpack melting and fueling the waterfalls.
We had a good experiences finding bathrooms when needed. We packed our own lunches in backpacks and ate on our hike. We leaned to arrive early enough for parking (before 8:30 am) and avoided the busy, behind schedule, super packed shuttle.
Don’t forget that 4th graders get in national parks for free! Google it!
Our group of 10 had an amazing week at Yosemite.

This park is absolutely beautiful! I enjoyed going during peak season in the spring, the waterfalls were flowing and the ticketed entry makes the park more enjoyable. The shuttle is nice to get around and runs really late. If you get the chance to drive Tioga pass I definitely suggest it.
Definitely worth to go if you like hiking! We went there in October, it’s a little bit of dry, but the good thing is that nearly all trails are open at that time.
Pretty cool. Hikes of all levels. Would reccomend spending an afternoon at mirror  lake on the first day because of how chill it is.
If there were 10 stars they still wouldn't be enough. Exceptional sceneries all around. It is truly paradise on earth.
Paradise. Any time of the year. 2023 was spectacular after we got good rain in the winter.
Must visit, waterfalls was super.

By far, the prettiest NP I've been to, and we visited quite a few!!!
Give your self at list 4 days there.
The upper part (Tioga Road) is amazing. May lake is beautiful.
If you enter from the west (El Portal), you can use the free shuttle coming from the closest lodge and then you DO NOT need a permit.  The permit is required for entering with your own vehicle.
Highly recommended!!!

Buses 🚌 don't work on this place. The guy who drove the green bus told us to ride the purple one. But no purple buses came. We waited for nothing. The place is crowded on Monday. Lots of tourists. So bathrooms are very dirty and tissues lying all over the floor. This place is magnificent with big tall mountain and blue sky.
Incredible, way too much to see in 2 days! Will definitely be back. We camped at Camp 4 and had a site to ourselves right in the valley on a Tues-Thurs, definitely give the lottery a go.
The hike wasn’t so hard but a lot of incline so be prepared. There’s a water/ restroom area half way up to the water fall.

The place in itself is fabulous, but as often in America, it is ruined by car infrastructures in the name of "accessibility". The wilderness is no more, and most people just hop from hotspot to hotspot in the gas guzzler with minimum effort. It's sad in a way.

What can one say about Yosemite national Park that hasntalready been said. I was fortunate that I visited in the wintertime as I was told by our guide that the crowds and the traffic is light.

It was really amazing! Words fail to describe the majesty. And fortunately, a week prior to my visit, it snowed - and as it warmed up, snow was melting, so the falls were really beautiful.

I visited the park by using a tour service which due to the drive along the winding roads through the Sierra Nevada mountains I highly recommend it. There were a lot of seemingly dangerous curves and the drive seemed somewhat harrowing. I'm glad that I didn't drive myself.

There is a food court in the middle of the park with pizza, burgers, and a few other select food items, in a cafeteria type setting. The food was OK, nothing to write about or to review, and also a bit pricey.

There is also a shuttle that routinely drives back and forth throughout one side of the park roughly every 15 to 30 minutes (check the schedule). so it's easier to see a little bit more and then shuttle back to the lodge area or parking area.

Yosemite is a great place to escape from the hustle and bustle of life. There are hikes for all levels with awe-inspiring views of waterfalls and mountains. Lots of beautiful flowers and don't miss the giant Sequoias! There are two main shopping and food areas: Camp Curry or Yosemite village. You can also pack in your own food and store it in a bear box. We enjoyed the pizza place at Camp Curry. The only thing that was a bit disappointing was that the shuttles are not running as regularly as usual. We often waited 45-60 minutes to be picked up and they were packed full. We stayed in the whited canvas tent cabins in Curry, but there are also more rustic options in the camp grounds or a little more comforts in the cabins in Curry or the Awahnee hotel. This is a great place for a day trip of spend a week with the family. It's cool in the evening and morning but warms up through the day. Bring mosquito spray!
Would highly recommend going to this national park. Very beautiful place to visit. If you are in the area please check it out. You will not be disappointed

The park is incredible. It has many places to stop typical of Yosemite. From hotels to heated tents. I recommend arriving at the park at sunset to appreciate the sunset between the mountains which makes the place unique and beautiful.
Inside Yosemite Valley you can find different food places and a great cafeteria for breakfast.
The cleanliness of the villa is incredible and if you stay at Curry Village, you will have a comfortable bathroom with a hot water shower for bathing.
For hiking, you can go to Nevada Hills where there is a great waterfall 6.0 miles away on foot. This is a moderate to strenuous hike and requires a high level of physical fitness. But the view and the experience is worth every step you take to get there. The trail consists of places to take water and go to the bathroom in between. It is important to wear waterproof clothes because when you get to the waterfall, it expels a lot of rain and you can get soaked.
Breath taking views. Water falls where amazing. The white water river was awesome to see. I am planning a 3 day excursion in the future. So much beauty to take in all at once. Buckets list check!

Gorgeous - one of a kind national park in the US.

If you're anywhere near Yosemite you should visit. The Dawn Wall , El Cap, and Half Dome are all relatively close together which makes viewing and hiking quite easy/a treat.

When we visited there were too many tourists and the trails we're in superb condition.
One of the greatest places on earth! The valley is nice the upper elevation is amazing if you can handle backpacking.

This national park is the best I've visited yet with the family. We spent a whole day there. We loved it so much that we're planning to return every season to witness the transformations. We came back with over 300 family photos, and we're struggling to choose which ones to delete, so we're keeping them all. I highly recommend visiting this place.

One of the most beautiful places. There are well maintained bathrooms and outhouses along or before many of the trails. Everywhere you are there are breathtaking views. Fall is a perfect time to go. I don't recommend going on the summer because there's too many ppl
Amazingly beautiful.  Not enough trams.  Too many people.  Highly recommend going on a Monday or Tuesday off-season.

One of the most stunning places I have seen so far in the US is Yosemite National Park. This location is picturesque, what with the extensive trees and the mountainous terrain. It's a hiker and camper's paradise here, with countless hiking trails and mountains to conquer. Keep whole day to see the yosemite falls, yosemite valley, tunnel view! Just try to get your own food if possible as the food here is not great!

Yosemite is such a beautiful place. Nature has created such breath taking views. Every step/drive is an amazing memory. Reservations is required to enter and should be made one week ahead for the day of. $35 for day use for 3 days is a good deal. We left our home at 7am and arrived at the entrance by 930am. Arriving early is a must so you don't go through the long line and can find parking. The first waterfall we saw entering the park was the Bridalveil Falls. It was beautiful and parking was available along the road to park and take photos. We took the Valley Loop trail. From Yosemite Lodge to the Lower Falls was about 15 minutes. We then took the trail that lead to Mirror Lake. The walk was 2.5 hours. The end point was 😱. You can see Mt. Watkins, Ahwiyah Point and Half Dome. There are mosquitoes, so bug repellent is a must. Will definitely come back and take more trails

Breathtaking sceneries ! This place was just so majestic… it felt straight out of a movie. The hiking trails and viewpoints were amazing. However the hikes were so beautiful and well maintained.
Like all places like these… food was expensive but it wasn’t so bad flavor wise. Definitely worth the time and make sure to enjoy the crispy fresh air. Take a breather and reflect.

Great place to go hike and camp. Beautiful views from Half Dome, it's definitely worth hiking up there. Clean, well maintained trails and you could just feel nature walking with you the whole way. Lots of squirrels saying hi along the way. The hike to Half Dome was eight hours to and back. Along the way you can see three waterfalls, which are breathtaking and beautiful. The trails gradually increase in elevation. Challenging hike for those who aren't physically fit. The waterfalls you are able to just go in, but sometimes can be slippery on the rocks so do be careful. Dogs are allowed here so don't be afraid to bring your pup! Camping is a recommendation, since it's a good price but you need a reservation because of how packed it could get. Very popular place to go.

Yosemite National Park is an absolute gem of nature's grandeur! The park's vast expanse of pristine wilderness offers an immersive experience like no other. The towering granite cliffs, lush meadows, and serene forests create a tranquil environment that invites exploration and wonder. And the waterfalls... oh, the waterfalls! They are simply breathtaking. From the iconic Yosemite Falls to the majestic Bridalveil Fall, each cascade captivates with its sheer beauty and power. Whether you're a seasoned adventurer or a casual nature lover, Yosemite National Park is a must-visit destination that will leave you in awe of the wonders of the natural world.

Would you like a beautiful drive through the mountains? A stunning and groomed cross-country ski track? Hidden dispersed backpacking campsites where you can watch the sun set over halfdome and gather water from a glacial stream?

Yosemite may be the place for you. Its stunning beauty is only matched by the harsh terrain of the backcountry. Stop by if you have a chance, you won't be sorry.

Beautiful Park. But remember to book it in with advance, Otherwise you will not be be able to Enter it between 6am and 5PM. Once you’re in it I recommend to take some food for BBQ as there is Great spot for it in the Valley by the River. BBQ’s and tables for tourists are there.

No other words but “Breath Taking” scenery! Prices were great. Mostly easy access around the park. The pass was closed due to weather on our visit. Wildlife and great trails were a nice bonus.
If you visit during the "dry" season, there's no waterfalls... but we still had a wonderful visit.

Nothing like being in the great outdoors.  However we stayed I'm a tourist type camp where there was tons of people. Not a bad thing just that it felt more like a tourist attraction rather than the experience of being in the great outdoors.  Still though I had a great time and did get the full appreciation of mother nature in all her glory

Well, John Muir was right...this place is special.   Beautiful scenery everywhere you look.   Great trail system.   Busses were busy so a little slow,  but got to all my places.  The hike to the vernal fall footbridge was fun.  Mariposa Grove of bug trees is remarkable.   Enjoy a few photos!
One of my favourite places on earth. Magical and simply spectacular gift from nature. Will come back to this place with my son once he s a bit older and can appreciate more adventures.

Amazing park!

What an awesome place to visit and enjoy nature.  We decided to visit in November because it’s less crowded and there are hotel and RV park spots available.  No matter how much time you spend at the park it will not be enough to explore it.  Wild life was rare due to time of the year but we managed to see some deer, a coyote, and a bear.  We traveled in an RV and found an immediate spot just outside the park.  There are plenty of spaces for class A RVs but I encourage you to try not to bring one to the park.  I had a class A and going down the mountains was as hard as going up.  The roads are very narrow and many times the white line on the edge of the road is also the edge of the cliff.  Diesel and gas aren’t cheap for a class A guzzler.  Expect to pay around $5 per gallon.
Fires destroy everything, be super careful.

Jan 01 2022 one of the best National Parks is US. have not seen much wildlife here, but the view point are awesome.. the tunnel view was great.. went in summer and in winter as well.. loved it both the times.. would love to visit again.. check the road condition before go.. the freeways may be chain free before entering the park.. but you might need chains inside..

One of the most amazing places in the world that I can visit again and again.
It's massive, has some of the most amazing landscapes, water features and wildlife. It's a place I wish I could stay for every day of the rest of my life.
Lovely place to see. Mountains rocks and trees. Gr8 if you love nature. Want to go when waterfalls can be seen, in April. Still worth going lots to see.

Prepare to be amazed by towering views, amazing hikes and everything that is cliche.

Late Spring May
It starts to get warm in the valley so dress and appropriately and have lots of water on your hikes. The mist trail is awesome, if you plan on making it to the top prepair to get soaked. JMT to Nevada falls closed on our trip.

Late Fall November
JMT is perfect for a hike at this time of the year, very few hikers will travel this long path that takes you all the way to the top of Nevada Falls where you can still and have a power snack or lunch, then circle back on the Mist Trail. It gets cold 30°f in the morning and can be icy so being layers.

A beautiful place to visit and hike. Yes, it's crowded, so the best time to visit is early in the season (May). The hike from Curry Village to Vernal Falls is a strenuous, but highly rewarding hike to a wonderful view. It's about 5 miles round trip.  The mist trail will get you a little wet, but you'll dry off quick.

The village was a winter wonderland. Facilities were limited but that didn't deter the crowds. Can't imagine how crazy it gets during summer.
Highly recommend carrying spikes or chains for shoes in the winter and some 4x4/AWD love.
This is by far the most beautiful National Park I've seen. Absolutely incredible views. Just make sure you get a reservation in advance on the website before coming to the park.

Go go and go there stunning views lots to do. Especially liked the valley floor tour 40 notes per person but worth every cent. Gift shops busy but what do you expect. No waterfalls to be seen as too dry but if you want to see them go in march/april. Thoughly enjoyed my visit and I hope to go again maybe in April. El captain is a sight to be seen and we saw some climbers on it. Wow they are so small compared to that rock lol.

This is my HAPPY PLACE. I've spent years hiking, backpacking and exploring here. I recommend the Tuolumne area of Yosemite for true nature lovers. Favorite hike, Glen Aulin via "The Fisherman's Trail".

A mythical place of course. The valley is a little overcrowded in camping sites, roads and hotels. I recommend walking at least an hour out of the crowded area to truly enjoy the wilderness of this magnificent park.

We love Yosemite. We stayed in housekeeping for 4 nights. This time of year there aren't as many people there due to how cold the nights get, but we prefer it. There was deer everywhere, and they didn't seem to care we were walking by. No bear sightings, but there were signs posted of a bear in the area. The pizza was great and there are plenty of shops. Everything you'd expect is more expensive but not outrageous. The hikes are beautiful and there is lots of water everywhere. At least this visit there was lots of water.

Yosemite is a very beautiful national park although crowded. We hiked up the falls and had lots of fun with our family here. Clouds Rest Clouds Rest in Yosemite National Park; let’s go! One of the most demanding hikes I have ever accomplished. We got there around 5:30 am and started the hike around 6 am, and didn’t finish until 6 pm, waiting for people…. Doable in 8-10 hours though. A lot of switch back on the way up and down, but the view is breathtaking; totally worth it. Be prepared to bring at least 3liters of water and mosquito repellent. It’s a beautiful place to spend whole day long. Every spot is amazing. Driving through winding roads is worth it.

Yosemite NP is an amazing park with spectacular vistas. Not to be missed is the view of El Capitan and Half Dome from Tunnel View. There are amazing waterfalls to be seen there. The park gets crowded in the summer, so relying on the shuttle bus is advised.

It’s a phenomenal park! We did three strenuous hikes (mist trail to Nevada falls, four mile trail and upper Yosemite falls) and while they were hellish going up, the views were heavenly. There’s a lot of less strenuous hikes as well, and the rangers are super helpful in recommending stuff to do. There’s plenty of things to do with kids. There are a lot of restrooms, but many of them are porta potties. A lot of roads are still closed, so do your research so you know where to go. As for parking: COME EARLY! The big parking lots fill up slower and there’s still parking before 9AM, but some of the smaller ones, like the one for the four mile trail, fills up before 7AM. Once you find a spot, leave your car there and walk/take the shuttle, even though the shuttles are crowded.

Beautiful place, drove from Vancouver bc canada,
