Yosemite National Park is a natural wonder that is truly awe-inspiring. It is located in the Sierra Nevada mountains in California, USA and attracts millions of visitors every year. The park is known for its stunning granite cliffs, waterfalls, and diverse wildlife.

One of the main attractions in Yosemite is the Yosemite Valley, which is surrounded by towering granite cliffs like El Capitan and Half Dome. The valley is also home to the famous Yosemite Falls, one of the tallest waterfalls in North America. Visitors can take hiking trails to get up close to the falls, or simply admire them from afar.

The park is also a paradise for hikers and outdoor enthusiasts, with over 800 miles of trails that wind through forests, meadows, and up to stunning viewpoints. Hikes range from easy walks to strenuous multi-day treks, and there are options for all skill levels.

In addition to hiking, visitors can also go rock climbing, fishing, camping, and horseback riding. In the winter, the park offers cross-country skiing and snowshoeing.

Yosemite is also home to a diverse range of wildlife, including black bears, mountain lions, coyotes, and deer. Birdwatchers can spot over 250 species of birds, including the endangered California Condor.

The park is also known for its rich history and cultural significance, with numerous historic buildings and sites that tell the story of the people who have called the area home for thousands of years.

Overall, Yosemite National Park is a must-visit destination for anyone who loves nature, adventure, and outdoor exploration. The park's stunning natural beauty, rich history, and endless opportunities for adventure make it a truly unforgettable experience.
Spent a couple days hiking in Yosemite. One day partially cloudy, the other rainy. Both days were AWESOME! Valley Loop Trail, Lembert Dome and Dog Lake Trails, and Tenaya Lake Loop. Simply amazing!

Such a beautiful place, really amazing nature, breathtaking views, but awful organization of visitors and parking. If you have option to chose another day than weekend, do it and also come before 8AM. Otherwise you can wait hours in line in front of park, after that pay a entrance fee and after few more hours of trying to find a parking spot go sadly back to home. If you would be lucky as us, you will be with other thousands of people at this really stuning place.
This is a wonderful place to visit whether you like driving or hiking. Winding roads are in great state. Amazing views.

What can I say about Yosemite National Park? It's simply magical, easily hands down the most beautiful and soul charging and inspiring place I've ever been and my most favorite place in all the world. I consider myself lucky amd so fortunate that YNP is right in my own backyard, just a hop skip and a jump away. I HIGHLY recommend it to anyone in or out of state or out of the country. It's something that everyone should get to experience at least once in their life.
My parents used to take me as a child and now I take my own family.
They love it as well!

The best national park I ever hiked! So much to do, so much to see, and the scenery is breathtaking. The views are great and the intense climbs are well worth it! Make sure you are prepared if you plan to do a more challenging hike like Half Dome.
I really fell in love with this park. I went for two days but I could have gone for five without getting tired. There are many walks to do and the landscapes are crazy. Mandatory stop!!!
Must visit place in California. I enjoyed going here all the time. It’s about 3-4 hour drive from Silicon Valley, gates will open around 8am daily.

Our very first time visiting Yosemite, it’s a awesome place to go with family and friends.  The free shuttle is a good way to get on and off to different spots in the park. You definitely need more days than 1 to get to see more of Yosemite. It was very busy when we went on Saturday 10.8.22 a lot of the parking was filling up quickly. We entered at 8:30am. Do recommend bringing your own cooler with food and snacks and plenty of water. Will definitely come back soon!

Yosemite is an amazing park with so much to do. I recommend getting there early to minimize car line waits. Bathing in lower Yosemite falls and going to glacier point we’re highlights of my time there.

A beautiful national park with so many hikes to choose from.  My highlights listed in order of what I enjoyed the most:

Upper Yosemite Falls/Yosemite Point
Vernal Falls/Nevada Falls
Tunnel View
Glacier Point/Four Mike Trail

Awe inspiring. A magical place that offers so much. Unsurpassed when it comes to ourstanding natural beauty. The park is also run and maintained amazingly. The shuttle buses that run you throughout the valley are frequent and very convenient and the shops/stores/restaurants in Yosemtie Village and Curry Village are brilliantly stocked and reasonably priced considering where you are. Unmissable experience.

Absolutely breathtaking views. One of the best experiences of my life. If you’re there for a day check out El Capitan, mirror lake, tunnel view, and then drive up to glacier point and see the entire valley from above.

Beautiful national park. Hikes, mountains, lakes, just everything. Just be sure to arrive soon enough because parking during season is tough. And also visit the visit center, the history of this place is sad and interesting.

No place like Yosemite! So much to see and do. The Valley is the best area to go if you're strapped on time. Mariposa Grove is a great hike through the redwoods. Glacier Point has the best views. Tioga Lake is a really cool spot to jump in the water.

The natural beauty of the park easily earns five stars. But the park loses 2 stars primarily because of what has been done to it and partially due to what has not been done. As to the latter, it should be a simple fix - trail signage is lacking, so the simple act of walking a loop around the Valley is more challenging than it should be, and the NPS never even bothered to cite walking distances on the map. Fixing the former represents a bigger challenge, but is a necessity - the experience of the Valley, the most iconic portion of one of America's greatest parks, is spoiled by the inundation of automobiles. Yosemite deserves better - the park should be closed to private vehicles and served instead by shuttles. One of this country's premier natural areas should not be marred by what amounts to a highway running through its entire length.

Magical and Magnificent.

With its breathtaking landscape and beautiful scenery it has something to offer in every turn you take. We’re just returning from a trip there and the gushing Merced river and waterfalls against the green backdrop is a feast for the eyes.

But the best of all is their emergency services. We were locked out of our car and a park ranger helped us out in merely 30 mins. Going back with lots of memories and will be back in no time

I loved loved loved it. It needs one thing. The length of the paths needs to be on the signs. So you know how long the walks are. I have limited mobility and a couple of walks were long and not marked. It is so very pretty. Stay in the old motel. It is so cool.
Busy but amazing! I got there at 7:30am, and  parking was full already. Reccomend to get there by 7am or take the shuttle if you're heading to Mist Trail. Rivers are huge! Get soaked, it's fun.

The Park itself was Great Not a lot of people when I went. Fresh air, clear and some snow. I went on the first week of February. Amazing views Falls and Wildlife. Lol. Like, I almost ran over a few deers, scared my living lights out of me.
It’s a great national park to visit. Lots of beautiful vistas. However, the roads are closed and you need to take a large loop to visit anywhere.
Visit during the weekday if you can. Weekends are jam packed. Go up the trails and you won't regret it!

Great park, but so very crowded.  We didn't get to see everything we wanted to see during our 2 days there, mainly because we couldn't find a place to park.

Mid June & its sweltering hot.  I wish I dressed accordingly, in order to just spend my time floating in the river.  ***bring lots of water***

One of  my  favorite parks , we stayed at Oakhurst, it's  about  30 min from south  entrance  and  didn't  have  permits, but  we entered park before  6 a.m. each day. It was  plenty parking spots and  traffic wasn't bad.  We did Yosemite fall and  Yosemite point hike  first day, it was  strenuous and  long, but the view was worth it. Second day  we did vermeil fall and  Nevada fall and mirror lake. Breath taking views!

So dang stunning! It very smokey in the mornings but that tends to disappear in the afternoon most of the time. They have so much to offer. The drive from the main gate to the visitor center is about an hour!

We stayed at an air bnb 20 minutes from the park gate and we would rather try get a spot in the park. The 3hr round trip was a little much just to come in for the day! So my advice would be get something inside if you can.

Also, the falls hike was beautiful and for a first time hiker it was challenging but doable. Highly recommend 😊

Also if you get motion sick, pack your dramamine/gravol as they didn’t have any at the store in the village 😊

One of the best National Parks in the country. It has almost everything you can ask for. Waterfall, nature, camping, hiking to half dome, relaxing, jungle life, shopping, good food, feel of nature’s lap, family friendly, couple friendly, solo hiking, camping, kido friendly, pet friendly everything everything. I really really love this place. I often drive to this place and do half dome hiking.

It is a beautiful place… but I’m not sure is worth the hassle… one hour wait on the road just to get in to the park, need reservations, parking is extremely hard, glacier point closed for season, bridal vail fall trail closed, is way too crowded for my liking…

When I arrived at thy palace I ‘‘twas greeted by thy soldier Pennington the fifth. He said that thy more money is the ruler of the cake. When you go to thy bathroom in the forest you eat more berries. So I pooped. Rate this 10

Yosemite National Park is located in California where you can drive your car into and around the park. Yosemite National Park is renowned for its granite cliffs and waterfalls. You can spend your day in Yosemite hiking, climbing, or walking among redwoods. It is amazing.
Great place! Especially on a motorcycle!
Unbeatable views. Highly accessible

If you're hoping for a tranquil escape from the noise of everyday life you're not in the right park.

Whereas the sites are beautiful you either have to go early in the morning to have time to yourself at the main attractions otherwise you are surrounded by 20 people or more.

With the amount of cars driving around it takes away the immersion of being out in nature.

Cell service works fine also removing the immersion.

Yosemite valley and Curry City are busy and with the amount of tourists causing noise pollution it makes it impossible to find a quiet spot to relax.

The less populated sites are a while to walk in order to find a relaxing place to unwind.

I had the wrong expectation coming into the park and it's more like a theme park rather than a place to get away from society and disconnect.

Sadly it seems that hippie culture has fadded and people don't come to national parks to experience reconnecting to nature. Everyone has their phones out and ear buds in.

Save your money.

Another nice place to hike with some awesome waterfall views. Most Trails are paved or partially still are. This park seems more commercialized then some others due to residential housing and stores. It kind of takes away from "getting away" unlike Sequoia national park.

We absolutely love this park. It is stunning (especially in the winter!) and way too large to cover in one visit. Try to spend a weekend in a cabin or hotel here if possible to get the most out of your visit.

You need Togo there what a place to see. Unbelievable views. YOU can't miss these views. The animals were great to see. Add this to your bucket list. Dont miss what is in the great outdoors. Lots of hiking easy and hard whatever you are looking for in a hike. Bike riding, there are huge water falls you can see from the road side, and if you hike there are more to see. We got wet from one of the easy hikes. It just a beautiful place to be just to get away from work it was AWESOME, me and my kid will be back soon. Hope you find this helpful. Go, you must you have Togo. Well it's not to be missed.

Amazing views. Tons of fabulous hikes. Highly recommend doing the hike to the top of Nevada falls, then down the John Miur trail (about 8 miles round trip). Definitely need good hiking boots with intense tread in some areas.

The beauty of our National Parks is just breathtaking 🥹🤍 I never get tired of visiting here. All different seasons & it still leaves me speechless like it’s the first time 😍I can spam so many photos but go see this baby with your own eyes and I’ll guarantee you won’t be disappointed 🥰

This is a really beautiful place to stay! We stayed at one of the rental cabins and it is truly the place to be. There are tons of beautiful sites to see (such as the giant sequoias, which are awe-inspiring, and a lot of great hikes.

The greatest national park in the country, if not the world.  Finally made it here, after putting it off for 20yrs.  It is breathtaking, and is hard to put into words.  If you have any inkling that you want to come see it, then do it.  It's worth it.
Yosemite is one of the best National Park!! You really need a week to experience everything here!

One of the best places for hiking, this park boasts of the grandeur of the tall lush sequoia trees, or the granite rocks of half-dome, El-Capitan. Majestic views on a bright sunny morning be it the valley or the falls. The Tunnel view is capitative area to view at sunset. We visited in spring so the water in the falls and rivers are gushing at its peak. Truly one of the best National Park in USA one cannot get enough of.

Great day walking around the Valley with my family. Enjoyed seeing all the climbers at camp 4. Saw a bear near the village. Watched sunset near Stonemans Bridge. Seeing all the different lights on El Capitan on the drive out of the valley was incredible. Can't wait to visit again.

Great national park. 👍
There can not be having food on the car, because bears will forage at night.
And, drive slowly at night, you will meet wild deers.

Very magical and beautiful. Need to hike a bit to see beautiful spots. Also it was very hot and because of forest fire the environment was a little polluted. You could smell smoke and see ashes flying around.
Beautiful National park, calm and very peaceful. Must experience once in a Lifetime.

Excellent place to relax and disconnect from the routine. My teenage daughter is torturing us to go back this year. We went twice last year and it is simply amazing!!!
Lots to do for the whole family...

I love Yosemite National Park; it’s beautiful and there are a lot to see such as beautiful mountains, waterfalls, or lakes. Make sure you check the website to see if it needs to reserve since Covid started and just for traffic control the park want people to make a reservation before get there.

Worst experience I’ve ever had at a national park/forest. Unless you’re in the back country then expect Disneyland style crowds anywhere you go. The worst part for me was the park Rangers. Seemed like the only reason they were there was to harass everyone and did not care to help when we asked.

We made a mistake and setup camp on a side of the campground that was closed off, however there were no visible signs from where we entered. We were woken up from our sleep by a ranger (which of course is understandable if the campground was closed) but he harassed us and asked about 6 times if we had firearms with us, we told him no the first time but he continued to ask repeatedly as if we were going to magically say yes, and to make it worse, when we asked him for help on how to fill out the reservation card his response was (you guys are adults you can figure it out on your own) let me add that was there was absolutely no instructions on what to do. So, my buddy and I filled out the card and campground that we found, put the money with it and dropped it in the box because that was the only thing that made any sense. The next day when we returned from our hike we found park rangers confiscated all our belongings from our locker (even though we filled out the card and paid for it.) perhaps we made a mistake but had the ranger decided to help us out instead of harassing us looking for reasons to arrest us, this could have been avoided. After he was done harassing he went around the campground looking inside every single vehicle for other other people to harass which he did to a few others. I used to like this place but I will NEVER go back after this last experience

Beautiful as always, fun with the kids and dogs. Lots of places to explore. We stayed in mariposa and drove in everyday. If you pay for park entrance and want to convert it to an annual pass, you can do it at the park entrance kiosk when you leave. You just show your receipt and pay the difference. The rangers are so nice!

Yosemite is an national treasure.
Please note that every vehicle needs a reservation in order fee to enter the park.
The views and the drives are breathtaking.
Pictures do not do justice to this magnificent place.
During my visit it was light traffic not crowded , I imagine that this is due to the ticketing system, it’s great for crowd control.

Great views in one of America's best national parks.  The winter time is a great time of year to visit because of the beautiful views and skiing.  The crowds tend to be less in the winter as well.  We stayed inside the park at a great cabin.  I would highly recommend visiting the park.

UPDATE: After sending a letter to Aramark and to NPS, our tour was "cancelled" and we received refund credit. No communications or follow-up with us - just the processing.  At least that! Still sad we missed out.

We were really looking forward to a Valley Floor Tour. We followed several people's recommendations and took the YARTS bus into the valley from our lodging and booked the Valley Floor Tour to get our bearings and insights about Yosemite Valley. The bus was a little delayed due to traffic and flagging for road work, but we arrived at the Yosemite Valley Lodge location and the tram with time to spare. Staff were outside instead of at the ticket counter, but had our tickets.

As people started loading onto the tram, they were "saving spaces" and refusing to move over to allow all ticketed passengers on the tram. It was already rather crowded with 4 to 6 people in each row. (People are bigger these days and there were multiple small children (less than ticketed age) taking up seats!) Staff were unwilling to make an issue of getting people to move over to allow all remaining ticketed passengers to board the tram. Rather than turning "ugly" and "making a scene" we just gave up and offered to get refunded for our tickets. The staff member said "ok".

We went inside to get refunded and were told "NO - we don't do refunds".  At this point, the tram was pulling out.  When the outside staff member came back in, we asked him to intercede on our behalf since he had seen the issue. He said he would ask the manager about a refund and when he came back, said "no - we can only move you to a later tour".  Well we already had later tickets booked on the YARTS bus and plans for the remainder of the day.  We were only in the valley the one day.

So - now we were out $80 and also had the experience of dealing with RUDE people unwilling to make space and several staff members who were unwilling to provide customer service and either ensure we were able to board the tram or refund our tickets. All 3 staff members we talked to had an "I don't care" or "too bad" attitude.

The experience ruined my day. Several days later, I am still broken hearted at having our plans and visit ruined after trying to follow recommendations to use the YARTS bus, the valley shuttles, and to take the valley tour given our limited time. I will continue to provide bad online reviews and tell everyone who will listen to avoid the Valley Floor Tour.

Further, the shuttle buses in the valley were arriving back to back and multiple locations around the valley.  As seniors, we also had to stand on most of the buses until we passed up on the first two busses and got on the third in a row.  Many of the driver microphones were not working so that people could hear to move back in the bus and/or get on in the front and off in the back. Buses were super crowded with seniors and handicapped people left standing in the aisles with challenges to hang on.

Worst Experience Ever! NPS needs to review the ARAMARK contract and ensure corrective action is taken to make sure shuttles are safely operated and the concessionaires provide good customer service and not oversell and crowd tours. This was a completely unacceptable experience and given that it's early in the season, it's only likely to get worse.

Unbelievable place. We visited in April and stayed in Curry Village unheated tents. It was very cold at night so we would recommend asking for extra blankets or take an extra sleeping bag for warmth. Staying in the park allowed us to access the trails much earlier and with smaller crowds.
Fall colors, off-season crowd levels, and spectacular weather... Very hard to beat!

ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL!!! I can't think of anyone who wouldn't love this park and all it's majestic beauty whether you go in the winter or in the summer you will not be disappointed. One of God's beautiful creations.

Zero guidance, very poor to zero signage work.you can barely see 1 tiny sign to lead you to any attraction,for first time visitors can be very frustrating.
Otherwise the place is a piece of heaven on earth .I’ll let the pictures talk as its really indescribable.

Absolutely amazing experience! Fantastic hiking, backpacking and wildlife. Weekends, especially Saturdays can be hectic with crowded bus stops so plan ahead and whenever possible walk/bike the valley. Amazing stargazing, well maintained trails, helpful rangers and beautiful landscapes. Enjoy!
The park is beautiful.   Stayed at Curry Village in a tent.  Great experience Would have liked a handrail on the stairs and more lighting.

How not to like? The park is amazing. Mind to brink mountain or hiking gear, and even if you don't plan to climb or hike, a simple walk around will amaze you, so beautiful, so massive, you feel one with nature. So please respect the nature all around and preserve it, this park deserve the best care!

Overrated? No interest?  Where did these reviewers go?   But that’s fine, leave this park to the rest of us to enjoy.  You might have to hike in the early morning or late afternoon to experience less people but this park is extraordinary and a hikers paradise.  Go to the government site to double check closures as they are maintaining several areas of the park and Tioga road closes in the winter.
Hetch hetchy is really amazing and less crowded than Yosemite Valley
What a place. Heaven on earth. Beautiful waterfall amazing park. Best in the whole wide world. Best if you come on a Rv as the hotels get crowded all year around . Must visit place in your lifetime

One of the greatest national parks that I’ve been to. Truly aww inspiring. The one way loop in the valley is a little annoying if you miss a turn though. Camping was great the shop has everything youll need

Absolutely gorgeous! Go during the week in the off season if you do not like crowds. So many things to do here you could spend a week and still have a lot to see. Everyone likes to go to the valley, but if you go east towards Mono Lake, you will get a treat and much cooler air.

Stunningly beautiful and peaceful! More than the images of beauty it's a place to live in the moment. Must visit if possible in your lifetime and spend time walking through the valley and enjoying views from every angle. Must visit places within: Tunnel View, Yosemite Valley View, Cook's Meadow, Yosemite Lower Falls, Tenaya Lake (nearby). Best time to visit is April May when the ice has melted and waterfall is at its peak flow.

I would say that if you are going to come to Yosemite, you need more than one day here. There are so many things you can do here that you will regret not staying more than one night. Trust me, we did and will come back here. It is simply beautiful what you see there, from the campgrounds to the Cleanliness of the place to the parking for Rvs and cars to the creeks and rivers you can swim to the trails you can walk. You will need a map to navigate the places you want to visit. This is a must visit place to see beauty.

Huge Crack Forms In Cliff At Yosemite.
And It's Huge.
A popular rock climbing area in Yosemite National Park has been closed because of a crack that's developed in a massive granite cliff. Climbers recently reported the new crack on the western side of the Royal Arches formation near a climbing route called Super Slide.

This review is hard for me to write simply because mere words fail to adequately describe the sheer beauty and majesty of this place. I am not sure any pictures I have taken can, either. Here's my advice: At least once in your life, come and experience Yosemite. You'll be better for it. Remember to tread lightly and respectfully here so that you kids and grandkids can share the joy, too.

The dream for any photographers. This place is a magical wonderland and no matter how many times you visit it never gets old. Different seasons brings different beauty. For the best experience try to stat at one of the few lodgings available within or at close vicinity to the park. It might be little expensive but completely worth it.

This place is just beautiful, so many things to do you need three days to be able to enjoy the park. The parking is $2.00 dollars you need to have a reservation. You need to make the reservation weeks before and is so competitive buying the ticket online. In 4 mintues the tickets were sold out. So do it on it. The entrance is another $35 dollars

Incredible park and a must for anyone who considers themselves an adventurer. You can easily access breathtaking viewpoints by driving to Tunnel View, Glacier Point, or Taft Point or you can hike numerous trails. I strongly recommend finding lodging within the park or camping. I chose to stay in a cabin just outside the park and thought it was a hassle driving everyday to and within the park. For trails, I would recommend hiking Vernal Falls and Upper Yosemite Falls

beautifull scenery but no wildlife except tourists squirrel and crows. yellowstone is by far better to go see in my opinion. not many places to stop for pictures if you are driving. good place for camping hiking but if you are disabled forget it

What an honour it was to witness El Capitan!

Excellent park- amenities are all fantastic, gift shop and little supermarket by Yosemite Valley.

The only thing I will say, is the toilets are a little smelly, and there is no Wifi in the visitor centre.

Best hikes (for me)

- 4 mile trail to Glacier Point
- Cathedral Lake
- Mirror Lake

I spend a LOT of time in National Parks but just truly got to experience Yosemite National Park for the first time and it instantly became one of my favorites!  The forest, endless waterfalls and lakes, amazing hikes, and village were all great to experience.  We climbed Half Dome thanks to our permit and it’s one of my favorite hikes I have done anywhere on this planet (I even put it over Angels Landing in Zion).  It is a very strenuous hike and you should be in good shape physically and have the mental fortitude to make it through the day.  It gets hot quick so tons of water and food are highly recommended.  There are also lakes and streams along the way to refill so bring a filter- we went through 200 ounces of water each to get up and back!  The cables are a tremendous forearm, cardio, and leg workout so be prepared for that!  People are respectful for the most part on the cables so over communicate to the people in front of and behind you so you are as safe as can be up there.  The view from the top is absolutely amazing and well worth the adventure to get there!  I cannot recommend Yosemite enough and even if you don’t have the permit to do Half Dome it is totally worth the visit!!

Yosemite National Park was added to the UNESCO list of natural heritage in 1984.
About the size of 4 Međimurjes, it abounds in rich flora, fauna, beautiful basins, glacial valleys, waterfalls, lakes and breathtaking panoramas.
Millions of visitors annually enjoy recreationally well-organized routes and hiking trails.  Here, we also had a full day, we really enjoyed it, but you should take at least a week for this great national park.
One thing really worried me: it is almost difficult to find a healthy tree in the entire national park.
The vast expanses of the forest seem so eerie...
Most of the trees are sick, but we have not been able to find out whether it is a disease caused by intruders or acid rain and other "noble" human activities.
The ticket costs only $35 to enter with a vehicle.

If your on the fence about going, just go. It's one of the most beautiful places in the world. Here you can experience the undying beauty of nature. Inside the valley and outside if it there's so much to do. Super great experience

So breathtakingly beautiful. You can still see remnants if the for a forest fires but nature is coming back! We spent all day there but could have spent more time. Definitely will be coming back to camp. So much activities to do. You can hike so many trails, rent bikes, ride horses! So much more! A great family adventure!

This was a splendid opportunity at camp. Great stories and achievements. Make sure you talk to the park rangers, but best to the park hostesses. They are paid seasonal collage students that focus on improving the park experience for the guests. Nicely, they know the secret spots and the how to, which they get passed along to the others. We found beaches, picture spots and other nice park and parking information that make our trip a much better and pleasant one. Thanks Ryan for your help, we really appreciate it and enjoyed talking to you. We wish you well on your future teaching endeavors…
Great national park to visit, will be back for summer!

I have had the pleasure of visiting Yosemite many times while growing up in the Bay Area. I didn’t have time for a proper trip this time but was pleasantly surprised to get this great view of Half Dome while flying Alaska Airlines flight AS15 from JFK to SFO.

Get a window seat on the left side of the airplane and leave the window shade up!

We took the tioga pass, this scenic route is so magical. We stopped at  Tenaya lake, Olmsted point, Toulmne Meadows and the views are breathtaking. The entrance requires reservation if driving between 6 am to 4 pm from May to Sep, peak hour reservation is required. We could get a reservation,hence started very early and entered the park before 6 am. The entrance was open and did not collect the fee at that time and we had to pay our way back out.

This was our first ever visit to Yosemite National Park & we all loved it. Half Dome, Mountains, greenery, waterfall, picnic spot, bbq spot, camping, biking, hiking all the great things are in here. We had only one day trip. Would love to come again and stay for 2 or 3 days.

One of the best experiences I’ve had in my life.

I travelled to California just to experience this moment. Words can not explain the beauty of this National Treasure.

I encourage you to visit and experience the picturesque scenery of this place.

My only wish is I could visit Yosemite again and spend days navigating through its marvels.

This is one off my bucket list.

We visited the tunnel view point and it was awesome. We reached there at around 6:40 am and the drive to this place was very nice and traffic free. I would suggest that time because you will get a traffic less drive and also you can see the sun rise from other areas.

The important thing is , you will not get a sunrise picture from here so don't plan to take any sunrise pictures from this spot.

Also you don't need to pay if you enter before 6. When we returned from this place, we saw a long queue of cars entering this place. So it is good if you visit this place before 6 or 7am.

We got great family pictures from the tunnel point. Some roads were closed at that time.

Even with the smoke of Creek Fires, the place is absolutely beautiful. Cannot wait to come back. Enjoyed having fewer visitors due to covid, but it was still busy.... Tioga pass is un freaking believable... beautiful, a little scary lol drive.....i think I like it better than the Valley. We went on top of Sentinel Dome, off Glacier point rd. We did Tioga pass the last 2 days we were there and the views, trails, overlooks, completely beautiful

This park is beautiful. The signs and road maps need work, it is way to easy to get lost. The restroom accessibility is good for a huge park like this, there are facilities placed randomly throughout the park. There are also nice places to stop and enjoy the scenery and have a snack.

Beautiful National park at Yosemite. If you’re traveling through California stop to see Yosemite National Park. Every age will enjoy the beautiful of the wildness in this park. Stop and enjoy an picnic, explore and nature trail and so much more. Check to see price point of entering this park.

Amazing!!! Nature's gorgeous, temprature exactly right for hiking, wonderful sightseeing places and within a few miles hiking. Huge diversity of wild life ... I could speak for hours, even more for days.
Don't you even think to miss it, if you have the opportunity to visit it, or at least, a part of it.

Absolutely amazing and beautiful place but… I went on Father’s Day weekend and the amount of people there was ridiculous. Not a single parking spot available, traffic up to the entrance of the park was over an hour. I’m talking like 5 miles in 1.5 hours. Highly recommend going during the week or at least not a holiday weekend.
Being among majestic sequioas at the Mariposa Grove, I feel awestricken at God's talent at creating such beautiful places for us to enjoy.
So beautiful! Stunning scenery even in the clouds and mist. The hiking paths are clean, plenty of restrooms. October is beautiful with all the yellow leaves too!

Very nice environment great break from the outside world. The reason that it's a not perfect score from my experience was more of the timing of going which was end of November, which meant no snow and no active waterfalls and it wasn't spring where the flowers were blooming and the waterfalls were flowing. However the fall made the trees look very nice from the color changing leaves everywhere. If you do go on the hikes the intermediate ones are definitely for the people who are somewhat athletic and the advanced shouldn't be attempted without some walking sticks. Also I'd recommend layering to help prevent you from sweating through your layers from all the walking.

Awesome national park. Very well organized. Try to avoid weekend as it's a bit over crowded. If you like long trails, I would recommend you the four mile trail. You can see the Glacier Point, and the view trail is amazing!

Absolutely stunning and well maintained national park. The number of public restrooms were adequate and well distributed. Clean drinking water was also pretty accessible in most areas.
Would recommend to visit in spring though. Most waterfalls dry up in summer and the only waterfall I saw in fall was the Bridal Veil Falls.
Amazing national park!!! Super pretty😃If you want to go through the mist trail, you will need a raincoat. 💦💦💦
An absolute must see if in or near San Francisco. We drove and made a day trip out of it. Lots of spectacular views all around you!!! A must see/do for sure!

Breathtaking. Went on a Sunday. Got there just before noon. Lots of families/people, but as a solo hiker it made me feel safe on the trails since it was the first day of spring and I’m sure bears were waking up from hibernation. Enjoyed my time. Hope to explore even more when I go back with friends or family.

Absolutely stunning- you really feel insignificant when standing below these otherworldly rock formations. Wonderful hikes for all skill levels. Sometimes there is traffic to get into the park, but it makes sense given how special Yosemite is.
Great views which is worth all the time you spend to get there
Heaven do exists ❤️ Beautiful place, a lot of restrooms, parking and places to eat.

We arrived at Yosemite via the south entrance around 9.30am and it takes around 45-60 minutes from there to make your way up to the parking area where you can start many of the key hiking 🥾 routes. Due to the smoke from recent and current fires we had limited visibility but still soaked in the incredible scene at tunnel view. Our hike went via the John Muir trail to Vernal Falls. The falls aren’t flowing very strong right now but we were really happy all the same. The hike featured some steep climbs up stairs but nothing too difficult or tiring.

Yeah even at 40K reviews and near 5.0 perfect I still have to throw in my two cents, Yep it's pretty incredible and that's from someone who just last year went to Yellowstone for the first time.(yeah, that's a 5 star too but for much different reasons) For a first timer there is nothing more incredible then to come past the mist of Bridal Veil falls into the meadow and behold Yosemite Falls in all it's glory, the roar is incredible (and you're  still 2 miles away i believe). Later in the year its not so busy and the water flows are much lower but in spring/ early summer it's a constant and pleasant assault on the senses. The Park is old and crowded,  the RV spaces are small, your neighbors are camping in your back pocket and everyone walks through your campsite at will but the vistas are not available anywhere else on the west coast if not the contential US. and that's from someone who pulled a trailer 15k miles around the lower 49 in 2020.   Yes, get out and go see this country but don't miss Yosemite even if you only have an afternoon to drive through or take a bus tour, even if you only get to stand in the meadow and soak it all in, it's not to be missed. The Park is so much more then just then Yosemite Valley it's self but IMO it all starts there. My greatest memories are  Half Dome with my daughters and the bridge/ Mist trail with my grandkids.

Edit.. A quick visit mid-june 2023 with historic winter snowpak and high river  flows. we must have seen 2 dozen small waterfalls that may not even be named (it rained every afternoon) surprizingly Yosemite falls it'self wasn't much more impressive (the weather was cool) but Bridal Veil was just awesome, much bigger and grander then I've ever seen it. The trail is closed at this time but at Tunnel View you can get the bigger picture.

We visited during the long weekend. Apart from the crazy traffic that extended our entry to the valley by 3 extra hours, the entire weekend was just like a dream!
Since it was still winter season, we couldn’t go to a few spots like glacier point, clouds rest, half dome (they were closed due to icy roads)
The spots we did see were- El Capitan, Tunnel view, upper falls, lower falls, bridalveil falls.

February is the best month if you want to catch firefall!

People say you should visit in every season to see the change in colors, weather and the views!

The only thing that I disliked was the traffic that we unfortunately got stuck in (it’s usually not this crowded on normal weekends)

But at the end it was totally worth it!

Stunning views and great trails. Chance to see bears and other wild life.
At the same time, very limited food options.
Also not all trails are clearly marked: sometimes you'll have to literally follow the footsteps.
Be prepared for the delays: as the crews working on roads there might be a single lane open in both directions.

El Capitan and Half Dome make the visit worthwhile. Recommend Four Mile Hike but it’s challenging (due mainly to distance and elevation change). Best to go weekdays and avoid weekends, even in off season. Weekend crowds diminish the experience.
Some of the most gorgeous sites to behold

Incredible park to see huge views! It is insanely busy so you need to get there as early as possible. Things take a really long time but they are totally worth it! A highlight of life to go see a park like this. Watch the movie Free Solo in preparation!

My second time came to Yosemite. I missed the chance to visit Glacier Point again… Hopefully I can come back during the fall to see the half dome from Glacier point. But I have to say that El Captain and Bridalveil Fall already satisfied me this time. It was so happy and great to catch these images on my camera. I really love California!
The best place to relax, enjoy nature and recharge. This place is well organized. Lots of activities to do,.

awesome view, nice and helpful rangers, scenic landscapes, best time to visit is in Summer. If you love hiking, trails and have advance level of trailing experience, then you can spend 3/4 days in the part easily exploring it..Keep protein bars, snacks and water with you.
We come up about 3 or 4 times a year and really enjoy ourselves sometimes just for a day trip sometimes for an overnighter. Place is very magical for us.
First time here and we loved the park. The drive down was beautiful, but honestly the drive back out is stunning. The sunset makes the whole park look magical!

I've been here multiple times but never during winter because I hate the snow. But this time, I'm coming from PA, which prepped me for snow, and I had a blast. The view was amazing and the place we rented was superb! This place will always have a special place in my life.

Yosemite National Park is by far one of the most beautiful places we’ve explored so far in the US. With the vast forests and mountainous landscapes, this is a picture perfect place to be. With countless hiking trails and mountains to climb, this is an outdoorsy, hiker/campers paradise. The wildlife and scenery is breathtaking. The trails are fun and provide different levels of challenging terrain. Its peaceful and calming rivers promote an infinite amount of space and opportunity for mediation. When visiting this region, travel with an open mind and plenty of time. Do not rush as the roads are extremely curvy. But don’t let that deter you as this place is absolute work, the travel, displaying indescribable beauty. The facilities within the national park are overall pretty clean and well stocked. There’s places where water bottles can be refilled with clean cold filtered water. This is a destination that we’ll definitely be visiting more in
This place is majestic. There are no words to adequately describe the beauty of this park. I think anyone who is into hiking or the outdoors should visit this park at least once.

We went during the off season (March).  The views are stunning and definitely worth seeing, it's a special place, no on can argue.  A few things I found off-putting were the numerous campsites, lodges, resorts, etc within the national park grounds which gave it less of a rugged natural feel.

I love Yosemite, impressive views with plenty of waterfalls, hikes and wildlife. Late spring and early summer are the best times for waterfalls but of course it could get too crowded. In winter several waterfalls are dry and others flow low, many hikes will be closed due to snow, but you may have the park to yourself.

Love Yosemite National Park in any season. If you're looking for peace and quiet, early spring and late fall are best especially when a storm paints the majestic landscape with a fresh coating of snow. Not to be missed.

If you get the chance; drive through Fresno(dead middle almost every direction in Cali) on Highway 99NB then turn off-to 41NB it's about a 1.5hr drive Highway 41 North dead ends to the gate of Yosemite; ya can't miss a turn but if you get car sick- it's an hour-long drive of straight not all switchbacks but windy. I lived in a little town called Coursegold(1 of the best Antique places)before you start passing into Oakhurst(1 of the best Antique places) & Fish Camp(name states all)  last tourist signs, stores, etc then before you realize BOOM! Yosemite. Shootz, I used to drive that road 80mph easy anyway of the week; loved it... then they opened another tribal casino(Chukchansi Gold Resort & Casino=AMAZING BUFFET!All separatedby type of food- american, asian,mexican,soul, etc. ) in the area; ruining a good 2 lane drive. I know CHPs reports in 2003-2005 had to be off the charts just from just in let's say a 10mile stretch of Highway 41 with the casino in the middle so either direction the driver is heading. None of us that drove the road as the back of my hand even racing around on it since it's only a 2 lane highway. Also ck out Highway 41 (if the southern gate you headed) for any road construction, road/driving conditions, & do you need new brakes or tires(replace them before the summer road trip). FOR REAL! #ifykyk 41NB in the mountains don't have much of any type of even "bike lane" its to close to mountains so you don't wanna breakdown anywhere on 41NB because it'll cause the additional stress & anxiety of getting hit & blocking traffic- unless you work put crew & you'll have that tire change done lickidy split! It's probably one of the other non tourist in the area, take in the drive to Yosemite; it's beautiful 😍.

Yosemite never fails to amaze with its sublime landform, breathtaking granite cliffs, and cascading waterfalls. The park offers many spots that offer great panoramic views of the surrounding landscape. To get the best of your trip, hike through towering sequoia groves, bask in lush meadows, and breathe in the refreshing Sierra Nevada air. It's an unforgettable escape for every outdoor enthusiast.

Amazing park, no wonder over a million visitors usually come. Parking can be complicated but definitely worth the drive. Food options are limited but picnic opportunities with magnificent views are almost unlimited all around. Avoid busy months and bring layers.
Went with two toddlers and did stroller friendly trails. Beautiful, and the kids got to run around.
A spot on everyone's bucket list. Prepared to be awed by the work of Mother Nature. The landscape and scenery are just out of this world. It was an amazing journey.

It was amazing to visit this place a second time. Plan the 10 mile hike to Nevada Falls, through the Mist trail, while coming back on the slightly longer J. Muir trail (it's easier on your knees). You will see the Vernal Falls, and enjoy a dip in the Emerald Pool, if you dare. The day trip is the best you can experience in the park. That, and Glacier point, the next day.

Well worth the visit. Beware of bears and other wildlife, which has been frequenting the village area recently. Don't leave any food or smelly items in your car, as these will attract them. Be sure to bring warm layers, it gets very cold at night! The best short hikes are to the falls and around half dome. Drive up the panoramic viewpoint too to get some great shots.

Unbelievable scenery.
Was very busy at Yosemite Falls. So many rude people.
This certainly takes away the vista unfortunately.
Was nice to get away from the hustle and bustle to take it all in.
Some of the most breathtaking views I have ever experienced. Everywhere you look is just absolutely stunning, it's like you are inside a postcard just incredible. Everyone should go 10/10

Gorgeous views with almost everything you expect to see: rocky mountains, large trees, huge rocks, high waterfalls, rivers, steep trails, glaciers, etc.  Great for all ages. I would love to come back later.
Thank goodness for this beautiful place being selected for a National Park for all to enjoy. What a wonderful treasure.
Not much to say, but just absolutely magnificent! I loved it, definitely want to go back. Biking and hiking fun. Sprung time is much nicer to go to since not nearly as busy as summer time.
One of the best places in the earth.   Amazing and mind boggling scenery and water falls from the Glaciers 👌

I hiked with my wife, brother, cousins, and nephews and nice. It is breathtaking and worth a workout hiking to the top; however, finding a parking spot is a nightmare although it’s charged $35 per car but parking is not guaranteed. It took us almost 2 hours to get a parking spot and we had to take free shuttle to the falls.
Beautiful scenery, properly guided hikes, beautiful fall foliage, rocky mountains, best for star gazing. A lot of places for food including veg options.

A paradise.  Nothing I say about Yosemite can describe the feeling of being in this amazing place.  When you arrive, you can already feel the majesty of nature, the smell of the trees, you are very small within all that immensity.  We rented a Campervan and stayed at the Lower Pines for 4 wonderful days.  We had an incredible view of the Half Dome from inside the Campervan.  It was the first week of June 2021 and it was very hot and dry, very dry.  But nothing matters when you wake up in the morning and have your coffee looking at the mountains.  We did trails every day, we saw children, couples with babies and older people doing too, we just didn't do the hardest ones.  I loved the structure of the park, bathrooms, water, everything very organized, monitored and safe.  Several Park Rangers everywhere, advice regarding animals and food and garbage storage (anti-bear lockers).  Bookings for the camping open 3 months in advance and finish quickly.
Stunning view points! We didn’t had much time there, but the Tunnel View and Glacier Point at sunset were simply astonishing.

What an outstandingly beautiful place. You'll spend your whole trip (if your taking a trail up Yosemite) with your head acting the same as a bobble head in a car looking everywhere as there is so much beauty.

When I went the snow on the top was starting to melt so from ground level you had stunning waterfalls and as you walked up streams the navagate over, every so often looking back down towards ground level. When at the top we camped and had snow over night. (Remember your bear canisters for your food over night)

I can't recommend going here more, it's a beautiful place while also being a place where you can be active with family and friends.

Spectacular!

We went in spring this year due to the heavy winter snows and the corresponding heavy spring melting.

All the waterfalls were going full bore. The water was landing with such force that you could hear it on the other side of the valley.

Don't miss the short walk to the base of Yosemite Falls. The force of nature was unbelievable. Apologies for very blurry nature of the attached short video, but you and your camera were getting instantly soaked by the spray from the falls.

One note:  We decided to stay in Oakhurst which is still over an hour's drive to the valley floor. But it worked well and we had a very nice room at the Fairfield Inn. We chose to leave the hotel at 6:30 which us to the main part of Yosemite before 8 am -- already a bit busy on a weekend, but still much easier to find parking than even an hour later.

Highly, highly recommended.

I don't give 5 star for nothing...but I am bias...I have been going for decades...this is my first review. Reserved early...we didn't so we stayed 20 minutes outside ...however...still absolutely amazing!!! Late spring week days is not crowded...but even with the crowds...it was great!!

Nice national park. The 120 Tioga pass is a great drive with good trails and many nice views, the vally has good views but is very crowded and traffic can make things difficult. Winter comes early here so be prepared, they closed the passes the second day I was here and unfortunately I was not able to visit glacier point which promises some of the parks best views n trails. I’d recommend this park, just know it is very touristy, it’s crowded and parking lots and any reservation based booking fills immediately upon release, the views especially on the upper passes and roads are very good. Very little to no cell service in the park.
Amazing place. Beautiful environment. Something to be very appreciative of. I'm so glad Roosevelt and Muir sat at that location to decide Yosemite's future.
I had been dying to go here since I was a kid. Finally getting to make it, I would say that the experience can be summed up as breath taking. This park is nothing short of gorgeous.

What an adventure!

We found the perfect time to visit...Fall!
Lower crowds, beautiful weather,  friendly faces scattered all around the park.
Such a peaceful place to visit.

Only drawback? Wildfires.

There was quite a bit of smoky haze throughout key areas of park accompanied by (at times)  an over whelming smoky smell.

Though this is to no fault of the park and is part of their ecosystem, please be prepared that some views may be hazy and some may be more sensitive to the smokiness than others.

We did see a few people wearing buffs on their faces.

Otherwise, it was a most wonderful experience. Would love to go back and spend a few days there and in the Rush Creek Lodge right outside the park.

Definitely worth this visit, especially viewing the ever popular El Capitan!

Sidenote: Must watch documentary "Free Solo" before visiting. So inspiring and insane all at once.

Such a treasure of nature, relatively close to the Bay area. Beautiful redwoods, stunning waterfalls. So much to do for both families and experienced hikers and climbers. Great hotel, or other lodging, or places to camp. It gets crowded so reservations are usually required.

I was driving home to Utah. Google said that the fastest way at the time was over Tioga Pass through Yosemite. It was appealing. I’ve made a quick video showing a few more pictures and just talking about how neat it was. Please take a look.

Take Tioga Pass
https://youtu.be/8BEejJE8tOo

The route is incredible. It’s not terribly busy compared to the Valley. I would recommend to everyone that they take the Tioga Road.
Of all the places we have been in the world, there are few that rival the natural beauty of Yosemite. It is with good reason that the park is world famous.

Best hikes specially the mist trail, 😍campgrounds are usually full, if you go on the weekends you might not find the best parking spots and it might be a little busy.💃. . . . . . . . . .💃. . . . . . . . . .💃 . . . . . . . .
Amazing falls, hikes, airbnbs, restaurants
I went there more than 10 times and I’ll go there more.

Firefall was definitely a highlight of Yosemite National Park during this visit. There wasn’t much water in the fall but still very gorgeous! No entry reservation needed this time of year. There was lots of traffic near the viewing areas and parking could be difficult. Make sure you arrive early.

There were portable toilets near the firewall viewing points. Very thoughtful.

If you plan to stay, Yosemite Valley lodge or Curry village are well located and convenient. Shuttles are also running to relieve the parking issues. But you must book ahead during holiday weekends. There are restaurants and kiosks at both lodges where you can purchase/eat foods (quite delicious). Ahwhanee hotel also provides food for the general public.

For tent campers, Camp 4 is well situated and first come first serve.

For hiking, the Mist trail or the John Muir trail are good for the experienced hikers. Mirror lake trail and Lower Yosemite fall trail are easier for beginners or families with kids.

If you want to ski/snowboard, Badger ski resort is nearby.

There’s no WIFI in the park except for the lodging areas. Cellular signal is also weak. It’s a perfect time for your to fully enjoy nature :)

Yosemite National Park is a renowned national park located in California, USA. It's known for its stunning granite cliffs, waterfalls, diverse ecosystems, and abundant wildlife. Some of its iconic landmarks include El Capitan, Half Dome, Yosemite Falls, and the Giant Sequoias. It's a popular destination for outdoor activities such as hiking, rock climbing, camping, and wildlife watching.

This is really amazing place that you must visit!!! I really enjoyed spending time here with my family (Make sure to check the website about closed road information and so on.) Also, need to make a reservation during the peak season. If you didn’t make a reservation, you can still enter the park before 6am and after 4pm (If I remember correctly)

Yosemite is a place which offers a beautiful experience at any time of the year. I visited this place in May and now in December. The weather is still great with no snow yet. Although a thin layer of ice forms on the car early morning. Roads are clear. Glacier point is open all day. The valley is very cold until 9am at least. Extra layers of Warm clothing is recommended for travel during winter. Sunrise at tunnel view and sunset at Washburn / glacier point to get the best views. Degnans deli offers great food.

Ofcourse nature here (the massive rocks) is beautiful but the the Curry village campingground is far to full! Toilets etc dirty and to many tents/people on a small spot. Roads are sometimes chaotic and tent cabins are, for the prices they charge, VERY simple and too basic. Overall dissapointing

Allow me to regale you with the tale of one of the most lamentable expeditions I have ever embarked upon. This journey, fraught with trials and tribulations, is a testament to adventure's unpredictable nature. Firstly, the sustenance provided was of such a dreadful quality that it induced the most distressing malady upon my person, causing a relentless bout of liquid diarrhea. This unfortunate affliction necessitated changing my pajama bottoms, a most undignified ordeal. My bunkmate was a constant source of misery. Despite the ample legroom provided by our bunks, he insisted on sleeping with his legs dangling off the bed. I can confirm the adequacy of the legroom, for we are of near identical stature, and I managed to keep both legs comfortably within the confines of my bed. Furthermore, they vehemently denied the habit and snored with such ferocity that it was impossible to attain a restful slumber. The accommodations were in a deplorable state, the rooms being both filthy and worn. Another compatriot consumed an excessive amount of caffeine and was a perpetual source of disturbance. The company was further marred by a barrage of inappropriate jests concerning the human anatomy and acts of a most indecent nature. To compound our woes, there was a complete absence of Wi-Fi, rendering it impossible to send or receive messages or partake in the simple pleasure of watching YouTube during our idle moments. Entertainment was sorely lacking, making our downtime excruciatingly dull. The bathing facilities offered scant privacy, the flimsy curtains affording one the dubious privilege of glimpsing one's comrades in their natural state. The cabins lacked heating, necessitating to kindle a fire within a diminutive furnace, its tiny chimney expelling smoke to the heavens. One of our compatriots, I must note, enjoyed the exclusive luxury of a private room, a manifestly unfair arrangement, especially given her solitary female presence on this excursion. Moreover, my bunkmate exhibited the most unbecoming cowardice at the sight of a bat native to the wilderness surrounding our cabin, letting slip an expletive of the most vulgar kind. Yet, amid this adversity, a beacon of joy emerged in the form of the middle schoolers from a neighbouring school. Their company was a delight, their presence a rare and cherished pleasure in an otherwise dismal adventure.

One of the best trips I have made. The decision to drive to Yosemite National Park on the way to San Francisco was well worth it, although not the best in December when there is still snow on the ground. The roads were a bit icy, but the sheer majesty of the mountain and the bridal falls compensated for it.

The park is full of breathtaking views; from the moment you start your drive past the guard gate to the moment you park. If you’re able to, visit the park and enjoy it’s beauty.
A few tips:
1. If you’re staying outside of the park, get to the park gate early. On a Saturday, we got to the gate by 8 a.m and had no issues finding parking
2. If you easily get nauseous from windy drives, get mentally ready, once you pass the entrance gates, it’s about 50 minutes till you get to the main parking area and it’s mostly windy roads
3. Right after the tunnel, there’s parking to the right if you would like to take pictures of some amazing views
4. Figuring out where to go and park is confusing, look for signs for Yosemite Village parking
5. If you forget snacks or even a backpack, don’t worry, they have lots of snacks and supplies at the village store; you can even get tums from a vending machine
6. Figuring out hikes and where to go is difficult; there’s a hiking map right next to the Yosemite village parking that tells you the difficulty levels
7. Layer up, it’s cold in the morning and gets hot quickly
8. Have fun!
Absolutely beautiful!!! Takes your breath away, makes you feel so small.
Now is the perfect time to go to Yosemite,  the snow melt has so many waterfalls looking great.  Lush and green.

Yosemite is a beautiful National Park. I went camping, picnicking, hiking, and slept in one of their hotel rooms. There are a lot of things to see over there. They also have a general story if you need to buy some supplies. I've taken a lot of beautiful pictures here and made a lot of memories. This is one of my favorite natural parks.
Stunning we only drove thru definitely coming back to hike the trails beautiful
By far the most beautiful place I've been in the US so far. A little busy but don't let it kill your vibe. The place is awesome.
So beauuuuuuutiful ,especially the water falls this year. And I saw a baby bear next to the river, so amazing, my whole family they are so happy for this trip, we will go again next year for sure 👍
As an employee, this place is awesome. Even more so when I get to work and the park is shut down. Not something I'd ever really get to experience otherwise.
Finally visited for the first time and I feel like. A barely scratched the surface. It’s gonna be hard to top these views

beautiful park with a lot of water falls and scenic points. walk to the Yosemite fall, however, there was a parking problem. it was really crowded during the weekend. it maybe better during the weekdays.

As if you're looking for reviews on Yosemite. You either know you're going, or not.
I'm posting this for the points.

If you are really reading this:
-Park rangers are awesome
-expect a wait at the main gate for about an hour starting at 8am
- it's a park that features few easy trails, are are moderate to hard but oh so worth it
Went during the summer. I had a picnic and saw the beautiful areas. Hope to go camping here oneday

Unbelievable views. This place is really organized. All the roads are clear  and nice. A lot of bathrooms inside the park and in the middle of the tracks. Signs are really clear.
Entrance costs 35$ for a private vehicle. You can use this ticket for 7 days in a row.

I grew up very close to this park and came here all the time as a kid. Then started coming on my own once I could drive, and now I go as often as I can to spend time in the magic of the valley, the high country, and in the meadows above the valley. Yosemite is an amazingly beautiful park that we are so lucky we get to visit. The water falls are extra amazing in the spring, watching the leaves change in the fall is amazing, make the trip up to tuolumne once the valley gets too hot and try to come at least once in the winter to see the valley covered in snow. It's an amazing place. Please don't trash the park!

Wonderful experience. I had a great time visiting the park. Well organized. The trails are awesome. Good camping grounds. The access to facilities is sometimes difficult due to the impressive ain't of visitors.
I really recommend this extraordinary site!
As you can see on my dog’s face even he was happy about the trip.

The park is huge! Check out the valley but then head to the high country for the best of Yosemite. Getting above treeline is some of the best the Sierra has to offer. Huge views, mountains over 13k, year round snow hiding on north faces, wildlife, and extreme solitude. The groves are nice as well. Park staff does a great job!

One of the most beautiful places on the earth. I would go there upon every opportunity that I get. Photos won't make any justice, nor the words. Go there at least once in your lifetime and experience feeling a spec of dust in front of the giant valley and astounding El Capitan and Half Dome.

Yosemite must be one of the most photographed national parks in the country. It has so many things to offer for activities. You can ride a horse, kayak, hike, bicycle, and go camping. Most of the iconic photographs taken of Yosemite are in the valley. There are campgrounds, and if you prefer not to camp, there are the historic Ahwahnee hotel, Yosemite lodge, and the Wawona lodge. Camp curry offer yurts. Yurts are tents built on a wooden foundation and, they have electricty. Yosemite also offers restaurants, grocery store, and gift shops.
One of the most beautiful national parks in have visited around the world.

What’s not to love about this place. Incredible stunning views all around you. The park Rangers were incredible, so kind, so helpful. I just couldn’t believe this was nature , truly a natural work of art and so awe inspiring!

We were lucky enough to get in, we tried twice. The first time we went we didn’t have any reservation day use pass, then it was lifted. So we made it. It was fast a little packed before the gate to get in took 30 mins at least. But it was all worth it. It’s such a beauty and so untouched. Parking is not bad at all. You must go to see! I wished we had time to hike. Maybe next time I’m definitely going back.

Must get there early, and stay in the valley if you can. Tons of hikes and could spend a solid extended weekend there. Keep an eye out for climbers!!

Start the long trails early in the day to avoid crowds, and get on the permit system for select hikes if possible. Worth a return trip!

It’s an amazing park but know before you go the distance between things can be crazy and the roads are the definition of a mountain pass. Come early in the morning and get a few hikes under your belt then grab lunch in the village and then do the last few but glacier point is amazing and the views are unforgettable
Beautiful mountains and scenic drive

What a phenomenal National Park. I went too many years of my life avoiding this place due to crowds but I'm glad I made the decision to come out here in early March. The temperature was perfect for hiking. Barely any people were at the park. No trouble finding parking anywhere. I love this place and I'm looking forward to coming back to do some more hikes. If you only have one day here I would recommend trying out the hike to Yosemite Point. Such unrivaled views that make you fall more and more in love with Mother Nature.

This place is amazing. Look for the tunnel view spot and go before 6 am to enjoy the sunrise. If you’re into intense hikes, try the Vernal-Nevada falls hike, it’ll amazed you. Make sure you wait for the rainbow. Lots of thing to do but it’ll be better you getting early.

I haven't been to Yosemite in many many years. We joined my in laws to go camping and it was my daughter and husband's first time to Yosemite. Stunning views of course. If you're able to get a spot on the Valley floor area you're golden. They have the showers there, cafe/lodge area, swimming pool,  you're able to get to the hiking areas better. We were at a higher elevation in Crane Flats. Which, there is a gas station there. Only really complaint is that, they have the bear box to store your food in or any items that might attract bears. It's not big enough. Especially if you're camping with a big family. Other than that, it's a wonderful place.

YOSEMITE one of the Wonders of California. A must visit for 3 days minimum.

We like to show up midday to hike, walk, enjoy scenery, and enjoy a light lunch. Pack sandwiches, snacks, and water. Make sure to have a bakcpack and phone charger too.

Recommend purchasing the $80 pass to visit all National Parks. Daily pass is $35. The $80 pays for itself in 2 days of visiting national parks.

We love staying just a few miles from park entrance at Tenaya Lodge.

Yosemite is perfect to visit all year long. However, the special treat to see the illusion of a  'lava' flow from the 'firefalls' or frozen water falls is a must do. January and Febraury perfect months to see the pseudo lava falls - 5:30pm during sunset, the sun reflects the rays at a perfect angle for a beautiful 13 minutes to enjoy the majestic lava flow. Park near the falls or near the Bridge. The walk is about 20 minutes time to find a spot to rest, chill, and wait. Wait time is most important since lot's of people walk and wait.

Take a light chair, snacks, water, warm clothes, jacket, gloves, beanie, and have patience. Worth the wait.

Also, enjoy the drive on highway 41 through Yosemite. Make sure to return on HWY 41 because some people make mistake and end up on a different Highway like 120 going in opposite direction.

Half Dome photos a must.
Twin Falls a must. Park and Hike around the area.
Park near the Lava falls and walk and enjoy more waterfalls in area. So worth it.
On way out of park, during snow, stop at the fun snow area to enjoy time with kids. Make sure to buy several round plastic snow sliding thingies. Well worth the fun times!

Also, plan a day to go to Badger Pass for skiing or snowboarding. Arrive around 12pm for half price tickets; otherwise get there early. We enjoyed the slopes on skiis and snowboards for 5 hours.

Excellent place to enjoy adult beverages, burgers, salads, and snack.

Love Yosemite.

WOW. the most beaitiful thing ive seen yet. Planet earth is so beautiful. Went on a roadtrip from LA to Sequoia and to Fresno and finally to Yosemite. We saw bears and deer. The creeks were beautiful. We swam and went camping. Perfect for the kids. Very memorable.  It was rainy. Peaceful.

This is a majestic place with epic scenic views. Make sure to get a reservation if you plan on entering after 6am and even if you have a reservation, going too late runs the risk of missing out on parking.

If you are entering from big oak flat entrance, it's a bit confusing. You can easily miss landmarks you plan on seeing while looking for parking. So try to plan ahead. We had to take a shuttle from landmark 7, and it only goes 1 way so we have to do the full tour of stops of 19 landmarks. We were on the shuttle for 50 mins. Now if you don't have a baby and it's not hot you can easily walk from one landmark to the next.

30 bucks to get it, bridalveil falls and glacier point are both closed for 2022 season.

The hype is real! This is the gem of California! This is a must see national park. I suggest visiting in winter when it’s not crowded. It’s really beautiful! To truly experience the park you need to camp or stay in the lodge. You will want multiple days.
Beautiful scenery. If possible avoid visiting during the summer because of crowds, and in late summer the waterfalls don't have much water, and Yosemite falls can dry up completely.

What an awesome journey through Yosemite it was. Very peaceful and grounding to just  be there. One of the best drives I've taken  through a national park. You could spend the whole day, or an entire week, just exploring the parks landscape. (I just don't see why any human would be leaving trash in the forest or passing other's at 50-60mph through the winding roads. They need more patrol vehicles in the park. Especially when the animals in the park are at risk of getting hit by people in a hurry.)

Such a beautifull place. Treat it kindly. More like being at an outdoor museum than the wild. No matter what the Forest Service says the animals including the bears are basically domesticated..
Still it is a place of unrivaled visual stimulation and sensory delights.  Just be prepared for the crush of humanity

I didn’t visit the entire national park, I only visited the Yosemite Valley. I hiked to the very top of the Nevada Fall and the view was amazing, but by the end of the hike(after I went up and came back down from Nevada Falls), my legs were extremely tired.
By the way, small tip:
Hike up the mountain with the long route, it has no steps, just a long concrete(or whatever material is used) route circling the mountain, then come back down with 6000+ extremely steep steps. If you go up by the steps, you’re likely to give up not even halfway.

Third visit in my lifetime and even more incredible than I remember! My brother from another mother talked me into taking a one day road trip with him and I can’t thank him enough! A beautiful sunny day with oh so blue skies highlighting the yellow leaves of fall. Blessed to see cool water running over the falls and down the Merced River! Stop by the Village Store if you get hungry, forgot to bring something or want souvenirs. If you are looking for the Visitors Center, park at the Village Store and follow the trail behind it as you take a short walk to the Visitors Center where there is no public parking. It was so nice to interact with people from all over the country and find that we truly have much more in common than we realize.

For the first time visitor, this place will gut punch you breathless. As a first time visitor this past January, I cant tell anyone enough about how this HAS to go on your bucket list. There are no words or descriptions that can achieve the sense of beauty and emotion you feel there.
The tunnel view is absolutely breathtaking. The lower falls is a nice little hike but let this flatlander tell you....i live in Florida and am educated in elevation etc. No one can prepare you for the reality of what elevation does to you hiking up these mountains and paths. Just when you think you cant go any further because you are out of shape and trying to get oxygen, you look around and BOOM! You are at the end of the trail and viewing some of the most gorgeous sites you could ever see in your life. Waterfalls, valleys, overlooks...it is one of the very best places I have ever experienced.

Especially for Memorial Day weekend- Make sure u reach at the gate at opening time and no later, its tuff to get parking and the entry takes hours!
The ticket is valid for 7 days!

Yosemite is a masterpiece. We went early (drove in around 8 a.m.) on a Friday and did not encounter major waits. A really enjoyable afternoon surprise that a kind photographer clued us in on was this rainbow event (at Vernal Falls, I believe). It was breathtaking!

Yosemite Nationalpark is the most beautiful place, I've ever been. The trails and valleys, the gorgeous scenery,  the wildlife .... just about absolutely everything this place is mesmerizing. I am in love with it. Go there! And experience it yourself! End of April is perfect by the way  ;)

One of the best looking National Parks they I have ever been to. So many view points that you can take many many memory enriching photos. Go during early spring, not many people and waterfall is still going. Otherwise go during autumn, leaves are changing colour to the better but waterfall generally drys up.

Gorgeous. Beautiful. Mesmerizing. What a place good lord. If you are visiting California you MUST make some time to spend at least two days in Yosemite. I did the full waterfall hike and it was the most challenging I've ever done before, you don't need skill, just a very very strong mindset.

It actully good after i went camp there, the only thing that was hard is is too hard to ge the camp ground, the tickets were sold out in one second, it was too hard to get the ticket, and you have to get the ticket before 5 month(for upper pine), if your new you have to know that if you didnt order before 5 month, you might have to wait for other people to reture their camp ground and then you could buy it! But is only like 40%... :(

All the views are breathtaking. I just went during winter and it looks amazing! There are plenty of EV chargers, at least 12 level-2 at the Lodge.
During winter I strongly recommend ice grips for shoes, very hard to do the trails without them.
I got a fair signal reception from AT&T and T-Mobile all over the park, even in the trails. The Wi-Fi is not reliable.

Waooo.. what an experience.. Yosemite is very beautiful place with all natural beauty everywhere.. every location is just waoo.  We booked a tent cabin in curry village.. its all structured with all the facilities. You can cover all the spots of Yosemite with bike or with free shuttle. Biking or hiking is much fun . The only sad part is the "Drought". Trees are drying.. there is no water in the lakes and rivers.. Yosemite fall also dried now.. very sad to see this natural beauty to be like that. Hope we have some rain and it all restored..

Absolutely impossible to capture the atmosphere in photos or words.

I recently spent 2 weeks in the US, and a day trip to Yosemite National Park was by far the highlight. I could have easily spent 2 weeks here, every corner you turn there's yet another astonishingly unique view.

El Capitan, Giant Sequioa, waterfalls, stunning valleys, I recommend coming at least once in your life.
It is always an incredible experience to visit Yosemite. This is easily one of the most beautiful national parks in the world.
The spring of 2023 has a very high volume of water and many waterfalls are visible. It is very powerful and exciting.
Last trip here was to hike Half Dome. Absolutely gorgeous views, it was an unforgettable experience.

Celebrated my 40th  and my niece's 26th birthday with an epic five day backpack trip around Half Dome, "Highlights of Yosemite".

45 miles, several peaks, multiple alive lashes and rivers, big valleys, stunning burnt and recovering slopes (lots of fireweed blooming), granite overlooks, and so much more.
Great place to visit with family and friends, lot’s to enjoy, trails ,waterfalls, streams. Museum , nature at it’s best. Highly recommend

This is a must see American treasure. Pictures are impressive but just don't do the massive rock valley, trees or vast meadow justice, so humbling. The roads are well maintained, great maps and rangers available. Trails in abundance and so so much from T meadow to mariposa to the massive rock valleys and clear rivers ( swimming permitted). Lots of road construction (9/1/21) and the waits at the gate can be hard to sit through. Recommend getting to the gates not much after 8am  for a smooth entry. If you go to the valley make the most of your sweet time and bring bikes or rent them.

At time of visit there was no water in the falls, but rocks and mountain was a beautiful site. The waking trails were very good and should not be missed. Best part of this part of the National park was availability of clean toilets with water and nearby Yosemite Lodge for refreshing Starbucks coffee.
